Product: Debt collection
Sub-issue: Notification didn't disclose it was an attempt to collect a debt
Consumer complaint narrative:
Saturday XX/XX/XXXX, I vacated my former apartment at XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX. After vacating and dropping the keys, I verified the status of the apartment was correct and asked to be a part of the apartment survey tour, all was mentioned to be in order. 

On XX/XX/XXXX I received a notice from Genesis Debt Recovery  for {$210.00} USD outstanding debts to XXXX XXXX, a XXXX XXXX. I attempted to contact XXXX but was provided no explanation of the charges I was being held accountable for. The collection agency did not provide an explanation either. 

On XX/XX/XXXX I reached out to XXXX XXXX for a clarification of the charges and a statement was sent, but no explanation of the charges was offered. 

I have not paid the collection for I was never given an explanation of what I was being charged for, I was never contacted by XXXX XXXX by either mail, email of phone about this charged. When I went physically to XXXX XXXX to ask for an explanation in XX/XX/XXXX I was shown out of office and referred to their accounts payable department, I reached out without succes in speaking to a representative. I have never been provided an explanation of the debt. In my view this is a violation of the fair credit reporting act that is damaging my financial credit.
Company: Rowland Avenue Management, Inc. A/KA Columbia Debt Recovery, LLC d/b/a Genesis

Product: Credit card
Sub-issue: Can't use card to make purchases
Consumer complaint narrative:
Today, I decided to purchase a {$890.00} XXXXXXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX from XXXX XXXX. The device was advertised at a XXXX XXXX sale price of {$690.00}. At checkout, XXXX XXXX solicited me for a credit card and advertised that I would receive a XXXX  % credit for future use at the store if approved and the card was used to make my first purchase. I clicked the link in the checkout cart, completed the application, and received approval for {$12000.00} in credit. I returned to the cart and clicked " complete '' but then received a message stating that the card information was " expired ''. I tried XXXX more times and received the same message. I then called the number provided for assistance, thinking XXXX XXXX would be happy to take my order and use the card. Instead, the sales department transferred me to XXXX at XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX. XXXX 's user ID, per her, is XXXX. She told me that I had been approved, but she was unsure about why the card would not work. I asked her to investigate this and she eventually told me that the reason the card would not work is that I had not completed the transaction quickly enough. Looking through my emails and phone history, I deterred that I received an email from XXXX XXXX telling me I was approved for credit at XXXX XXXX. My call history shows that I then called XXXX XXXX number ( XXXX ) at XXXX. This means that XXXX minutes passed between the time they approved me and the time I called for help. She then told me that I probably clicked out of the session? I asked her to confirm if that was the reason my card was being denied and she could not confirm this. She officially did not know, but was only guessing. I did not click other windows or sessions. She then told me that I should call a XXXX XXXX store or go to XXXX and make the order. I told her that the solicitation of credit and offer of promotion for immediate use felt like bait and switch, because now my credit score has been harmed, I was approved, and XXXX XXXX is not allowing me to use the card. She told me I should just call a store. I told her I wanted her to warm transfer me to a store and explain the situation to solve my issue. She then called XXXX XXXX Customer Service, and the rep there explained to both of us that customer service could not use a " card on file '' to place an order and that my only option would be to visit a store. For the second time, XXXX and XXXX XXXX failed to honor the credit they solicited from me, and thus the promotion. They suggested that I wait until the card arrives in the mail and then come back. If I did that, the item I want to order will no longer be discounted for XXXX XXXX. 
I then cancelled the card with XXXX, and am no longer a XXXX XXXX Credit card customer. There are multiple issues here : XXXX ) XXXX XXXX is soliciting credit applications from online customers, approving customers for credit, and then refusing to accept that credit either due to a defective website OR a desire to deny promotional expenses they would incur if the promotions used to solicit credit applications were used. I consider this to be Unfair and Deceptive Acts and Practices as defined by the CFPB. XXXX ) The representatives forced to serve online customers are completely powerless to use cards solicited online? XXXX XXXX is unable to help the same customers. XXXX XXXX should cease promotion and offer of online credit as it is clearly unable and unprepared to ensure it can honor the credit it solicits or correct its own errors and defective website. XXXX ) I was transferred 3 times, and through the entire experience, no one was willing to escalate my concerns or solve my issue. Why are stores " more powerful '' and able to use credit cards that XXXX XXXX has approved, but neither customer service for credit or online orders is enabled to do this? It is illogical, and evidence of a retailer who should invest in the tools it provides its online representatives.

Product: Checking or savings account
Sub-issue: Funds not received from closed account
Consumer complaint narrative:
The funds in that accounts they closed belong to be and all equal about $ XXXX belong to me and no one else, this is why I had contacted XXXX for addtional help. The company that wired the funds on XX/XX/XXXX did contact B of A to unfreeze the account after speaking to me. 


BANK OF AMERICA SENT ME A LETTER STATING THAT THEY WILL NOT SEND ME MY FUNDS. 


I purchased a house from a lady and for many years I had been receiving emails and letters from Attorney XXXX XXXX since XX/XX/XXXX after I purchased his girlfriend 's friend 's home ( XXXX XXXX ) located at XXXX Deloise AveCerritos, CA XXXX I purchased the home as a Seller Finance/wrap around mortgage because at the time I only qualified for $ XXXX and she convinced me that it was best she stood on the loan and that she would help me. We agreed to a high Sales price of {$800000.00} ( close of escrow was XX/XX/XXXX ). The home was only appraised for $ XXXX at the time and an interest rate of 5.99 % which was high considering it was the coronavirus era. I paid the Seller her down payment of {$32000.00} as well as {$4600.00} a month mortgage and property taxes $ XXXX and hazard insurance $ XXXX. Since buying the home, XXXX XXXX ( her family attorney ) had sent me threatening letters telling me he will foreclose on me ( 1 month after buying the home because I told her tenants that were living there that I bought it when I was supposed to keep it a secret. She still had the home listed after I bought it trying to sell it to other people. I was scared so I recorded the deed when she asked me to wait 6 months to record it. I felt something very off about her business practices. XXXX XXXX threatened foreclosure the first year of buying it when I had proof of all payments being made on time as well as bank statements to show for it. Many times he didnt want to accept the proof I was showing and wrote me disgusting and hateful emails harassing me. 



On XX/XX/XXXX, XXXX XXXX sent his girlfriend with whom he lives with in XXXX XXXX, XXXX XXXX to my home and she walked into the home at XXXX at night with XXXX XXXX XXXX the previous owner ) and started yelling at the tenants ( they had tenants they rented to when they sold the home to me ) and told them that they still own the home and that they need to continue to make their rent payments to XXXX XXXX not me-but all this was untrue as i technically owned the home at that point. XXXX XXXX owed them their security deposit and didnt want to give it back. I was truly scared because I was putting my 9 month old baby to sleep and I heard the renters yelling at her saying that she is a fraud because she just rented to them a week ago and then sold the house ( our deal took a few weeks to close so she shouldn't have done that ). The tenants even recorded this conversation so I have the recording saved. I then called the police for walking in unannounced at XXXX ( you dont buy a Home and the previous owner still comes in at night unannounced ), the police asked them to leave and we changed the locks the next day. Then again, XXXX XXXX showed up to my home for no reason on XX/XX/XXXX and stood outside from XXXX and took notes of who was coming in and out of the home and then he took pictures of all of the cars outside and was watching us looking into our windows from the outside. A week after, The water company showed up to the house and was outside turning my water off. I opened the door around XXXX to check the mail and there was a man outside that was shocked to see me. He yelled about XXXX feet away and asked XXXX XXXX, this house isnt empty? I got a call from the owner saying its empty. I told him no, I just bought the house. He then told me he would turn the water back on as the water company is not allowed to turn the water off if someone is living in the home. 



After 6 months of buying the home, XXXX XXXX threatened me saying I had to sell it back to the previous owner since the purchase contract states there's a potential buy back but it would had to be extended if its after 6 months. He e-mailed a check written by his girlfriend in my name in the amount of {$42000.00} on XXXX ( 3 days before the buy back contract expires ). I sent them contracts to see if they can perform on time but they finally gave me a XXXX  officers name on XXXX so I contacted XXXX and they said they can not close escrow in 1 day since they are closed on Saturday/Sunday. It is evident that XXXX XXXX and XXXX XXXX ( whom his girlfriend and him are linked to an investment to this property ) saw that after I bought the house is XX/XX/XXXX saw that the real estate market went up and most likely had a change of XXXX about their sales price of {$800000.00} ( when again the home was only worth about $ XXXX in XXXX ). They became greedy trying to take advantage and its obvious that they tried to change their sales price to $ XXXX when you see the complaint as they finally filed a lawsuit but nothing happened as the attorney yelled at XXXX XXXX in court and he quit while she still owes him $ XXXX. If they wanted to buy back, they needed to close within the 6 month timeframe or at least have some money ( $ XXXX buy back price ) deposited into the escrow account. I asked to receive the money or some type of proof delisted to escrow but when I called escrow they had nothing and said I would take XXXX dates to close the transaction. I gave the attorney XXXX document ( provided proof of email thread ) to close fast out of escrow as they had 3 days ( a weekend ) but they did NOT perform and said theyd only do the transaction this time with an escrow company which was interesting because we never used an escrow company the first time around. 



I cooperated with them on the buy-back sale and gave proof of XXXX documents that I supplied them with to sign for in order to close escrow within the 3 days remaining. They declined to close the sale on time and wanted to close this time with escrow ( the first time we closed without an escrow company. 



In addition, 2 days after purchasing the home from XXXX XXXX, she was still showing the property to potential buyers and telling me that I can not record on the property until 6 months later. She wanted me to refinance the mortgage thats under her name with her but as long as she stays the lien holder which is illegal in the state of California and no loan officer will agree to this. I asked her to stop showing the house and to please take it off XXXX as it had sold and she refused. I had to contact XXXX and show them the purchase contract and deed recorded for them to remove the listing. 



I recorded the deed to protect my asset which was my {$32000.00} down payment, $ XXXX sales price when the home only was worth $ XXXX, a mortgage or {$4600.00}, {$670.00} in monthly property taxes, {$47.00} hazard insurance ; and an interest rate or XXXX  % not including homeowners insurance. 



She also interfered with me refinancing and would not sign the release form to get a payout from the XXXX. She wants $ XXXX or more in her pocket but doesnt understand that XXXX XXXX XXXX has to get approximately $ XXXX from the XXXX. The $ XXXX that shes requesting doesnt go to her directly, it is minus $ XXXX. 



I decided to let her have the home back, escrow contacted her and she told them I no longer want it and if she buys it back its now $ XXXX minus legal fees and property depreciation as well as furniture fees plus gardening. That she never did. 



Thus all of this had led to a lis pendens she filed because it was in escrow. She doesnt want the property she wants around $ XXXX more in what we agreed to on the sales price in XX/XX/XXXX. She even sent me a payout demand for $ XXXX when I only owe approximately $ XXXX ( will attach ). 



All of this has resulted in XXXX XXXX and XXXX XXXX attempt to file litigation, then postpone litigation by falsely accusing me of being in foreclosure which is not the first time it has been since a few days of buying the home. When we were in court they decided to cancel everything and withdraw the lawsuit because they did not want a XXXX XXXX and because she knew she would not win. 



As of XX/XX/XXXX the home was in escrow for $ XXXX and the buyer has their Earnest money deposit of {$26000.00} in escrow. I have spent {$16000.00} in home improvements upon buyers request such as replacing the air vents, the roof, and other minor repairs. Escrow was held up and couldn't close due to her not willing to sign the lien release and XXXX other documents.. Id like to file suit as it seems as theres no other option to sell and get the correct payout. 



Then I tried again to sell on XX/XX/XXXX, it was in escrow that day for $ XXXX with $ XXXX in credit for repairs to the buyer. And yet again, she was unwilling to sign the XXXX necessary papers escrow was asking her for. She hed up escrow for 2 months and said that she needs the money in her hands and then she will sign all the necessary documents needed. XXXX told her it doesnt work that way.She stated Wire me the $ XXXX and I will handle the rest of the paperwork after the money is in my bank account. It's apparent I have been dealing with someone not normal over the past few years. 



A demand letter was sent XX/XX/XXXX to XXXX XXXX to no avail. 



I was in a XXXX escrow for myself ( replacement home ) and they threatened to keep my earnest money deposit of {$27000.00} because I couldn't close on it as I needed a small amount of funds from the departing residence in order to have enough down payment. Thankfully I was still able to close on my home now, the lender adjusted my down payment. 



Then in XX/XX/XXXX, I am tired and I would love to sell this home because the whole situation is awful, evil, and toxic. But how can I sell it when she won't sign the lien release? 



I have made XXXX payments and I owed a [ proximately $ XXXX on my home. My last payment I made was XX/XX/XXXX. 



I also tried to refinance the home in XX/XX/XXXX with lender XXXX XXXX to get her off the loan and to have a clean title and she told the lender to ( excuse this language but ) XXXXXXXX XXXX  is what she told him, she was really evil and awful. 



She even sent a wrong " balloon payment '' to me less than a year from purchasing the home with the wrong amount owed. See attached. 



She even fraudulently tried to charge me for gardening fees when there was no gardener at the time and I hired my own. She is trying to charge me $ XXXX for XXXX furniture that I begged her to pick up and sent her a letter to pick it up in 30 days as well as other things we did not agree to such as interest fees, etc. 



She is unfortunately a criminal and most likely saw me as a young single mom, I dont typically have a victim mentally but when you see the attachments you will see why I feel targeted by her. I will attach everything I have as proof. I have XXXX Exhibits but I am only sending XXXX attachements so I do not burden you. I am so tired. So many people know of the situation and even the buyer 's agent on XXXX of the transactions said they are going to complain to the lender so I am not shocked that XXXX XXXX accelerated the loan and I sold MY house. She finally agreed and signed all paperwork in escrow because the lender called her out for all of her wrong doings and they threatened to criminalize her, I have this letter as well. I have been a target and a threat since I met her and bought my home in XX/XX/XXXX. This person is unethical and is not to be trusted. 



Please mail my money back to me in a form of a cashiers check. I have recorded XXXX conversation with Bank of America when I called and all reps certainly informed me that my checks
Company public response: Company has responded to the consumer and the CFPB and chooses not to provide a public response

Product: Credit reporting or other personal consumer reports
Sub-issue: Reporting company used your report improperly
Consumer complaint narrative:
Subject : Violation of Consumer Protection Laws : CFPB Failure to Enforce Statutory Rights Against XXXX, EXP, and XXXX I am submitting a formal complaint against the Consumer Protection Bureau ( CFPB ) for failing to enforce federal consumer protection laws against XXXX ( XXXX ), Experian ( EXP ), & XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX ( XXXX ), despite multiple complaints regarding unauthorized reporting of my personal information. 
Background : As a federally protected consumer, I have the right to ensure my personal information is handled per federal laws. However, XXXX, EXP, & XXXX have reported an account without my consent, violating my statutory rights. I have repeatedly requested proof of consent to this reporting, but none have provided such proof. Despite contacting the CFPB, no enforcement action was taken. 
Jurisdiction of CFPB Over CRAs : The CFPB has direct jurisdiction over CRAs such as XXXX, EXP, and financial institutions like XXXX ( 15 U.S.C. 6805 ). The CFPB is responsible for enforcing compliance with FCRA, GLBA, and the Privacy Act of 1974. These laws ensure CRAs protect consumers nonpublic personal information and maintain accurate reporting.

Failure of CFPB to Enforce Permissible Purpose Laws : Despite the CFPB 's statutory duty, it has failed to enforce 15 U.S.C. 1681b, which mandates that consumer information can only be reported with written consumer consent or for permissible purposes. I have repeatedly requested proof of my consent to this reporting, but no such proof has been provided. The CFPB has not taken the necessary action to stop these unlawful practices.

Failure to Enforce Opt-Out Rights : Under 16 C.F.R. 313.7, I have the right to opt out of nonpublic information being shared with third parties. Despite this, XXXX, EXP, & XXXX continue to report my information without offering me an option to opt out, violating 15 U.S.C. 6802. The CFPB has ignored its responsibility to enforce these protections, allowing these companies to continue violating my rights.

CFPBs Role in Protecting Consumer Rights : Per 15 U.S.C. 6801 ( GLBA ), financial institutions and CRAs must protect the confidentiality of nonpublic personal informationXXXX XXXX, EXP, & XXXX have failed to comply, reporting my information without proper consent. The CFPB, responsible for overseeing and enforcing this protection, has neglected its responsibility to act. 
Violation of Privacy Act of 1974 : The Privacy Act of 1974 ( 5 U.S.C. 552a ) ensures that personal information, including SSNs, is handled with strict confidentiality. XXXX, EXP & XXXX have reported my SSN without my consent, violating this federal law. The CFPB has failed to enforce the Privacy Act, allowing these companies to breach my privacy rights. 
Precedent and Accountability : In similar cases, such as FTC XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXXXXXX, courts have ruled that CRAs and financial institutions must comply with federal laws. The CFPB has the legal obligation to enforce such rulings. Failure to do so not only disregards federal statutes but also sets a dangerous precedent for future violations. 
Harm and Urgency : These unlawful reporting practices have caused significant financial and emotional harm, including a decline in my credit score, denial of credit, and continued privacy violations. This issue has been ongoing since XXXX, and immediate action is necessary to prevent further damage. 
Company Policies Do Not Supersede Federal Law : When I contacted XXXX, EXP, & XXXX regarding this issue, they claimed their policies allowed them to report my information without consent and that the laws protecting my opt-out rights do not apply. This is untrue. Federal laws such as the FCRA, GLBA, and the Privacy Act supersede internal policies. The CFPBs failure to act allows these companies to continue violating my rights. 
Breach of Statutory Duty : The CFPB has a legal responsibility to enforce consumer protection laws. By neglecting its duty to act against the violations committed by XXXX, EXP, & XXXX, the CFPB has breached its statutory duty under federal law. This breach allows ongoing harm to consumers, undermining the integrity of these legal protections. 
CFPBs Inaction and Breach of Duty : The CFPB, mandated by Congress to enforce these laws, has failed in its duty. Should the CFPB continue to fail in enforcing these laws, I will explore additional legal remedies to compel enforcement and protect my rights. I reserve the right to escalate this issue to congressional representatives for oversight and raise public awareness through consumer protection groups and media channels. 
Conclusion : The CFPBs failure to act has allowed XXXX, EXP, & XXXX to continue violating federal consumer protection laws. I am formally requesting the CFPB immediately enforce the relevant statutes, cease the continued reporting of my information, and impose the necessary sanctions. If the CFPB fails to take immediate action, I will pursue further steps, including legal action and escalating this issue to Congress and the public. See CFPB complaint # XXXX the last time these issues were brought to your attention and the policies not enforced. At that time it appears that the CFPB was engaging in an abrogation of responsibility. I trust that this will not be the case in this instance, as I expect the CFPB to fulfill its mandated duties. Should the CFPB fail to take appropriate action, I will pursue all available avenues to ensure accountability and enforcement of my rights under federal law.

Consumer complaint narrative:
Subject : Failure to Provide Proper Validation and Verification of Disputed Credit Report Items Dear CFPB, I am filing this complaint to address the failure of both XXXX and certain collection agencies to provide the required validation and verification documentation for several accounts I disputed. Despite my attempts to resolve these disputes through the proper channels, I was not provided with the appropriate validation of these debts, as required under the Fair Credit Reporting Act ( FCRA ) and the Fair Debt Collection Practices Act ( FDCPA ). 

Details of the Complaint : 1. Collection Agency : XXXX XXXX Account Number : XXXX Original Creditor : Progressive Original Amount : {$290.00} Dispute Outcome : Verified as accurate, but no supporting validation or verification documents were provided. 
Despite my dispute, I was informed that this account " belongs to me '' without any proof, such as a signed contract or a detailed statement outlining the debt. 
2. Collection Agency : Sequoia XXXX XXXX. 
Account Numbers : XXXX, XXXX, XXXX Original Creditor : XXXX XXXX XXXXXXXX. 
Original Amounts : {$40.00}, {$130.00}, {$39.00} ( balance amounts updated to {$49.00}, {$170.00}, and {$53.00}, respectively ) Dispute Outcome : Verified as accurate, with some fields updated, but no supporting validation documents were provided. These utility accounts were reported as being delinquent, but the collection agency failed to provide any original agreements, billing details, or verification showing that I owe these amounts. 
3. Deletion of Items by XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX 
Account Numbers : XXXX and XXXX Dispute Outcome : These items were deleted after investigation, which implies that these debts were likely unverifiable. 
While this is a step in the right direction, it further demonstrates the overall lack of diligence in verifying the accuracy of items on my credit report. 
My Complaint : In each of these cases, I requested proper validation and verification of the debts in accordance with my rights under the FCRA and FDCPA. However, I was not provided with any documentation proving the validity of the debts, such as : Original contracts or signed agreements. 
Billing statements showing the origin of the debt and the amounts. 
Proof that these debts were legitimately assigned or sold to the collection agencies. 
Instead, the reporting agencies and collection agencies merely " verified '' the debts without offering any tangible proof or explanation. This practice violates my rights as a consumer to verify the accuracy of debts that are negatively impacting my credit report. 

Action Requested : I request that the CFPB : Investigate the failure of XXXX, XXXX XXXX, and Sequoia XXXX XXXX to provide the required validation and verification documentation. 
Ensure that these disputed items are either validated with proper documentation or removed from my credit report. 
Provide any remedies available under the FCRA and FDCPA for non-compliance, including removing unverifiable accounts from my report. 
I have attached a copy of the dispute results from XXXX for your reference. 

Thank you for your time and attention to this matter. Please feel free to contact me if additional information or documentation is required. 

Sincerely, XXXX XXXX XXXX Address : XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX, XXXX, XXXX  XXXX

Consumer complaint narrative:
XX/XX/XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX, FL XXXX Subject : Request for Reinvestigation and Removal of Inaccurate Information ( 3rd Time ) Reference : Fair Credit Reporting Act ( 15 USC 1681i ( a ) ( 5 ) ( A ) ) Dear CFPB I am writing to formally request a reinvestigation of the following accounts listed in my consumer file, which I believe contain inaccurate information. As per the Fair Credit Reporting Act ( 15 USC 1681i ( a ) ( 5 ) ( A ) ), you are required to follow reasonable procedures to assure maximum possible accuracy of the information concerning me in my consumer file. 
Despite previous disputes, the following accounts continue to reflect incorrect details. I urge you to conduct a thorough and reasonable reinvestigation to determine the accuracy of this information and delete the inaccurate items from my consumer file. 
Account Name/Account Number : XXXXXXXX XXXX XXXXXXXX / [ Account Number XXXX ] Inaccuracy : There are significant discrepancies in the reporting of the account information across different credit bureaus, particularly concerning payment history, balance details, and account status. 
Specifics : High Balance : XXXX reports a high balance of {$13000.00}, while Experian reports {$0.00}. This inconsistency suggests that the high balance information has not been accurately updated across bureaus. 
Last Verified Date : XXXX lists the last verified date as XX/XX/XXXX, but Experian does not report a verification date. This lack of consistency indicates that the account verification process may not have been applied uniformly. 
Date of Last Activity : Both XXXX and Experian report the date of last activity as XX/XX/XXXX ; however, the subsequent account activity reported by XXXX suggests ongoing discrepancies. The last activity date should be accurately verified. 
Date Reported : XXXX reports the date as XX/XX/XXXX, while Experian lists it as XX/XX/XXXX. The accurate date reported should be consistent across both bureaus. 
Balance Owed : Both XXXX and Experian show a balance owed of {$0.00}, but the payment history and account status suggest discrepancies in how this account was closed or charged off. This needs to be verified and corrected. 
Closed Date : XXXX reports a closed date of XX/XX/XXXX, but Experian does not provide a closed date. The closed date should be consistent and accurate across all reports. 
Account Status : Both bureaus report the account as " Paid, '' but XXXX includes the remark " Payment after charge off/collection '' and " Canceled by credit grantor, '' while Experian states, " Account has been closed due to inactivity '' and " Unpaid balance reported as a loss by credit grantor. '' These differences in status and remarks should be reconciled and accurately reflected in all reports. 
Payment History : Experian reports delinquencies ( 30 days late in March 2024, 60 days late in XXXX and XX/XX/XXXX, etc. ), while XXXX shows no late payments reported. This discrepancy in payment history should be thoroughly investigated and corrected. 
Days Late - 7 Year History : XXXX reports no late payments, while Experian reports late payments in multiple months. This inconsistency must be addressed to ensure the accurate reporting of the payment history. 

Action Requested : Please conduct a comprehensive reinvestigation to ensure that all details, including the high balance, payment history, account status, and remarks, are accurately and consistently reported across all three credit bureaus. Any inaccuracies or inconsistencies should be corrected or deleted from my consumer file as required by the Fair Credit Reporting Act. 
You have 15 days from the receipt of this letter to conduct a reasonable investigation and rectify the inaccuracies as required by law. I expect all necessary changes to be made to my consumer file and for these changes to be forwarded to me at the address provided above. 
Please consider this my formal request for a reinvestigation and ensure that the inaccuracies are corrected promptly. I look forward to receiving confirmation of the changes made to my file. 
Thank you for your prompt attention to this matter. 
Sincerely, XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX

I am writing to this company the 8th time to dispute the unauthorized furnishing of my personal credit information by your company. According to my recent credit report, there are entries that I did not authorize and which I believe are in violation of my rights under the Fair Credit Reporting Act ( FCRA ). This is the 7 letter and dispute I have sent to this creditor along with my police report, FTC report, and supporting identity documents verifying my identity. I indicated in all my letters and police report that I am indeed a victim of identity theft, and this creditors violating my consumer rights and not protecting me as an American consumer according to the stated laws. This is my 7th notice to this company notifying you guys that these listed accounts are fraud. My information isnt protected, and this creditor/company isnt honoring my identity theft claim. I am now pursuing litigation, I am suing this credit company, for AGGRAVATED IDENTITY THEFT, ILLEGALLY FURNISHING FRAUD ACCOUNTS ON MY CREDIT PROFILE, PAIN AND SUFFERING, AND DEFAMATION OF CHARACTER. This company did not honor my consumer rights as a citizen in America regarding my consumer credit file, this company ignored not 1, but 7 documented and certified complaints and letters regarding my identity being compromised. Under stated consumer rights law this company didnt protect, honor, or respect my claim and rights. I provided evidence, police reports, FTC reports, and supporting valid identity documents to verify myself throughout this 6-month process. This company did not honor my rights or acknowledge my supporting documents regarding identity theft. I was incarcerated for 10 years with proof when all these accounts were open illegally and fraudulently and Ive proven this matter and will prove it in court without a doubt. 

I DID NOT OPEN OR AUTHORIZE THESE ACCOUNTS, NOR WAS I INVOLVED IN ANY TRANSACTIONS ASSOCIATED WITH THESE ACCOUNTS. UNDER 18 U.S. CODE 1028 ( AGGRAVATED IDENTITY THEFT ), THE USE OF MY IDENTITY WITHOUT MY KNOWLEDGE OR CONSENT TO COMMIT FRAUDULENT ACTIVITY IS A SERIOUS FEDERAL CRIME. THIS COMPANY IS CONTINUING TO COMMIT A CRIME BY FUNISHING AND REPORTING ACCOUNTS UTILIZING MY IDENTITY WITHOUT MY CONSENT AFTER I MADE THIS COMPANY AWARE OF THE FRAUD, AND IDENTITY THEFT. THIS COMPANY BY LAW IS IN VIOLATION OF MY RIGHTS, AND THIS COMPANY IS A SUSPECT IN THIS IDENTITY THEFT CASE.

15 U.S.C. 1681 et seq., governs access to consumer credit report records and promotes accuracy, fairness, and the privacy of personal information assembled by Credit Reporting Agencies ( CRAs ). 

XXXX has suffered a handful of data breach incidents over the past 18 months, including a XXXX incident in which hackers obtained the personal information of up to XXXX XXXX individuals Five years ago, a massive data breach occurred. On XXXX XXXX, XXXX, the XXXX credit bureau publicly revealed its computer networks had suffered a data leak that exposed the personal information of XXXX XXXX consumers, a number later raised to XXXX XXXX. That data included consumers names, addresses, dates of birth, Social Security numbers and credit card numbers all of which could lead to identity fraud and other financial crimes. 

Experian, one of the leading global information services groups, experienced a significant data breach in XX/XX/XXXX. This breach exposed the personal information of millions of consumers due to unauthorized access to data from a server that contained information for clients, including XXXX The incident was particularly concerning due to the nature of Experian 's business, which involves handling sensitive personal credit information.

Product: Credit reporting or other personal consumer reports
Issue: Problem with a company's investigation into an existing problem
Sub-issue: Their investigation did not fix an error on your report
Consumer complaint narrative:
I have been disputing this account for XXXX  regarding the repeated charge-off that appears on my account each month. I have asked them to validate the debt by sending me a purchase agreement, assignment contract, or something displaying my wet signature showing that this alleged debt is mine. 
Debt Validation Request under 15 U.S.C. 1692g ( FDCPA ) Verification Request : Pursuant to my rights under 15 U.S.C. 1692g, I am requesting that you provide the following information : 1. The Amount of the Debt : A detailed accounting of the debt, including the principal, interest, fees, and any other charges that have been applied.

2. The Name of the Creditor to Whom the Debt is Currently Owed : Including the name and address of the original creditor if different from the current creditor.

3. Verification of the Debt : A copy of the judgment ( if applicable ) or other documents showing that I am indeed legally obligated to pay this debt.

4. Proof of Your Legal Right to Collect the Debt : Documentation that you are authorized to collect this debt on behalf of the creditor.

5. Complete Payment History : Showing how the amount claimed was calculated and all transactions related to the debt.

According to the Fair Credit Reporting Act ( FCRA ), specifically sections 607 ( b ) ( 15 U.S.C. 1681e ( b ) ), 623 ( a ) ( 1 ) ( A ) ( 15 U.S.C. 1681s-2 ( a ) ( 1 ) ( A ) ), and 623 ( a ) ( 2 ) ( 15 U.S.C. 1681s-2 ( a ) ( 2 ) ), information furnished to consumer reporting agencies must be accurate and complete. A charge-off should not be reported each month as a new charge-off ; instead, the status should reflect the original charge-off date and not be reported repeatedly as if it were a new event.

This by this action being taking each month it affects my credit score, credit report, and credit worthiness.

Product: Credit reporting or other personal consumer reports
Issue: Problem with a company's investigation into an existing problem
Sub-issue: Their investigation did not fix an error on your report
Consumer complaint narrative:
Subject : Failure to Provide Proper Validation and Verification of Disputed Credit Report Items Dear CFPB, I am filing this complaint to address the failure of both XXXX and certain collection agencies to provide the required validation and verification documentation for several accounts I disputed. Despite my attempts to resolve these disputes through the proper channels, I was not provided with the appropriate validation of these debts, as required under the Fair Credit Reporting Act ( FCRA ) and the Fair Debt Collection Practices Act ( FDCPA ). 

Details of the Complaint : 1. Collection Agency : XXXX XXXX Account Number : XXXX Original Creditor : Progressive Original Amount : {$290.00} Dispute Outcome : Verified as accurate, but no supporting validation or verification documents were provided. 
Despite my dispute, I was informed that this account " belongs to me '' without any proof, such as a signed contract or a detailed statement outlining the debt. 
2. Collection Agency : XXXX XXXX XXXX. 
Account Numbers : XXXX, XXXX, XXXX Original Creditor : XXXX XXXX XXXXXXXX. 
Original Amounts : {$40.00}, {$130.00}, {$39.00} ( balance amounts updated to {$49.00}, {$170.00}, and {$53.00}, respectively ) Dispute Outcome : Verified as accurate, with some fields updated, but no supporting validation documents were provided. These utility accounts were reported as being delinquent, but the collection agency failed to provide any original agreements, billing details, or verification showing that I owe these amounts. 
XXXX. Deletion of Items by XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX 
Account Numbers : XXXX and XXXX Dispute Outcome : These items were deleted after investigation, which implies that these debts were likely unverifiable. 
While this is a step in the right direction, it further demonstrates the overall lack of diligence in verifying the accuracy of items on my credit report. 
My Complaint : In each of these cases, I requested proper validation and verification of the debts in accordance with my rights under the FCRA and FDCPA. However, I was not provided with any documentation proving the validity of the debts, such as : Original contracts or signed agreements. 
Billing statements showing the origin of the debt and the amounts. 
Proof that these debts were legitimately assigned or sold to the collection agencies.

XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX MN XXXX XXXX XXXX XX/XX/2024 Consumer Financial Protection Bureau XXXX XXXX XXXX, XXXX XXXX XXXXXXXX Subject : Pre-Arbitration Notice Regarding Incorrect Reporting of Late Payments Dear Consumer Financial Protection Bureau, I am writing to formally dispute the inaccurate reporting of late payments on my credit report under the Fair Credit Reporting Act ( FCRA ), specifically under sections 15 U.S.C. 1681 and 15 U.S.C. 1666b. 

I have recently reviewed my credit report and noticed that several accounts are reflecting late payments that I believe are inaccurate. As you are well aware, the FCRA mandates that all information on a credit report must be both fair and accurate. Incorrect reporting of late payments can have severe and long-lasting impacts on my credit score, potentially affecting my ability to secure loans, credit, housing, and even employment. 

It is crucial to me that my credit report accurately reflects my payment history. I am requesting an immediate investigation and correction of these inaccuracies. Enclosed are copies of supporting documents that substantiate my claim that these late payments were either inaccurately reported or never occurred. 

If this matter is not resolved promptly, I will have no choice but to pursue legal action to protect my rights under the FCRA. This could include filing a lawsuit to seek damages, legal costs, and attorney fees as permitted under the law. 

To provide clarity on the potential legal costs, here is a breakdown : Attorney Fees : Depending on the complexity of the case, attorney fees could range from {$200.00} to {$500.00} per hour. In a straightforward case, this could amount to {$2000.00} to {$10000.00}. 
Court Filing Fees : Filing a lawsuit typically incurs a fee ranging from {$100.00} to {$500.00}, depending on the jurisdiction. 
Other Legal Costs : Additional costs such as deposition fees, expert witness fees, and other litigation expenses could add another {$1000.00} to {$5000.00} to the total cost. 
I hope we can avoid these unnecessary costs by resolving this matter promptly. Please confirm the receipt of this letter and initiate the investigation into my dispute. I expect a timely response as outlined in the FCRA, and I look forward to a fair resolution. 

Thank you for your immediate attention to this important matter. 

Sincerely, XXXX XXXX XXXX

Product: Credit reporting or other personal consumer reports
Sub-issue: Reporting company used your report improperly
Consumer complaint narrative:
Subject : Violation of Consumer Protection Laws : CFPB Failure to Enforce Statutory Rights Against EXQ, XXXX, and XXXX I am submitting a formal complaint against the Consumer Protection Bureau ( CFPB ) for failing to enforce federal consumer protection laws against Equifax ( EXQ ), XXXXXXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX & XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX ( XXXX ), despite multiple complaints regarding unauthorized reporting of my personal information. 
Background : As a federally protected consumer, I have the right to ensure my personal information is handled per federal laws. However, EXQ, XXXX, & XXXX have reported an account without my consent, violating my statutory rights. I have repeatedly requested proof of consent to this reporting, but none have provided such proof. Despite contacting the CFPB, no enforcement action was taken. 
Jurisdiction of CFPB Over CRAs : The CFPB has direct jurisdiction over CRAs such as EXQ, XXXX, and financial institutions like XXXX ( 15 U.S.C. 6805 ). The CFPB is responsible for enforcing compliance with FCRA, GLBA, and the Privacy Act of 1974. These laws ensure CRAs protect consumers nonpublic personal information and maintain accurate reporting.

Failure of CFPB to Enforce Permissible Purpose Laws : Despite the CFPB 's statutory duty, it has failed to enforce 15 U.S.C. 1681b, which mandates that consumer information can only be reported with written consumer consent or for permissible purposes. I have repeatedly requested proof of my consent to this reporting, but no such proof has been provided. The CFPB has not taken the necessary action to stop these unlawful practices. 
Failure to Enforce Opt-Out Rights : Under 16 C.F.R. 313.7, I have the right to opt out of nonpublic information being shared with third parties. Despite this, EXQ, XXXX, & XXXX continue to report my information without offering me an option to opt out, violating 15 U.S.C. 6802. The CFPB has ignored its responsibility to enforce these protections, allowing these companies to continue violating my rights.

CFPBs Role in Protecting Consumer Rights : Per 15 U.S.C. 6801 ( GLBA ), financial institutions and CRAs must protect the confidentiality of nonpublic personal information. EXQ, XXXX, & XXXX have failed to comply, reporting my information without proper consent. The CFPB, responsible for overseeing and enforcing this protection, has neglected its responsibility to act. 
Violation of Privacy Act of 1974 : The Privacy Act of 1974 ( 5 U.S.C. 552a ) ensures that personal information, including SSNs, is handled with strict confidentiality. EXQ, XXXX & XXXX have reported my SSN without my consent, violating this federal law. The CFPB has failed to enforce the Privacy Act, allowing these companies to breach my privacy rights. 
Precedent and Accountability : In similar cases, such as FTC v. XXXX XXXX XXXX, courts have ruled that CRAs and financial institutions must comply with federal laws. The CFPB has the legal obligation to enforce such rulings. Failure to do so not only disregards federal statutes but also sets a dangerous precedent for future violations. 
Harm and Urgency : These unlawful reporting practices have caused significant financial and emotional harm, including a decline in my credit score, denial of credit, and continued privacy violations. This issue has been ongoing since XXXX, and immediate action is necessary to prevent further damage. 
Company Policies Do Not Supersede Federal Law : When I contacted EXQ, XXXX, & XXXX regarding this issue, they claimed their policies allowed them to report my information without consent and that the laws protecting my opt-out rights do not apply. This is untrue. Federal laws such as the FCRA, GLBA, and the Privacy Act supersede internal policies. The CFPBs failure to act allows these companies to continue violating my rights. 
Breach of Statutory Duty : The CFPB has a legal responsibility to enforce consumer protection laws. By neglecting its duty to act against the violations committed by EXQ, XXXX, & XXXX, the CFPB has breached its statutory duty under federal law. This breach allows ongoing harm to consumers, undermining the integrity of these legal protections. 
CFPBs Inaction and Breach of Duty : The CFPB, mandated by Congress to enforce these laws, has failed in its duty. Should the CFPB continue to fail in enforcing these laws, I will explore additional legal remedies to compel enforcement and protect my rights. I reserve the right to escalate this issue to congressional representatives for oversight and raise public awareness through consumer protection groups and media channels. 
Conclusion : The CFPBs failure to act has allowed EXQ, XXXX, & XXXX to continue violating federal consumer protection laws. I am formally requesting the CFPB immediately enforce the relevant statutes, cease the continued reporting of my information, and impose the necessary sanctions. If the CFPB fails to take immediate action, I will pursue further steps, including legal action and escalating this issue to Congress and the public. See CFPB complaint # XXXX the last time these issues were brought to your attention and the policies not enforced. At that time it appears that the CFPB was engaging in an abrogation of responsibility. I trust that this will not be the case in this instance, as I expect the CFPB to fulfill its mandated duties. Should the CFPB fail to take appropriate action, I will pursue all available avenues to ensure accountability and enforcement of my rights under federal law.

Product: Credit reporting or other personal consumer reports
Issue: Problem with a company's investigation into an existing problem
Sub-issue: Problem with personal statement of dispute
Consumer complaint narrative:
I recently received a debt collection notice from your office. I am writing to verify that you have contacted the correct individual and to request that you provide documentation confirming this. Please supply me with a copy of any contract or agreement signed with your company or the original creditor. 

In Accordance, with the Fair Debt Collection Practices Act ( FDCPA ), I request the following information : 1. The name and address of the original creditor and the current creditor.

2. Verification of the debt amount you are seeking to collect, including evidence that a contract exists creating the amount you claim is owed.

3. Documentation of all assignments showing the transfer of the debt from the original creditor to the current creditor.

4. Proof that the original creditor securitized the debt.

5. Documentation showing the assignments of the debt from the original creditor to the secured trust and then back to the original creditor.

Please cease and desist from collecting on this debt until you have provided validation of the debt.

Additionally, I request that you do not access my credit report or report anything to my credit bureaus. I dispute the validity of this debt amount, and this dispute should be reflected on my credit report if you have already reported this debt.

Please state your permissible purpose for accessing my credit information. I dispute your right to do so.

I dispute that I owe this debt to you. Should you transfer this debt to another collector, please inform them of my dispute regarding the validity of this debt.Thank you for your prompt attention to this matter.

Product: Credit reporting or other personal consumer reports
Issue: Problem with a company's investigation into an existing problem
Sub-issue: Their investigation did not fix an error on your report
Consumer complaint narrative:
I have been disputing this account for XXXX  regarding the repeated charge-off that appears on my account each month. I have asked them to validate the debt by sending me a purchase agreement, assignment contract, or something displaying my wet signature showing that this alleged debt is mine. 
Debt Validation Request under 15 U.S.C. 1692g ( FDCPA ) Verification Request : Pursuant to my rights under 15 U.S.C. 1692g, I am requesting that you provide the following information : 1. The Amount of the Debt : A detailed accounting of the debt, including the principal, interest, fees, and any other charges that have been applied.

2. The Name of the Creditor to Whom the Debt is Currently Owed : Including the name and address of the original creditor if different from the current creditor.

3. Verification of the Debt : A copy of the judgment ( if applicable ) or other documents showing that I am indeed legally obligated to pay this debt.

4. Proof of Your Legal Right to Collect the Debt : Documentation that you are authorized to collect this debt on behalf of the creditor.

5. Complete Payment History : Showing how the amount claimed was calculated and all transactions related to the debt. 
According to the Fair Credit Reporting Act ( FCRA ), specifically sections 607 ( b ) ( 15 U.S.C. 1681e ( b ) ), 623 ( a ) ( 1 ) ( A ) ( 15 U.S.C. 1681s-2 ( a ) ( 1 ) ( A ) ), and 623 ( a ) ( 2 ) ( 15 U.S.C. 1681s-2 ( a ) ( 2 ) ), information furnished to consumer reporting agencies must be accurate and complete. A charge-off should not be reported each month as a new charge-off ; instead, the status should reflect the original charge-off date and not be reported repeatedly as if it were a new event.

This action being taken each month it affects my credit score, credit report, and creditworthiness.

Consumer complaint narrative:
I am writing to dispute the unauthorized furnishing of my personal credit information by your CREDIT BUREAU. According to my recent credit report, there are entries that I did not authorize and which I know are in violation of my rights under the Fair Credit Reporting Act ( FCRA ). This is the 7th letter and dispute I have sent to this COMPANY along with my police report, FTC report, and supporting identity documents verifying my identity. I indicated in all my letters and police report that I am indeed a victim of identity theft, and this CREDIT BUREAU is violating my consumer rights and not protecting me as an American Consumer according to the stated laws. This is my 7th notice to this BUREAU notifying you guys that these listed accounts were opened fraudulently. My information isnt protected, and this credit bureau isnt honoring my identity theft claim. Ive started legal litigation and will be suing this CREDIT BUREAU ; this company did not honor my rights or acknowledge my supporting documents regarding identity theft. These accounts were open illegally and fraudulently and Ive proven this matter and will prove it in court without a doubt, I am suing for my rights being violated, pain and suffering, false allegations from this CREDIT BUREAU, and assisting to furnish a wrong, and fraudulent accounts. I demanded these accounts be removed, and my legal rights, and laws be honored, and this CREDIT BUREAU DIDNT HONOR MY CONSUMER RIGHTS. THIS ACT IS PUNISHABLE BY LAW BECAUSE THIS CREDIT BUREAR IS ADDING AND ASSISTING IN AGGRAVATED IDENTITY THEFT. 


THESE PEOPLE CREATED FAKE DOCUMENTS TO OPEN AND OBTAIN CREDIT CARDS, LOANS AND LEASES IN MY NAME. THESE INDIVIDUALS OBTAINED MY INFORMATION FROM MY ENTIRE WALLET BEING STOLEN, EVER SINCE THEN THESE CRIMINALS HAVE BEEN USING MY IDENTITY INFOROMATION TO OPEN UP CREDIT CARD ACCOUNTS AND CAR LOAN ACCOUNTS. 


My identity has been stolen and compromised ; this is the 6th notice I have sent this company with all supporting evidence and documentation. I will be suing for assisting and adding in the opening account, and furnishing fraudulent data on my consumer credit report, this company did not take the proper steps to help protect my consumer report and properly investigate this matter. 


Specifically, I refer to the following accounts : FRAUDULENT ACCOUNTS : XXXX XXXX : BALANCE {$12000.00} ACCOUNT # XXXX

Product: Credit reporting or other personal consumer reports
Issue: Problem with a company's investigation into an existing problem
Sub-issue: Their investigation did not fix an error on your report
Consumer complaint narrative:
XXXX XXXX Account Number : XXXX I have never been late on this account, despite the company claiming otherwise. I have submitted proof that Ive always made my payments on time, but the company has ignored my evidence. Additionally, how can the company report me as late in XX/XX/2023, but not in the previous month or the following month? All other months show on-time payments. This discrepancy needs to be properly investigated. This account needs to reflect on-time payments only, as I have never been late. Please update and correct this information accordingly. 

XXXX Account Number : XXXX This account was never properly investigated, as there are no remarks on my credit report indicating that the bureau ever conducted an investigation, yet the information was marked as 'verified. ' How could you verify something that was never investigated? I request that this account be thoroughly investigated. If you can not verify this account, I ask that it be removed from my credit report immediately. 

XXXX XXXX Account Number : XXXX This account is showing as a charge-off but is still reflecting a balance, which constitutes a violation. Furthermore, this account was never investigated after I requested proof of its accurate reporting and validation of the debt. I have not received any response to my request for validation. I request that this issue be addressed immediately. 

I am requesting validation and verification for each account listed below. If your company or the original creditor can not provide verification or burden of proof, I request that these accounts be removed from my credit report immediately. Additionally, please remove any personal information that is outdated, old, or inaccurately reported from my credit report as well. 

Additional Accounts Listed Below : XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX If a company is claiming that I was late on payments, please provide proof of where and when these late payments occurred. I request a complete list of my payments and transaction history, including the date when I first became delinquent. If you are unable to provide this information, I ask that any and all late payments be removed from my credit report. 

Furthermore, I urge the Consumer Financial Protection Bureau ( CFPB ) to investigate the bureaus ' failure to properly investigate these accounts. It is crucial that the CFPB takes appropriate action to ensure compliance with investigation requirements and address these reporting discrepancies. 

Thank you for your attention to this matter.

Product: Credit reporting or other personal consumer reports
Issue: Problem with a company's investigation into an existing problem
Consumer complaint narrative:
In accordance with the Fair Credit Reporting act. The List of accounts below has violated my federally protected consumer rights to privacy and confidentiality under 15 USC 1681.

15 U.S.C 1681 section 602 A. States I have the right to privacy.

15 U.S.C 1681 Section 604 A Section 2 : It also states a consumer reporting agency can not furnish a account without my written instructions 15 U.S.C 1681c. ( a ) ( 5 ) Section States : no consumer reporting agency may make any consumer report containing any of the following items of information Any other adverse item of information, other than records of convictions of crimes which antedates the report by more than seven years.

15 U.S.C. 1681s-2 ( A ) ( 1 ) A person shall not furnish any information relating to a consumer to any consumer reporting agency if the person knows or has reasonable cause to believe that the information is inaccurate.

Sub-issue: Reporting company used your report improperly
Consumer complaint narrative:
XX/XX/year> Re : Debt Validation Request I am writing to you in response to a notice I received regarding an alleged debt claimed to be owed by me. Under the Fair Debt Collection Practices Act ( FDCPA ), I am requesting that you validate this debt. Please provide the following information : 1. **The amount of the debt** : A complete breakdown of the amount owed, including any fees, interest, and principal balance.

2. **The name of the original creditor** : The name and address of the original creditor to whom this debt is owed.

3. **Verification that I owe the debt** : Documentation that verifies I have a contractual obligation to pay this debt, such as a copy of the original signed contract.

4. **Details of the debt assignment** : Proof that your company has the right to collect this debt, including documentation showing the chain of assignment of this debt from the original creditor to your company. 

Until you provide the requested validation, I am disputing this debt and requesting that you cease all collection activities in compliance with the FDCPA. Furthermore, please note that any attempt to report this debt to credit bureaus without proper validation is a violation of federal law and my rights under the FDCPA. 

I request that all future communication regarding this matter be done in writing. 

Thank you for your prompt attention to this matter.

Product: Credit reporting or other personal consumer reports
Consumer complaint narrative:
In XXXX XXXX I became unable to pay my mortgage due to the Pandemic and completed a forbearance application. I also had to file a federal court case against both XXXX and XXXX for breach of contract, Respa Violations, Negligence, and etc. 

I have disputed the inaccurate reporting of my payment history with XXXX, XXXX, Equifax and XXXX, yet these inaccuracies still remail and continue to cause me and my family great financial hardship. 

XXXX are in direct violation of the FCRA and CFPB regulations as they are knowingly reporting inaccurate and inconsistent information about my payment History. I am also attaching a letter received from XXXX confirming Respa violations and misapplication of my payments received and wrongful payment history reported. 

For example, XXXX and Equifax show me as current in XXXX of XXXX ( which I was ) However, XXXX is reporting me as XXXX delinquent for XXXX of XXXX. XXXX is also wrongfully holding a check from my home insurance company to finish the repair of my home as they said that I was not current on my mortgage which I was and I am attaching the letter to prove so. 

Also in XXXX and XXXX of XXXX XXXX and XXXX show me as 30 days delinquent and Equifax is reporting me as 60 days delinquent on each occurence. 

Lastly, when I applied for the forebearance, per the Cares Act, XXXX should have not been reporting negative items to the credit bureaus.

I am under so much stress and financial strain and these negative marks are affecting my ability to get funds to help me take care of my family in my time of need. 

I have disputed these inaccuracies on several occasions with XXXX XXXX XXXX, Equifax, and XXXX. I kindly ask that these negative marks be removed immediately from my credit reports.

Sub-issue: Credit inquiries on your report that you don't recognize

Product: Credit reporting or other personal consumer reports
Issue: Problem with a company's investigation into an existing problem
Sub-issue: Difficulty submitting a dispute or getting information about a dispute over the phone
Consumer complaint narrative:
I am filing a formal complaint against TransUnion LLC for their improper handling of my request to block fraudulent inquiries and their failure to provide adequate assistance in resolving this matter. My name is XXXX XXXX, and my file number is XXXX. 

**Background : ** On XX/XX/year>, I received an unsatisfactory and unsupported response from TransUnion concerning my request to block fraudulent inquiries. TransUnion incorrectly declined to block inquiries made by XXXX ( XX/XX/year> ) and XXXX XXXX XXXXXXXX ( XX/XX/year> ), claiming that the Federal Trade Commission ( FTC ) Identity Theft Report I submitted was not a valid document. This decision is inconsistent with the requirements of the Fair Credit Reporting Act ( FCRA ) and California state laws. 

**Specific Issues : ** 1. **Refusal to Block Fraudulent Inquiries : ** Despite providing a valid FTC Identity Theft Report ( Report Number : XXXX ), which complies with both federal and state laws, TransUnion refused to block the fraudulent inquiries. This refusal violates FCRA Section 605B and California Civil Code 1798.92.

2. **Inadequate Phone Assistance : ** I have attempted to follow up on this issue via phone. During these calls, representatives disconnected the line, refused assistance, and provided misleading information about protocols and procedures. This pattern of behavior has included : - Representatives disconnecting calls without resolution. 
- Misleading statements regarding dispute processes. 
- Refusal to acknowledge or act upon the valid documentation I provided. 

**Violation of Federal and State Laws : ** - **Federal Law ( FCRA, Section 605B ) : ** Under FCRA, TransUnion is obligated to block fraudulent information when provided with a valid FTC Identity Theft Report. Their refusal to comply violates this requirement.

- **California State Law : ** The California Identity Theft Act mandates that credit reporting agencies must promptly investigate and block fraudulent accounts upon receiving proper documentation. TransUnion 's failure to act on the FTC Identity Theft Report contravenes this law as well.

**Details of the Fraudulent Inquiries : ** - **XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX ** - **XXXX XXXX XXXXXXXX XXXX XX/XX/year> ) ** These inquiries were unauthorized and result from identity theft. The continued presence of these inquiries on my credit report is harming my credit standing and financial opportunities. 

**Actions Requested : ** I request the CFPB to intervene and compel TransUnion to : 1. Immediately block the fraudulent inquiries from XXXX and XXXX XXXX XXXXXXXX. 
2. Comply with FCRA Section 605B and California Civil Code 1798.92.

3. Provide a detailed explanation of their investigation methods, including all communications with XXXX, XXXX  XXXX XXXX, and any other relevant parties. 
4. Provide me with an updated credit report reflecting the removal of the fraudulent inquiries. 
5. Ensure that TransUnion ceases further violations of my consumer rights under federal and state laws. 

**Supporting Documentation : ** - FTC Identity Theft Report ( Report Number : XXXX ) - TransUnion Response ( Dated : XX/XX/year> ) - Records of phone calls with TransUnion representatives TransUnions refusal to address my legitimate concerns and their improper handling of my disputes is a clear violation of consumer protection laws. I respectfully request that the CFPB investigate this matter and enforce appropriate actions to protect my rights as a victim of identity theft.
Company public response: Company has responded to the consumer and the CFPB and chooses not to provide a public response

Product: Credit reporting or other personal consumer reports
Issue: Problem with a company's investigation into an existing problem
Consumer complaint narrative:
In accordance with the Fair Credit Reporting act. The List of accounts below has violated my federally protected consumer rights to privacy and confidentiality under 15 USC 1681. 

15 U.S.C 1681 section 602 A. States I have the right to privacy.

15 U.S.C 1681 Section 604 A Section 2 : It also states a consumer reporting agency can not furnish a account without my written instructions 15 U.S.C 1681c. ( a ) ( 5 ) Section States : no consumer reporting agency may make any consumer report containing any of the following items of information Any other adverse item of information, other than records of convictions of crimes which antedates the report by more than seven years.

15 U.S.C. 1681s-2 ( A ) ( 1 ) A person shall not furnish any information relating to a consumer to any consumer reporting agency if the person knows or has reasonable cause to believe that the information is inaccurate.

Product: Credit reporting or other personal consumer reports
Issue: Problem with a company's investigation into an existing problem
Sub-issue: Their investigation did not fix an error on your report
Consumer complaint narrative:
XX/XX/XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX, FL XXXX Subject : Request for Reinvestigation and Removal of Inaccurate Information ( 3rd Time ) Reference : Fair Credit Reporting Act ( 15 USC 1681i ( a ) ( 5 ) ( A ) ) Dear CFPB I am writing to formally request a reinvestigation of the following accounts listed in my consumer file, which I believe contain inaccurate information. As per the Fair Credit Reporting Act ( 15 USC 1681i ( a ) ( 5 ) ( A ) ), you are required to follow reasonable procedures to assure maximum possible accuracy of the information concerning me in my consumer file. 
Despite previous disputes, the following accounts continue to reflect incorrect details. I urge you to conduct a thorough and reasonable reinvestigation to determine the accuracy of this information and delete the inaccurate items from my consumer file. 
Account Name/Account Number : XXXX XXXX XXXXXXXX / [ Account Number XXXX ] Inaccuracy : There are significant discrepancies in the reporting of the account information across different credit bureaus, particularly concerning payment history, balance details, and account status. 
Specifics : High Balance : TXXXX reports a high balance of {$13000.00}, while Experian reports {$0.00}. This inconsistency suggests that the high balance information has not been accurately updated across bureaus. 
Last Verified Date : XXXX lists the last verified date as XX/XX/XXXX, but Experian does not report a verification date. This lack of consistency indicates that the account verification process may not have been applied uniformly. 
Date of Last Activity : Both XXXX and Experian report the date of last activity as XX/XX/XXXX ; however, the subsequent account activity reported by XXXX suggests ongoing discrepancies. The last activity date should be accurately verified. 
Date Reported : XXXX reports the date as XX/XX/XXXX, while Experian lists it as XX/XX/XXXX. The accurate date reported should be consistent across both bureaus. 
XXXX Owed : Both XXXX and Experian show a balance owed of {$0.00}, but the payment history and account status suggest discrepancies in how this account was closed or charged off. This needs to be verified and corrected. 
Closed Date : XXXX reports a closed date of XX/XX/XXXX, but Experian does not provide a closed date. The closed date should be consistent and accurate across all reports. 
Account Status : Both bureaus report the account as " Paid, '' but XXXX includes the remark " Payment after charge off/collection '' and " Canceled by credit grantor, '' while Experian states, " Account has been closed due to inactivity '' and " Unpaid balance reported as a loss by credit grantor. '' These differences in status and remarks should be reconciled and accurately reflected in all reports. 
Payment History : Experian reports delinquencies ( 30 days late in XXXX XXXX, 60 days late in XXXX and XX/XX/XXXX, etc. ), while XXXX shows no late payments reported. This discrepancy in payment history should be thoroughly investigated and corrected. 
Days Late - 7 Year History : XXXX reports no late payments, while Experian reports late payments in multiple months. This inconsistency must be addressed to ensure the accurate reporting of the payment history. 

Action Requested : Please conduct a comprehensive reinvestigation to ensure that all details, including the high balance, payment history, account status, and remarks, are accurately and consistently reported across all three credit bureaus. Any inaccuracies or inconsistencies should be corrected or deleted from my consumer file as required by the Fair Credit Reporting Act. 
You have 15 days from the receipt of this letter to conduct a reasonable investigation and rectify the inaccuracies as required by law. I expect all necessary changes to be made to my consumer file and for these changes to be forwarded to me at the address provided above. 
Please consider this my formal request for a reinvestigation and ensure that the inaccuracies are corrected promptly. I look forward to receiving confirmation of the changes made to my file. 
Thank you for your prompt attention to this matter. 
Sincerely, XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX

Product: Credit reporting or other personal consumer reports
Issue: Problem with a company's investigation into an existing problem
Sub-issue: Their investigation did not fix an error on your report
Consumer complaint narrative:
I have been disputing this account for XXXX  regarding the repeated charge-off that appears on my account each month. I have asked them to validate the debt by sending me a purchase agreement, assignment contract, or something displaying my wet signature showing that this alleged debt is mine.

Debt Validation Request under 15 U.S.C. 1692g ( FDCPA ) Verification Request : Pursuant to my rights under 15 U.S.C. 1692g, I am requesting that you provide the following information : 1. The Amount of the Debt : A detailed accounting of the debt, including the principal, interest, fees, and any other charges that have been applied.

2. The Name of the Creditor to Whom the Debt is Currently Owed : Including the name and address of the original creditor if different from the current creditor.

3. Verification of the Debt : A copy of the judgment ( if applicable ) or other documents showing that I am indeed legally obligated to pay this debt.

4. Proof of Your Legal Right to Collect the Debt : Documentation that you are authorized to collect this debt on behalf of the creditor.

5. Complete Payment History : Showing how the amount claimed was calculated and all transactions related to the debt.

According to the Fair Credit Reporting Act ( FCRA ), specifically sections 607 ( b ) ( 15 U.S.C. 1681e ( b ) ), 623 ( a ) ( 1 ) ( A ) ( 15 U.S.C. 1681s-2 ( a ) ( 1 ) ( A ) ), and 623 ( a ) ( 2 ) ( 15 U.S.C. 1681s-2 ( a ) ( 2 ) ), information furnished to consumer reporting agencies must be accurate and complete. A charge-off should not be reported each month as a new charge-off ; instead, the status should reflect the original charge-off date and not be reported repeatedly as if it were a new event.

This by this action being taking each month it affects my credit score, credit report, and credit worthiness.

Consumer complaint narrative:
I have contacted this company XXXX a few times they responded back with a letter stating that they sold the debt to XXXX. I have also contacted them sending them debt validation letters and debt verification letters requesting that they validate this debt. 
I have written this company two times to request a debt validation letter and verification letter and did not receive the letter. I have also written all three credit bureaus requesting the same information previously twice as well. 
After carefully investigating the company XXXX, they are not even licensed to collect in my state that I live in Iowa. 

As such, any attempt to collect the alleged debt from me is in violation of Iowa state law and the Fair Debt Collection Practices Act ( FDCPA ). 

Consequences of Non-Compliance : Please be aware that any further attempts to collect this debt in violation of Iowa law or the FDCPA will be met with legal action. I am prepared to file a complaint with the Iowa Attorney General 's Office, the Federal Trade Commission ( FTC ), and the Consumer Financial Protection Bureau ( CFPB ). I will also seek damages as allowed under state and federal law. 
Delete I demand that you immediately cease all collection activities related to this alleged debt. This includes, but is not limited to : Phone calls Letters Emails Reporting this debt to any credit reporting agencies

XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XX/XX/XXXX Federal Trade Commission XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX, XXXXXXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXXXXXX Subject : Dispute of Credit Report Inaccuracy an privacy violation Due to Data Breach Dear Sir/Madam, I am writing to formally dispute inaccuracies on my credit report that I believe have arisen as a result of a recent data breach involving my personal information. My dispute is made under the Fair Credit Reporting Act ( FCRA ), specifically 15 U.S.C. 1681, which governs the accuracy and privacy of information contained in consumer credit reports. 
Details of the Dispute : Name : XXXX XXXX Social Security Number : XXXX Date of Birth : XX/XX/XXXX Description of the Issue : I was informed that my personal information was compromised in a data breach at the credit reporting agencies, XXXX XXXX Experian XXXX XXXX XXXX This breach has likely led to the erroneous reporting of information on my credit report, including but not limited to inaccuracies on my credit report also a violation of the FCRA and my rite to privacy in leaked information as my social, address, account information and more. 
Requested Action : I ask that these following accounts be remove from my credit report immediately XXXX  XXXX account # XXXX XXXX Account # XXXX Premier XXXX/XXXX  XXXX  account # XXXXXXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX account XXXX XXXX I request that you investigate this matter and ensure that any inaccurate or fraudulent information related to this data breach is corrected or removed from my credit report. I also ask for confirmation in writing once these corrections have been made. 
Please provide me with a written response detailing the actions taken in this matter within [ reasonable timeframe, e.g., 30 days ] as stipulated by the FCRA. 
Thank you for your attention to this matter. I trust that you will act promptly to rectify any inaccuracies that have resulted from this unfortunate breach of my personal information. 
Sincerely, XXXX XXXX

Product: Credit reporting or other personal consumer reports
Consumer complaint narrative:
XXXX, Equifax, and XXXX have refused to remove the negative accounts that do not belong to me from my credit reports. Despite multiple requests, these fraudulent accounts remain, damaging my credit and personal reputation. 

On XX/XX/year>, while applying for the Alaska Permanent Dividend Fund ( PFD ), I encountered a serious glitch on their website. As I was submitting my application, the page refreshed and began displaying another individuals personal information. This included their address, date of birth, Social Security number, and bank account details. 

On that same day, I received two phone calls from individuals who had seen my personal information on the PFD website during the glitch. They confirmed that they had access to all of my private information. 

Soon after this data breach, fraudulent accounts began appearing in my name, clearly using the information that was leaked through the PFD website. I did not authorize the use of my personal information in any form, and my identity was stolen to create these fraudulent accounts. 

I demand that XXXX, Equifax, and XXXX immediately remove these fraudulent accounts from my credit reports. This is my last warning, and I would prefer to resolve this matter peacefully, without the need for court intervention. However, if this issue is not resolved promptly, I will take legal action. Under the Fair Credit Reporting Act ( FCRA ), I have the right to dispute inaccurate information, and you are legally obligated to ensure that my credit report only reflects legitimate accounts. If you continue to refuse to act, I will pursue all available legal remedies, including litigation, to hold you accountable for the damage caused by this negligence. 

the following account are not mine and inquiries are not mine XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX

Sub-issue: Their investigation did not fix an error on your report
Consumer complaint narrative:
VALIDATION AND CEASE AND DESIST Collection agency name : XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX Account XXXX Your NAME : XXXX XXXX Your XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX Dear ( Debt Collector ) I recently received a debt collection notice from your office. I am writing to verify that you have contacted the correct individual and to request that you provide documentation confirming this. 
Please supply me with a copy of any contract or agreement signed with your company or the original creditor. 
In accordance with the Fair Debt Collection Practices Act ( FDCPA ), I request the following information : 1. The name and address of the original creditor and the current creditor.

2. Verification of the debt amount you are seeking to collect, including evidence that a contract exists creating the amount you claim is owed.

3. Documentation of all assignments showing the transfer of the debt from the original creditor to the current creditor.

4. Proof that the original creditor securitized the debt.

5. Documentation showing the assignments of the debt from the original creditor to the secured trust and then back to the original creditor. 
Please cease and desist from collecting on this debt until you have provided validation of the debt. 
Additionally, I request that you do not access my credit report or report anything to my credit bureaus. I dispute the validity of this debt amount, and this dispute should be reflected on my credit report if you have already reported this debt. 
Permissible Purpose Please state your permissible purpose for accessing my credit information. I dispute your right
