Product: Credit reporting or other personal consumer reports
Credit reporting or other personal consumer reports
Issue: Problem with a company's investigation into an existing problem
Sub-issue: Their investigation did not fix an error on your report
Consumer complaint narrative:
On XX/XX/year>, I received an improper and unsupported response from TransUnion regarding my fraud block request ( XXXX XXXX : XXXX ). TransUnion incorrectly declined to block fraudulent inquiries by XXXX ( XX/XX/year> ) and XXXX XXXX XXXXXXXX ( XX/XX/year> ), falsely claiming that the Federal Trade Commission ( FTC ) Identity Theft Report I submitted was not an official, valid document. This decision violates both the federal Fair Credit Reporting Act ( FCRA ) and California state laws designed to protect consumers from identity theft and fraudulent activity. 

XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXXViolation of Federal Law ( FCRA, Section 605B ) : ** Under the FCRA ( 15 U.S. Code 1681c-2 ), TransUnion is required to block fraudulent information on a credit report when a valid Identity Theft Report is provided by the consumer. The FTC Identity Theft Report I submitted ( Report Number : XXXX ) was generated through the FTCs authorized online platform, www.identitytheft.gov, and fully complies with federal law. This document included my personal identifying information, the specific fraudulent accounts in question, and a certification that I was a victim of identity theft. There is no legal requirement to provide a separate law enforcement report when the FTC Identity Theft Report is provided. 

Despite fulfilling all the requirements outlined by the FCRA, TransUnion refused to block the fraudulent inquiries. Their failure to comply with this legal obligation violates federal law and constitutes a violation of my consumer rights. 

XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXXViolation of California State Laws : ** As a California resident, I am also protected by the California Identity Theft Act ( California Civil Code 1798.92 et seq. ), which provides additional protections for victims of identity theft. Under California law, credit reporting agencies are required to investigate and block fraudulent accounts promptly upon receiving proper documentation. The FTC Identity Theft Report qualifies as an official document under both federal and state law, yet TransUnion has refused to take the required action, further infringing upon my rights. 

XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXXDetails of the Fraudulent Inquiries : ** - **XXXX ( XX/XX/year> ) ** - **XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XX/XX/year> ) ** Both inquiries were made without my authorization and are the result of identity theft. I have provided all necessary documentation, yet TransUnions refusal to block these inquiries from my credit report continues to cause harm to my credit standing and financial opportunities. 

XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXXActions Requested : ** I request the CFPBs assistance in compelling TransUnion to : 1. Immediately block the fraudulent inquiries from XXXX and XXXX XXXX XXXXXXXX. 
2. Comply with the FCRA, Section 605B, and California Civil Code 1798.92.

3. Provide a detailed explanation of their investigation method, including copies of all communications between TransUnion, XXXX, XXXX XXXX XXXXXXXX, and any other relevant parties. 
4. Provide me with an updated credit report reflecting the removal of the fraudulent inquiries.

5. Prevent further violations of my consumer rights under both federal and state law. 

XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXXConclusion : ** TransUnions refusal to block the fraudulent items despite receiving valid documentation is a clear violation of both the FCRA and California state laws. I respectfully request that the CFPB investigate this matter and enforce compliance to protect my rights as a consumer and victim of identity theft. 

**Supporting Documentation : ** - FTC Identity Theft Report ( Report Number : XXXX ) - TransUnion Response ( XXXX : XX/XX/year> )
Company public response: Company has responded to the consumer and the CFPB and chooses not to provide a public response

Product: Credit reporting or other personal consumer reports
Sub-issue: Reporting company used your report improperly
Consumer complaint narrative:
1666b. Timing of payments ( a ) Time to make payments A creditor may not treat a payment on a cred-it card account under an open end consumer credit plan as late for any purpose, unless the creditor has adopted reasonable procedures de- signed to ensure that each periodic statement including the information required by section 1637 ( b ) of this title is mailed or delivered to the consumer not later than 21 days before the pay-ment due date. ( b ) Grace period If an open end consumer credit plan provides a time period within which an obligor may repay any portion of the credit extended without in-curring an additional finance charge, such addi-tional finance charge may not be imposed with respect to such portion of the credit extended for the billing cycle of which such period is a part, unless a statement which includes the amount upon which the finance charge for the period is based was mailed or delivered to the consumer not later than 21 days before the date specified in the statement by which payment must be made in order to avoid imposition of that finance charge.

My account with XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX was never late! I have had exceptional payment history witH XXXX  XXXX and all payments were placed on Autopay. This late payment that is reporting is a result on a systematic error on their end processing my payment.

I demand the late payment reported in XXXX AND XXXX to be removed. 

They are not in compliance with the following law. 15 USC 1666b and its requirements set the standards and the guidance for a creditor to treat a payment as late, yet they are reporting a payment as late and they did not comply with the law!

15 USC 1666b ( a ) Time to make payments A creditor may not treat a payment on a credit card account under an open end consumer credit plan as late for any purpose, unless the creditor has adopted reasonable procedures designed to ensure that each periodic statement including the information required by section 1637 ( b ) of this title is mailed or delivered to the consumer not later than 21 days before the payment due date. 

XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX never sent the periodic statement along with the disclosures from section 1637 ( b ).

I have requested proof that this information was mailed or delivered 21 days before the payment due date and this information was requested in good faith pursuant rule 1002 and It was never provided.

This is unfair, illegal, fraudulent, and not equitable to me as a consumer!

Delete the late payments from my consumer reports

Consumer complaint narrative:
This letter serves as my final attempt to resolve this matter before escalating to legal proceedings. Despite multiple previous disputes and my clear evidence that these accounts are inaccurately reported, you have failed to remove the erroneous information from my credit report. Your continued reporting of these items is a direct violation of the Fair Credit Reporting Act ( FCRA ) and the Fair Debt Collection Practices Act ( FDCPA ).

Violations include but are not limited to : Failure to Conduct a Proper Investigation : As required under 15 USC 1681i ( a ) ( 1 ), credit reporting agencies must conduct a reasonable investigation of any disputed items. Your investigations have clearly been inadequate, as the same inaccurate information remains on my credit report.

Reporting Inaccurate Information : Under 15 USC 1681s-2 ( a ) ( 1 ), furnishers of information are required to provide accurate information. These accounts are incorrect and have not been verified with my signed consent.

Failure to Respond to Dispute : As per FCRA 611 ( a ) ( 1 ) ( A ), you are required to respond to disputes within XXXX  days. Your repeated failure to adequately address my disputes is unacceptable.

I have provided clear evidence that the accounts listed below are not mine and should not be reported under my credit file :

Consumer complaint narrative: I just opened this card in XXXX, but never received the card in the mail. I called the credit card company to request a new card be sent because I never received the first XXXX. The credit card company said they were sending me a new card and were waiving all late fees. Once I got my credit card in the mail, I then made a credit card payment of my full balance minus the late fees because they said they were waiving the late fees. I even called a second time to make sure all of the late fees were being waived because it had been a couple months since I opened the account. They assured me they were waiving all late fees. Yet, then they reported a {$55.00} late fee as a missed payment to the credit bureau. Its the first missed payment that Ive had reported to the credit bureau in my 17 years of having a credit card. This late payment reporting reduced my credit score overnight by over XXXX points. I called the credit card company again after I saw this late payment posting, and they removed that late fee, but refused to remove the late payment reporting to the credit bureau.

Credit reporting or other personal consumer reports
Consumer complaint narrative:
I am writing to formally address concerns regarding the reporting of late payments by [ insert the name of the creditor/financial institution ], which I believe may violate the Fair Credit Reporting Act ( FCRA ). I request your intervention to ensure compliance with the appropriate regulations governing accurate and fair credit reporting. 

Under the FCRA ( 15 U.S.C. 1681 ), creditors and financial institutions are legally required to report accurate and timely information to credit reporting agencies. According to the law : Accuracy of Information ( 1681s-2 ( a ) ) : Furnishers of credit information are required to report accurate information to credit reporting agencies. If inaccurate information is identified, it must be corrected promptly.

Duty to Correct and Update Information ( 1681s-2 ( a ) ( 2 ) ) : Furnishers must correct and update information when they become aware that previously provided information is inaccurate or incomplete.

Reasonable Investigation ( 1681s-2 ( b ) ) : When a consumer disputes the accuracy of reported information, creditors must conduct a reasonable investigation and provide corrections if inaccuracies are found. 
Based on my review, [ insert specific details about the late payment reporting, such as the dates and nature of the incorrect reporting ], I believe this information needs to be more accurate and align with the requirements outlined in the FCRA. This inaccurate reporting negatively impacts my creditworthiness and financial well-being. 

I request that the CFPB investigate this matter to ensure that [ creditor/financial institution ] complies with the FCRAs requirements. Specifically, I ask that they be directed to : Correct any inaccuracies in my credit report related to the late payment. 
Ensure all future reporting adheres strictly to FCRA standards. 
Provide written confirmation of the actions taken to correct these inaccuracies. 
Thank you for your attention to this matter. I look forward to your prompt assistance in upholding my rights under the Fair Credit Reporting Act. 

Sincerely, XXXX XXXX

Product: Credit reporting or other personal consumer reports
Issue: Problem with a company's investigation into an existing problem
Sub-issue: Their investigation did not fix an error on your report
Consumer complaint narrative:
I am writing to dispute the continued reporting of accounts on my credit report that have not been properly verified, despite my requests for investigation. According to the Fair Credit Reporting Act ( FCRA ), specifically 15 U.S.C. 1681i ( Procedures in case of disputed accuracy ), you are required to conduct a reasonable investigation when a consumer disputes the accuracy of any information on their credit report. I have not received proper written notice of the results of any investigation, which is a violation of 15 U.S.C. 1681i ( a ) ( 6 ) ( Notification of results of reinvestigation ).

Furthermore, I question how you can verify that these accounts truly belong to me if you are not conducting a thorough investigation. If you can not provide documented proof of these accounts validity, you are legally obligated to remove them from my credit report under 15 U.S.C. 1681i ( a ) ( 5 ) ( Requirement to delete or modify information that can not be verified ). 

Additionally, I request that you remove any hard inquiries not associated with an open account, particularly those made within the last six months. Under 15 U.S.C. 1681b ( Permissible purposes of consumer reports ), inquiries can only be made with my explicit consent, and I have not applied for new credit recently. With the recent nationwide data breach in which my Social Security number was exposed, its possible that credit was applied for in my name without my knowledge.

Lastly, please ensure the removal of any duplicate information from my credit report, as accuracy is required under 15 U.S.C. 1681e ( b ) ( Compliance procedures ).

I trust you will follow the law and promptly investigate and correct the errors in my credit report. Failure to comply may result in further action to protect my rights. 

Account ( XXXX ) listed below : XXXX. XXXX XXXX XXXX. XXXX XXXX XXXX. XXXX XXXX I am writing to dispute the continued reporting of this account that was settled. As part of the settlement agreement with the company, they confirmed that they would no longer report this account on my credit report. Despite this, the account is still being reported. 
Please remove this account immediately, as its continued reporting is inconsistent with the terms of the settlement. 

XXXX. XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX this account that was paid in full. The account should reflect a XXXX balance, yet it continues to report an outstanding balance, which is inaccurate. 

If the credit bureaus or the creditor are unable to update the information to accurately reflect the paid status, I request that the account be removed or deleted from my credit report, as required by the Fair Credit Reporting Act ( FCRA ). 

XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX  This account was previously removed from my credit report but has since been reinserted without proper notice. I was not notified of the reinsertion, which is a violation of my consumer rights under the Fair Credit Reporting Act. I kindly request that this issue be addressed immediately. 

XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX  this account was sold to a debt buyer. 

I am also writing to request the removal of outdated and incorrect personal information from my credit report. Specifically, I have noticed that old and unverified addresses are still being reported. The only address that should be listed on my credit report is my current address. 

Please remove any old or unverified addresses, as they do not accurately reflect my current information. Thank you for your prompt attention to this matter. Old addresses are listed below : XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX Thank you for your prompt attention to this matter.

Product: Credit reporting or other personal consumer reports
Consumer complaint narrative:
This letter serves as a formal demand to Equifax for the immediate removal of the inaccurate and fraudulent account from Kikoff Lending, Account No : XXXX, from my Equifax credit report. This account is being inaccurately reported with late payments for XX/XX/year> and XX/XX/year>, which violates FCRA 15 U.S.C. 1681a ( 2 ) ( A ) ( i ). This section explicitly states that a consumer report does not include information solely regarding payment history or utilization between the individual and the company making the report. As such, the reporting of these late payments is in direct violation of federal law, and I demand their immediate removal.

In addition, under FCRA 605B ( 15 U.S.C. 1681c-2 ), I request that Equifax block this information as it is fraudulent and negatively impacting my credit report. By law, you are required to block this information within 4 business days upon receipt of this request if it is determined to be the result of fraud or identity theft.

Furthermore, under FCRA 1681e ( b ), consumer reporting agencies must follow reasonable procedures to assure the maximum possible accuracy of the information they report. The information Equifax is reporting is both inaccurate and unverifiable. As required by FCRA 1681i ( a ) ( 1 ) ( A ), inaccurate or unverifiable information must be corrected or deleted from my credit report within 30 days. Given the harm caused by this false reporting, I demand the removal of this account and any associated derogatory information within 14 days of receiving this letter. 

Failure to comply with my request for removal will be considered a willful violation of FCRA 1681n, which entitles me to statutory and punitive damages for noncompliance. I will take further action, including filing a formal complaint with the Consumer Financial Protection Bureau ( CFPB ) and pursuing legal remedies. 

I expect full compliance and a written confirmation that this account and any associated derogatory remarks have been removed from my Equifax credit report within 14 days of receiving this letter.

Consumer complaint narrative:
This letter serves as a formal demand to TransUnion for the immediate removal of the inaccurate and fraudulent XXXX XXXX account, Account No : XXXX, from my TransUnion credit report. The account is being reported inaccurately with late payments for XXXX 2024 and XXXX  2024, which violates FCRA 15 U.S.C. 1681a ( 2 ) ( A ) ( i ). This section clearly states that a consumer report does not include any report containing information solely regarding payment history or utilization between the individual and the company making the report. Therefore, the reporting of these late payments is not only unlawful but constitutes a direct violation of federal law.

Additionally, under FCRA 605B ( 15 U.S.C. 1681c-2 ), I demand that TransUnion block this fraudulent information within 4 business days as required by law. The reporting of this account and its associated derogatory remarks is both fraudulent and harmful to my credit.

Under FCRA 1681e ( b ), you are required to maintain reasonable procedures to ensure the maximum possible accuracy of consumer information. The information being reported by TransUnion is inaccurate and unverifiable, violating FCRA 1681i ( a ) ( 1 ) ( A ), which mandates that inaccurate or unverifiable information must be corrected or deleted within 30 days. Given the seriousness of this issue, I demand the immediate removal of this account within 14 days of receiving this letter.

Noncompliance with this request will be considered a willful violation of FCRA 1681n, entitling me to statutory and punitive damages. If this issue is not resolved promptly, I will escalate the matter by filing a formal complaint with the Consumer Financial Protection Bureau ( CFPB ) and pursuing legal action. 

Please provide written confirmation that this account and its associated derogatory remarks have been permanently removed from my TransUnion credit report within 14 days of receipt of this letter. 

These letters are now clear about which bureau they are directed to ( XXXX or TransUnion ) and are stronger in tone. When sent to the CFPB, they will clearly indicate which letter corresponds to which bureau. 

Please remove the inaccurate late payments for XXXX and XX/XX/year> for account XXXX from my credit report & stop reporting account XXXX to my Transunion credit report. Reporting this violates FCRA 1681a ( 2 ) ( A ) ( i ). I demand immediate correction.

( 3 ) INFORMATION regarding inquiries Except as provided in section 1681g ( a ) ( 5 ) of this title, a consumer reporting agency shall not furnish to any person a record of inquiries in connection with a credit or insurance transaction that is not initiated by a consumer.

The entry in question is as follows : Account Number : unknown Reported Amount : {$610.00} & {$610.00} Nature of Dispute : I believe the information is incorrect and unverified. ] Under the Fair Credit Reporting Act ( FCRA ), specifically Section 1681s-2 ( b ), furnishers of information are required to ensure that the information they provide is accurate and verifiable. Furthermore, Section 1681i of the FCRA mandates that upon receiving a dispute from a consumer, the credit reporting agency must conduct a reasonable investigation to ensure the accuracy and completeness of the information reported.

I request that you investigate this matter thoroughly and provide me with a written response detailing the results of your investigation. If you are unable to verify the accuracy of this information, I expect it to be promptly corrected or removed from my credit report. Additionally, I request that you notify all three major credit bureaus ( XXXX, Experian, and XXXX ) of these corrections. 

Please be advised that if this matter is not resolved to my satisfaction within [ 30 ] days, I will consider all available legal remedies, including but not limited to seeking litigation for violations of the FCRA and any other applicable consumer protection laws. I would prefer to resolve this matter amicably and without the need for legal action, but I am prepared to take all necessary steps to ensure that my rights are protected.

Thank you for your assistance.

Sub-issue: Reporting company used your report improperly
Consumer complaint narrative:
I am writing to file a formal complaint regarding TransUnion 's fraudulent reporting practices that have caused significant harm to me. On XXXX XXXX XXXX, I received a letter from TransUnion confirming the removal of six fraudulent accounts from my consumer report. However, on XXXX XXXX XXXX, XXXX XXXX was re-added to my report without my knowledge or consent. Similarly, on XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX appeared on my report, again without notice or written authorization from me.

On XXXX XXXX XXXX, I made several attempts to contact TransUnion regarding these unauthorized changes. Despite multiple calls, I only received one callback. During this callback, I spoke to a representative named XXXX XXXX ( ID # XXXX ) at XXXX XXXX. XXXX reviewed my consumer report and noted that these accounts were not reflected in his system at that time. After updating his system, he acknowledged that these accounts should not have been added without my explicit written consent and assured me that they would be removed immediately. He then transferred me to another representative named XXXX at XXXX XXXX 

XXXX refused to provide her employee ID number and falsely claimed that she was unable to do so. She also refused to provide any documentation or explanation as to why these accounts were re-added to my consumer report without my permission. Furthermore, she stated that I have no control over what is reported on my consumer file, claiming that creditors own and control what is reported, and that consumer protection laws are designed to be used against me rather than to protect my rights. This interaction was highly distressing and has further compounded the emotional, mental, and physical harm I have suffered as a result of TransUnions actions over the past 10 months. 

I have previously notified TransUnion of four data breaches in which my personal information was compromised. I have submitted reports to the Federal Trade Commission ( FTC ), filed identity theft reports, provided police reports, affidavits of truth, and a power of attorney that overrides any and all permissions. Despite these measures, TransUnion continues to act in violation of my consumer rights under the Fair Credit Reporting Act ( FCRA ), the Uniform Commercial Code ( UCC ), and the Code of Federal Regulations ( CFR ).

TransUnions repeated failures to address these issues, and their unauthorized and fraudulent actions, have caused me severe distress. Their practices are in clear violation of federal consumer protection laws, including the FCRA, which governs the proper handling and accuracy of consumer reports. I respectfully request that the Consumer Financial Protection Bureau investigate this matter and hold TransUnion accountable for its continued violation of my rights.

Consumer complaint narrative:
To Whomit May Concern This letter is being sent to you in response to a computer generated, unsigned letter dated XX/XX/year> ( XXXX ), letter received by Claimant from your offices. Be advised that your claim is disputed and validation and proof of claim of the disputed debt is requested in accordance with the Fair Debt Collection Practices Act, 15 USC 1692 and as amended by adding the following new Title 8 USC 802 et seq., and the Fair Credit Billing Act, 15 USC. 1666 et seq. All of which work in conjunction with each other, including the Truth In Lending Act ( TILA ) 15 USC 1601 et seq. It is not now, nor has it ever been, my intention to avoid paying any obligation that is lawfully owed by the Claimant. I refuse to pay this alleged debt until the proper validation of this debt is provided. Please cease and desist all collection activities until you can properly validate this alleged debt.

15 USC1692c ( c ) Ceasing communication If a consumer notifies a debt collector in writing that the consumer refuses to pay a debt or that the consumer wishes the debt collector to cease further communication with the consumer, the debt collector shall not communicate further with the consumer with respect to such debt.

If proper validation of this alleged debt is not provided within 30 calendar days of receiving this notice, I will assume this alleged debt to be invalid and you shall delete this account and stop all collection activities regarding this account. In order to make arrangements to pay an obligation which may be lawfully owed, please document and verify the debt by complying, in good faith, with this request for validation and return it to me, within thirty ( 30 ) days of receipt of this letter.

This is NOT a request for verification or proof of Claimant mailing address, but a request for VALIDATION and PROOF OF CLAIM made pursuant to the above-named Titles and Sections. I respectfully request that your offices provide Claimant with competent evidence as per the attached Declaration and Proof of Claim that I have any legal obligation to pay you the unsubstantiated alleged debt.

Provide under Rule 1002. Requirement of the Original An original writing, recording, or photograph is required in order to prove its content unless these rules or a federal statute provides otherwise.

Furthermore, you shall cease all verbal communication. No phone calls, no text messages, no social media contact, no ringless voicemail contact, no email contact, the only communication must be through the UNITED STATES POST OFFICE, to the Claimant.

At this time I will also inform you that if your offices have reported invalidated information to any of the 3 major Consumer reporting agencies, such as, XXXX, XXXX and TransUnion prior to validation and proof of claim of the disputed debt, this action might constitute fraud under both Federal and State Laws. Due to this fact ; if any negative mark is found on any of Claimant consumer reports by your company or the company that you represent, I will not hesitate in bringing legal action against you and your client for the following : Violation of the Fair Credit Reporting Act Violation of the Fair Debt Collection Practices Act Defamation of Character Violation of United States Code TITLE 18 PART 1 CHAPTER 63 1341 ( Mail Fraud ) This debt is considered to be invalid until I receive proper validation and your offices provide Claimant with proof of claim of the disputed debt. Your offices have 30 days to produce the required documentation in accordance with FTC guidelines. During this validation period and proof of claim, if any action is taken which could be considered detrimental to any of Claimant consumer reports, said action will be considered a dishonor and cause the self-executing contract portion of this notice to be implemented. This includes any listing any information to a consumer reporting repository that could be inaccurate or invalidated.

If your offices fail to respond to this validation and proof of claim request within 30 days from the date of your receipt, all references to this account must be deleted and completely removed from Claimant credit file and a copy of such deletion request shall be sent to Claimant immediately.

Title 8 USC 809. Validation of debts [ 15 USC 1692g ] ( b ) If the consumer notifies the debt collector in writing within the thirty-day period described in subsection ( a ) that the debt, or any portion thereof, is disputed, or that the consumer requests the name and address of the original creditor, the debt collector shall cease collection of the debt, or any disputed portion thereof, until the debt collector obtains verification of the debt or any copy of a judgment, or the name and address of the original creditor, and a copy of such verification or judgment, or name and address of the original creditor, is mailed to the consumer by the debt collector.

BLACKS LAW DICTIONARY : VERIFICATION. Confirmation of correctness, truth, or authenticity, by affidavit, oath, or deposition.

In conjunction with the above request, upon further investigation I did not receive All MY TRUTH IN LENDING DISCLOSURES.

Provide me with my truth in lending disclosures 15 usc 1635 ( a ) The information and rescission forms required under this section together with a statement containing the material disclosures required under this subchapter.

The creditor shall clearly and conspicuously disclose, in accordance with regulations of the Bureau, to any obligor in a transaction subject to this section the rights of the obligor under this section.

The creditor shall also provide, in accordance with regulations of the Bureau, appropriate forms for the obligor to exercise his right to rescind any transaction subject to this section.

Under 15 U.S. Code 6802- Obligations with respect to disclosures of personal information You failed to prove me with the Required disclosures to OPT out of having my information reported.

The law is very clear and before you reported my information to any nonaffiliated 3rd party ( Consumer Reporting Agencies ) you should have given me the following disclosures and you did not.

Provide me with the following ; ( a ) NOTICE REQUIREMENTS Except as otherwise provided in this subchapter, a financial institution may not, directly or through any affiliate, disclose to a nonaffiliated third party any nonpublic personal information, unless such financial institution provides or has provided to the consumer a notice that complies with section 6803 of this title.

( b ) OPT OUT ( 1 ) IN GENERALA financial institution may not disclose nonpublic personal information to a nonaffiliated third party unless ( A ) such financial institution clearly and conspicuously discloses to the consumer, in writing or in electronic form or other form permitted by the regulations prescribed under section 6804 of this title, that such information may be disclosed to such third party ; ( B ) the consumer is given the opportunity, before the time that such information is initially disclosed, to direct that such information not be disclosed to such third party ; and ( C ) the consumer is given an explanation of how the consumer can exercise that nondisclosure option.

Counter Claim with Self-executing Contract If Respondent, such as by commission, omission, and otherwise : ( a ) Fails to provide VALIDATION 15 usc 1692gb and PROOF OF CLAIM within thirty ( 30 ) days ; ( b ) All disclosures listed in this this correspondence ( c ) Makes a false representation of the character of the herein above-referenced alleged debt ; ( d ) Makes a false representation of the legal status of the herein above-referenced alleged debt ; ( e ) Makes any threat of action that can not legally be taken, in violation of any applicable law, such as, the law codified at the Fair Debt Collection Practices Act, will be construed to be Respondents tacit acceptance of the terms and condition stated herein. In which case RESPONDENT agrees to : ( f ) Voluntarily report this account to all consumer reporting agencies as paid as agreed ; and, ( g ) Voluntarily waive all claims against Claimant, their Agent or Heirs with prejudice ; and, ( h ) The matter regarding the alleged debt is finally and totally settled ; and, ( i ) Voluntarily admits the Claimant is the depositor for this account, that Respondent risked none of their assets at any time regarding this account and that they failed to disclose these material facts to Claimant ; and, ( i ) Voluntarily report the date of last activity on this account is the date of this notice.

Furthermore, RESPONDENTS failure to Cease and Desist in accordance with the requirements of the FDCPA and other related law, and/or satisfy the above terms and conditions, constitutes RESPONDENTS Breach of Duty and voluntary agreement to compensate Claimant, by certified mail, with a cashiers check within thirty ( 30 ) days of the date of billing by Claimant, their Agent or Heirs, in the following amounts : I ) II ) XXXX XXXXXXXX XXXX ( {$1000.00} ) for each communication made to Claimant or their Agent or Heirs, whether telephonically or in writing, which is not in affidavit form, by a person who has first hand knowledge, regarding Respondents unsubstantiated claim ; and, XXXX XXXXXXXX XXXX ( {$50000.00} ) for each transaction initiated by Claimant where Claimants commercial ability is impeded due to you, your agents or assigns adverse credit reporting ; and, XXXX ) XXXX XXXX XXXX ( {$5000.00} ) for each court appearance Claimant, their Agent or Heirs makes in response to Respondents unsubstantiated claims ; and, IV ) RESPONDENT owes Claimant the balance equal to the purported credit limit on this account, plus interest and fees, for money lent; and, V ) Three times the alleged claim amount of XXXX XXXXXXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXXXXXX XXXX  ( {$160000.00} ) which equals ( {$490000.00} ) ; and, VI ) XXXX XXXX XXXX ( {$5000.00} ) per occurrence, for listing or reporting any information to a credit reporting repository which could be considered detrimental to Claimants credit history ; and, VII ) Punitive damages in the amount of ( {$270000.00} ) ; and VIII ) Debt Collector tacitly agrees that Debt Collector will compensate Respondent for all costs ; fees and expenses incurred in defending against this and any and all continued collection attempts ( by anyone ) re the abovereferenced alleged account RESPONDENT also agrees to : 1. Voluntarily authorize Claimant to record a UCC-1 on RESPONDENT as debtor to secure the debt owed Claimant ; and, 2. Voluntarily prove their claim as a RESPONDENT in possession of Claimant property in a involuntary bankruptcy proceeding process ; and, 3. Voluntarily compensate Claimant for ALL costs and attorneys/consultant fees ; and, 4. Resolve ALL claims by Claimant, against Respondent, et al, exclusively and finally through binding arbitration, if necessary, to enforce the above terms, conditions, fees, penalties and damages. Arbitration replaces the right to go to court except to confirm an arbitration award. The arbitration organization that is selected will apply its code or procedure in effect at the time the arbitration is filed, subject to this agreement. The arbitration will be conducted before a single arbitrator. The arbitrators authority is limited solely to the Claims between Claimant and Respondent alone. The arbitration will not be consolidated with any other arbitration proceeding. If Claimant prevails in the arbitration of any Claim against Respondent, Respondent will reimburse Claimant for any fees Claimant paid to the arbitration organization in connection with the arbitration. Any decision rendered in such arbitration proceedings will be final and binding on the parties, and judgment may be entered in a court of competent jurisdiction. This arbitration provision applies to all Claims now in existence or that may arise in the future. The arbitration provision shall survive any voluntary payment of Claimants claim against Respondent, in full, or any bankruptcy by Respondent.

This is a private communication and is intended to affect an out-of-court settlement of this matter. Conduct yourself accordingly. Should any provision on this agreement be found to not be enforceable by order of a court of competent jurisdiction, it shall not adversely affect any other provision of this agreement and reasonable opportunity and effort shall be taken to modify it to become enforceable.

Equality under the Law is PARAMOUNT and MANDATORY by Law NOTICETOTHEPRINCIPALISNOTICETOTHEAGENT NOTICETOTHEAGENTISNOTICETOTHEPRINCIPAL Applicable to all successors and assigns Silence is Acquiescence/Agreement/Dishonor Executed on this XXXX day of XXXX, XXXX  by, XXXX XXXX You are the second party that has written a letter purporting to represent, or have as your client, XXXX XXXX Bank, the first was not registered as a debt collector in XXXX  and they have not answered the debt validation request presented to them. This is Notice that I do not recognize the Respondent from which the Claimant has received a computer generated debt collection attempt, and I must necessarily dispute part, or all, of the alleged until the following is received...

CREDITOR/DEBT COLLECTOR DECLARATION and PROOF OF CLAIM Please provide all of the following information and submit the appropriate forms and paperwork back to me along with an Affidavit signed In Accordance with 28 U.S.C. 1746 within 30 days from the date of your receipt of this request for validation and proof of claim.

1. Alleged Name and Address of Creditor 2. NameonFile of Alleged Debtor : 3. Alleged Account # : 4. Amount of alleged debt : 5. Date that this alleged debt became/becomes payable : 6. Date of original charge off or delinquency : 7. Amount paid if debt was purchased : 8. Please attach a copy of any signed agreement alleged debtor/claimant has made with debt collector, or other verifiable proof that debtor/claimant has a contractual obligation to pay debt collector.

9. Furnish a copy of the original promissory note/agreement redacting my social security number to prevent identity theft and state that your client named above is the holder in due course of the note agreement and will produce the original for my own and a judges inspection should there be a trial to contest these matters.

10. Produce the account and general ledger statement showing the full accounting of the alleged obligation that you are now attempting to collect. Such as ; FR 2046 balance sheet ( XXXX # XXXX XXXX, XXXX, XXXX ), XXXX099 OID report, S-3/A registration XXXXstatement, XXXXXXXX XXXX, XXXX & XXXX call schedules 11. Identify by name and address all persons, corporations, associations, or any other parties having an interest in legal proceedings regarding the alleged debt.

12. Verified specifically, name ( s ) of person ( s ) assigned as Trustee to handle Corporations affairs and to be held accountable for the actions of the Corporation. Such as CFO and subordinates responsible for debt collections.

13. Verify as a third-party debt collector, you have not purchased evidence of the alleged debt and are proceeding with collection activity in the name of the original maker of the note.

14. Verify you know and understand that certain clauses in a contract of adhesion, such as a so-called forum selection clause, are unenforceable unless the party to whom the contract is extended could have rejected the clause without impunity.

15. Provide verification from the stated creditor that you are authorized to act for them.

16. Verify that you know and understand that contacting me again after receipt of this notice without providing procedurally proper validation of the debt constitutes the use of interstate communications in a scheme of fraud by advancing a writing, which you know is false with the intention that others rely on the written communication to their detriment a violation of United States Code TITLE 18 PART 1 CHAPTER 63 1341. Product: Credit reporting or other personal consumer reports
Consumer complaint narrative:
I am writing to formally address concerns regarding the reporting of late payments by [ insert the name of the creditor/financial institution ], which I believe may violate the Fair Credit Reporting Act ( FCRA ). I request your intervention to ensure compliance with the appropriate regulations governing accurate and fair credit reporting.

Under the FCRA ( 15 U.S.C. 1681 ), creditors and financial institutions are legally required to report accurate and timely information to credit reporting agencies. According to the law : Accuracy of Information ( 1681s-2 ( a ) ) : Furnishers of credit information are required to report accurate information to credit reporting agencies. If inaccurate information is identified, it must be corrected promptly.

Duty to Correct and Update Information ( 1681s-2 ( a ) ( 2 ) ) : Furnishers must correct and update information when they become aware that previously provided information is inaccurate or incomplete.

Reasonable Investigation ( 1681s-2 ( b ) ) : When a consumer disputes the accuracy of reported information, creditors must conduct a reasonable investigation and provide corrections if inaccuracies are found. 
Based on my review, [ insert specific details about the late payment reporting, such as the dates and nature of the incorrect reporting ], I believe this information needs to be more accurate and align with the requirements outlined in the FCRA. This inaccurate reporting negatively impacts my creditworthiness and financial well-being. 

I request that the CFPB investigate this matter to ensure that [ creditor/financial institution ] complies with the FCRAs requirements. Specifically, I ask that they be directed to : Correct any inaccuracies in my credit report related to the late payment. 
Ensure all future reporting adheres strictly to FCRA standards. 
Provide written confirmation of the actions taken to correct these inaccuracies. 
Thank you for your attention to this matter. I look forward to your prompt assistance in upholding my rights under the Fair Credit Reporting Act. 

Sincerely, XXXX XXXX

In XXXX XXXX I became unable to pay my mortgage due to the Pandemic and completed a forbearance application. I also had to file a federal court case against both XXXX and XXXX for breach of contract, Respa Violations, Negligence, and etc. 

I have disputed the inaccurate reporting of my payment history with XXXX, Experian, XXXX and XXXX, yet these inaccuracies still remail and continue to cause me and my family great financial hardship. 

XXXX are in direct violation of the FCRA and CFPB regulations as they are knowingly reporting inaccurate and inconsistent information about my payment History. I am also attaching a letter received from XXXX confirming Respa violations and misapplication of my payments received and wrongful payment history reported. 

For example, XXXX and XXXX show me as current in XXXX of XXXX ( which I was ) However, Experian is reporting me as XXXX delinquent for XXXX of XXXX. XXXX is also wrongfully holding a check from my home insurance company to finish the repair of my home as they said that I was not current on my mortgage which I was and I am attaching the letter to prove so. 

Also in XXXX and XXXX of XXXX XXXX and Experian show me as 30 days delinquent and XXXX is reporting me as 60 days delinquent on each occurence. 

Lastly, when I applied for the forebearance, per the Cares Act, XXXX should have not been reporting negative items to the credit bureaus. 

I am under so much stress and financial strain and these negative marks are affecting my ability to get funds to help me take care of my family in my time of need. 

I have disputed these inaccuracies on several occasions with XXXX XXXX Experian, XXXX, and XXXX. I kindly ask that these negative marks be removed immediately from my credit reports.

My account with XXXX XXXX XXXX  was never late! I have had exceptional payment history witH XXXX  XXXX and all payments were placed on Autopay. This late payment that is reporting is a result on a systematic error on their end processing my payment.

This was clearly a billing error made my the company and is not a reflection of my payment experience which violates USC Code 1681eb. This error has caused severe hard to my reputation, my character, my mode of living and to my family!

I demand the late payment reported to be removed.

They are not in compliance with the following law. 15 USC 1666b and its requirements set the standards and the guidance for a creditor to treat a payment as late, yet they are reporting a payment as late and they did not comply with the law!

15 USC 1666b ( a ) Time to make payments A creditor may not treat a payment on a credit card account under an open end consumer credit plan as late for any purpose, unless the creditor has adopted reasonable procedures designed to ensure that each periodic statement including the information required by section 1637 ( b ) of this title is mailed or delivered to the consumer not later than 21 days before the payment due date.

NATIONS FIRST CAPITA never sent the periodic statement along with the disclosures from section 1637 ( b ).

I have requested proof that this information was mailed or delivered 21 days before the payment due date and this information was requested in good faith pursuant rule 1002 and It was never provided.

This is unfair, illegal, fraudulent, and not equitable to me as a consumer!

Delete the late payments from my consumer reports

( A ) In general. A consumer reporting agency shall provide written notice to a consumer of the results of a reinvestigation under this subsection not later than 5 business days after the completion of the reinvestigation, by mail or, if authorized by the consumer for that purpose, by other means available to the agency ( B ) Contents. As part of, or in addition to, the notice under subparagraph ( A ), a consumer reporting agency shall provide to a consumer in writing before the expiration of the 5-day period referred to in subparagraph ( A ) ( I ) a statement that the reinvestigation is completed. 
In accordance with the FCRA, a consumer report excludes any report solely detailing transactions or interactions between the consumer and the reporting entity. Issue: Problem with a company's investigation into an existing problem
Consumer complaint narrative:
Subject : FORMAL DISPUTE AND DEMAND FOR IMMEDIATE REMOVAL OF INACCURATE INFORMATION AND DEBT VALIDATION Account : XXXX XXXX - XXXX XXXX  Account Numbers : XXXX Notice to Agent is Notice to Principle and Notice to Principle is Notice to Agent, I am writing to demand the immediate removal of inaccurate and conflicting information on my credit file for the accounts listed above. Under the Fair Credit Reporting Act ( FCRA ), you are legally required to report only accurate and verifiable information. Failure to comply with FCRA Section 611 mandates the removal or correction of inaccurate information within 30 days. 

Due to the recent XXXX XX/XX/XXXX data breach, which exposed sensitive consumer data, it is imperative that my information be handled with utmost care to mitigate risks of identity theft and fraud. 

Discrepancies in Reporting : XXXX  XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX account, under account number XXXX, exhibits significant inconsistencies : XXXX. Conflicting Status Update Dates : XXXX report lists a charge-off status update in XX/XX/XXXX, while another lists it in XX/XX/XXXX. 
XXXX. Payment History Mismatch : Inconsistencies in the payment history for charge-offs and delinquency periods between the XXXX accounts. 
XXXX. Missing Original Creditor Information : XXXX XXXX is listed as the original creditor in XXXX report but omitted in another. 
XXXX. Unverified Highest Balance Information : XXXX report states the highest balance as {$1900.00}, while the other omits this information. 

This conflicting information is unverifiable and does not accurately reflect my credit activity. Under FCRA Section 611, I demand the immediate removal of this account from my credit report. 

Demand for Debt Validation : Under the Fair Debt Collection Practices Act ( FDCPA ), I request full validation of this debt. You are required to provide : XXXX. Proof the debt belongs to me. 
XXXX. A full accounting of the balance, including how {$1800.00} was calculated. 
XXXX. Copies of the original signed agreement indicating my legal obligation to pay this debt. 
XXXX. Name and contact information of the original creditor, along with all related documentation. 

If this debt can not be fully validated within 30 days, you must remove it from my credit report and cease all reporting. Non-compliance will be considered a willful violation of FCRA Section 611 and FDCPA, prompting me to pursue all available legal remedies, including filing complaints with the CFPB and considering a lawsuit under federal law. 

Expectations for Resolution : An immediate investigation into this account is mandatory. Provide verifiable proof that this debt is mine and accurate, or remove this item from my credit report. 

Failure to resolve this matter within 30 days will result in : XXXX. Filing formal complaints with the CFPB and FTC. 
XXXX. Considering legal action for damages due to willful non-compliance under the FCRA, entitling me to statutory damages and compensation for harm caused by incorrect reporting. 

Given the data breach, the urgency of this matter can not be overstated. Notify me in writing of the investigation results and provide an updated copy of my credit report once changes are made. 

Thank you for your prompt attention to this serious matter. 

Sincerely, XXXX XXXX [ Agent/Beneficiary ] without prejudice, all natural inalienable rights reserved.

This letter serves as my final attempt to resolve this matter before escalating to legal proceedings. Despite multiple previous disputes and my clear evidence that these accounts are inaccurately reported, you have failed to remove the erroneous information from my credit report. Your continued reporting of these items is a direct violation of the Fair Credit Reporting Act ( FCRA ) and the Fair Debt Collection Practices Act ( FDCPA ).

Violations include but are not limited to : Failure to Conduct a Proper Investigation : As required under 15 USC 1681i ( a ) ( 1 ), credit reporting agencies must conduct a reasonable investigation of any disputed items. Your investigations have clearly been inadequate, as the same inaccurate information remains on my credit report.

Reporting Inaccurate Information : Under 15 USC 1681s-2 ( a ) ( 1 ), furnishers of information are required to provide accurate information. These accounts are incorrect and have not been verified with my signed consent.

Failure to Respond to Dispute : As per FCRA 611 ( a ) ( 1 ) ( A ), you are required to respond to disputes within 30 days. Your repeated failure to adequately address my disputes is unacceptable.

I have provided clear evidence that the accounts listed below are not mine and should not be reported under my credit file :

Issue: Attempts to collect debt not owed
Consumer complaint narrative:
I initially made a report out on XX/XX/2024 with your service. Subsquently there was addition information that need to be added. So call cfpb and spoke with a representative who indicated I make out a new report. What follow is the new additional information Starting in XX/XX/2024 I started to receive phone calls from a company identified as XXXX XXXX XXXX ( XXXX ). My cell phone identified the calls as SCAM, so I did not respond/answer. Calls from XXXX continued through XXXX and early XXXX. Each time I received a call from XXXX the identified phone number was different. This continued to support my thinking that it was a SCAM. Never did anyone that called from XXXX leave a voice message about why they were calling. On XX/XX/2024, I received a text message on my cell phone from XXXX. At this point I went and looked up XXXX on the internet and found they are debt collection agency. 

Being concerned that some debt fraud might be occurring for me I contacted XXXX from the phone number found on the internet. In calling XXXX I identified myself and the XXXX representative indicated that I had a debt with PayPal for {$21000.00} through a XXXX XXXX with XXXX Bank. I informed the representative that I have no XXXX XXXX with XXXX Bank. Further I indicated that I have never banked with XXXX XXXX. I asked what information they had from the XXXX Bank. The XXXX representative did identify that last XXXX digits of the XXXX XXXX  as XXXX and a residential address of XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX. I informed the representative that this was not my address and never has been since I live in Washington. I was not willing to provide XXXX further personal information about myself. I did ask the XXXX representative I can correct this error. The XXXX representative indicated he would file a dispute resolution and that I could respond to it when it would be mailed to me in XXXX to 10 days. I asked a XXXX representative for XXXX Dispute phone number which he provided but indicate I would need to call the next day since given the time the office would be closed. 

Following the call with XXXX I call XXXXXXXX XXXX  and spoke with a representative. The representative was able to confirm the information that XXXX had provided me. I had indicated to the XXXX representative that I have never bank with them. XXXX XXXX XXXX representative asked for my personal information, address and XXXX XXXX. I was reluctant to provide the representative this information, but she assured me it was to help verify if the information on their account was the same. Being concerned that my personal information was exposed I did provide the representative with the information. In turn she was able to confirm that the information in XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX was not my SS # or my address. XXXX XXXX XXXX  representative did indicate she would open a case on this as fraud and that I would receive a notice. The call with XXXXXXXX XXXX  was then terminated. 

After contacting XXXX XXXX  I call PayPal. I informed PayPal representative of the above information. I found PayPal representative not very helpful, and he only indicated that it maybe another person with my same name but he would report this to the higher-ups I might note that I do have a PayPal account which has a single credit card not with XXXX XXXX  XXXX This PayPal account is used infrequently. I check this account routinely and there has never been any fraudulent or illegal activity against it. 

On XX/XX/2024, I called XXXX XXXX department and spoke to a representative. The representative was able to confirm that I had called their service yesterday. I ask the representative how they obtain my cell phone since my personal information was not listed on XXXX XXXX XXXX account initially to start contact me assuming it was me that owned the debt. The XXXX representative could not initially indicate how that occurred. The representative was then able identified my SS # and address in their system. She indicated my personal information was now listed on the XXXXXXXX XXXX. I was upset that XXXX now had my personal information. I asked XXXX representative when my personal information was entered in the XXXXXXXX XXXX XXXX She confirmed that my personal information was entered in by XXXXXXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX It appears XXXX XXXX  entered my personal information on to a falsified account. The XXXX was also able to identify there was a prior information on the account that was not mine. I tried to explain to the XXXX what had occurred and how now they had my personal information in my attempt to correct this information. The representative only indicate that she was not XXXXXXXX XXXX I was quite frustrated at this point. The XXXX representative did indicate I would need to submit a dispute form which would be mailed to me in 3 to 7 days. This document needed to be submitted with my signature and a nonfamily member counter signature or notarized. I then asked XXXX representative if this information would be filed against my credit. She indicated that debt was filed to my credit report this morning XX/XX/2024. At his point I became very angry and indicated XXXX had used my personal information base on my attempt to correct fraud on my personal information. The XXXX representative was not able to respond to my concerns. Now I have a bad credit filling on debt that is not mine. 

I contact my attorney and shard the above information with him. We both feel that now there has been further abuse of my personal information. XXXXXXXX XXXX should have never entered my personal information to the account that initially only had my name but did not have my SS # nor my address. Additionally, XXXX appears to be on fishing expeditions to make collection on debt in any manner to appease their needs. XXXX has initially information from XXXXXXXX XXXX was not mine and they did not attempt to clearly clarify information on the account. Instead, they somehow found my phone number and began harassing me until I contacted then as a concern citizen that there might be fraud occurring. Instead, they use my attempt to correct a wrongful complaint against me. I truly wonder how reputable XXXX is. 

Thank you

Under 15 USC 1681i ( a ) ( 1 ) ( A ) subject to subsection ( f ) and except as provided in subsection ( g ), If the completeness or accuracy of any item of information contained in a consumer 's file at a consumer reporting agency is disputed by the consumer and the consumer notifies the agency directly or indirectly through a reseller, of such dispute, the agency shall, free of charge, conduct a reasonable reinvestigation to determine whether the disputed information is inaccurate and record the current status of the disputed information, or delete the item from the file in accordance with paragraph ( 5 ), before the end of the 30-day period beginning on the date on which the agency receives the notice of the dispute from the consumer or reseller.

This is the 7th letter and dispute I have sent to this COMPANY along with my police report, FTC report, and supporting identity documents verifying my identity. I indicated in all my letters and police report that I am indeed a victim of identity theft, and this CREDIT BUREAU is violating my consumer rights and not protecting me as an American Consumer according to the stated laws. This is my 7th notice to this BUREAU notifying you guys that these listed accounts were opened fraudulently. My information isnt protected, and this credit bureau isnt honoring my identity theft claim. Ive started legal litigation and will be suing this CREDIT BUREAU ; this company did not honor my rights or acknowledge my supporting documents regarding identity theft. These accounts were open illegally and fraudulently and Ive proven this matter and will prove it in court without a doubt, I am suing for my rights being violated, pain and suffering, false allegations from this CREDIT BUREAU, and assisting to furnish a wrong, and fraudulent accounts. I demanded these accounts be removed, and my legal rights, and laws be honored, and this CREDIT BUREAU DIDNT HONOR MY CONSUMER RIGHTS. THIS ACT IS PUNISHABLE BY LAW BECAUSE THIS CREDIT BUREAR IS ADDING AND ASSISTING IN AGGRAVATED IDENTITY THEFT. 


THESE PEOPLE CREATED FAKE DOCUMENTS TO OPEN AND OBTAIN CREDIT CARDS, LOANS AND LEASES IN MY NAME. EVER SINCE THEN THESE CRIMINALS HAVE BEEN USING MY IDENTITY INFOROMATION ALONG WITH MY OLD ADDRESS ( XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX, IL XXXX ) AND MY STOLEN IDENTIFICATION TO OBTAIN LOANS AND CREDIT.

I will be suing for assisting and adding in the opening account, and furnishing fraudulent data on my consumer credit report, this company did not take the proper steps to help protect my consumer report and properly investigate this matter.

On XX/XX/year>, I sent formal dispute letters to [ Credit Bureau ( s ) ] ( XXXX, XXXX, Equifax ) to address inaccuracies on my credit report. As per the Fair Credit Reporting Act ( FCRA ), 15 U.S.C. 1681i ( a ) ( 1 ), the credit bureaus are legally required to conduct a reasonable investigation and respond to disputes within 30 days. If additional information is provided, they are given 45 days to complete their investigation and respond to the consumer. 

As of XX/XX/year>, it has been more than 45 days since the date of my original disputes, and I have yet to receive any response from Credit Bureaus. This is a direct violation of the FCRA, which mandates that the credit reporting agencies must provide the results of their investigation within the required time period. 

The failure of the Credit Bureaus to respond within the legal timeframe has significantly impacted my financial situation, as the inaccuracies on my credit report have remained unresolved. These inaccuracies may be affecting my credit score, access to financial services, and overall financial well-being.

Consumer complaint narrative:
Dear LVNV Funding and CFPB, I am writing to formally dispute the inaccurate, outdated, and misleading information associated with my credit report regarding the account listed by LVNV Funding. This account contains numerous discrepancies that not only misrepresent my financial history but also jeopardize my credit health and overall quality of life. 

The following inaccuracies have been identified in the report : 1. **Unverified Information** : The report indicates a " Balance Owed '' of {$500.00}, with the " Last Verified '' date marked as " - ''. This lack of verification raises serious concerns about the legitimacy of this account. Under 15 USC 1681e ( b ), I am entitled to have accurate information reported, and it is clear that this account fails to meet that standard.

2. **Outdated Activity Dates** : The " Date of Last Activity '' is listed as XX/XX/XXXX, yet the " Date Reported '' is XX/XX/XXXX. This discrepancy implies that the information being reported is not current and reflects poorly on my credit history. Such inaccuracies can lead to unjust penalties on my credit score and may hinder my ability to secure loans or favorable interest rates.

3. **Misleading Account Status** : The report states that the " Account Status '' is " Open '' with a " Payment Status '' of " Late 120 Days. '' This misleading information suggests that I am not maintaining my financial obligations, which is simply untrue. Additionally, the " Dispute Status '' indicates that this account is under investigation, yet every time I have reached out to XXXX regarding this matter, the account remains marked as " being verified. '' This ongoing ambiguity creates a negative impact on my credit health and personal finances.

4. **Consumer Rights Violations** : The inaccuracies present in this report violate my rights under 15 USC 1681e ( b ), which requires consumer reporting agencies to follow reasonable procedures to ensure maximum possible accuracy of the information they report. Additionally, 15 USC 1681i mandates that consumers have the right to dispute inaccuracies in their reports and to have them corrected in a timely manner.

The ongoing presence of this inaccurate and misleading information on my credit report has a profound impact on my life. It limits my access to credit, increases my financial burdens, and causes undue stress and anxiety regarding my financial future. I have made numerous attempts to resolve this issue with XXXX, yet their investigations have yielded no resolution, leaving me in a state of uncertainty and frustration. 

Given the severity of these issues, I respectfully request that LVNV Funding immediately conduct a thorough investigation into this account and take corrective action to ensure that my credit report accurately reflects my financial history. I expect the necessary updates to my account to be completed promptly, as my financial well-being depends on it. 

I appreciate your attention to this matter and look forward to your prompt response. 

Sincerely, XXXX XXXX XXXX : XXXX

XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX, TX XXXX Subject : Request for Method of Verification Under FCRA Dear XXXX, I recently disputed the accuracy of certain information on my credit report, and I have received your response. However, I am not satisfied with the outcome of the reinvestigation. Therefore, I am writing to request the method of verification for the following disputed item ( s ) : Disputed Item ( s ) : 1. Account Name : Jefferson Capital Systems, National Credit Adjust, XXXX XXXX, Receivable Management, XXXX XXXX XXXX, XXXX and XXXX, XXXX XXXX XXXX, Reason for Dispute : The above accounts are incorrect for the following reason 1. Closed/charge off accounts recorded as Paid off but the balance is constantly updated. 2. Paid off account but falsely reporting as late. 3. I am contesting these entries as it was added without my authorization. According to the Fair Credit Reporting Act ( FCRA ) section 605B. It is illegal to report information on my credit report without my permission.

Under the Fair Credit Reporting Act ( FCRA ), Section 611 ( a ) ( 7 ), I have the right to request " a description of the procedure used to determine the accuracy and completeness of the information. '' Additionally, FCRA Section 607 ( b ) requires that credit reporting agencies " follow reasonable procedures to assure maximum possible accuracy of the information '' contained in consumer reports. 
Please provide the specific details on how the investigation was conducted, including : 1. The name, address, and telephone number of the person or entity that verified the information.

2. The method and sources used for verification.

Also, ** In accordance with the Fair Debt Collection Practices Act ( FDCPA ), I request the following information : 1. The name and address of the original creditor and the current creditor.

2. Verification of the debt amount you are seeking to collect, including evidence that a contract exists creating the amount you claim is owed.

3. Documentation of all assignments showing the transfer of the debt from the original creditor to the current creditor.

4. Proof that the original creditor securitized the debt.

5. Documentation showing the assignments of the debt from the original creditor to the secured trust and then back to the original creditor. 

Thank you for your prompt attention to this matter.

Consumer complaint narrative:
This letter serves as my final attempt to resolve this matter before escalating to legal proceedings. Despite multiple previous disputes and my clear evidence that these accounts are inaccurately reported, you have failed to remove the erroneous information from my credit report. Your continued reporting of these items is a direct violation of the Fair Credit Reporting Act ( FCRA ) and the Fair Debt Collection Practices Act ( FDCPA ). 

Violations include but are not limited to : Failure to Conduct a Proper Investigation : As required under 15 USC 1681i ( a ) ( 1 ), credit reporting agencies must conduct a reasonable investigation of any disputed items. Your investigations have clearly been inadequate, as the same inaccurate information remains on my credit report.

Reporting Inaccurate Information : Under 15 USC 1681s-2 ( a ) ( 1 ), furnishers of information are required to provide accurate information. These accounts are incorrect and have not been verified with my signed consent.

Failure to Respond to Dispute : As per FCRA 611 ( a ) ( 1 ) ( A ), you are required to respond to disputes within 30 days. Your repeated failure to adequately address my disputes is unacceptable.

I have provided clear evidence that the accounts listed below are not mine and should not be reported under my credit file :

Date : XX/XX/XXXX Dear Sir/Madam I am writing to formally request that a security freeze be placed on my credit file, effective immediately, pursuant to Section 605A of the Fair Credit Reporting Act ( FCRA ) ( 15 U.S.C. 1681c-1 ).

1. Restriction on Disclosure of Information ( Section 604 of the FCRA, 15 U.S.C. 1681b ) Pursuant to Section 604 of the FCRA, I demand that no disclosure of my personal information, including consumer reports, be made to any person, organization, or entity that is not legally authorized to receive such information or that does not have my explicit consent.

2. Right to Privacy ( Section 609 of the FCRA, 15 U.S.C. 1681g ) In accordance with Section 609 of the FCRA, I request written confirmation that my personal information, including any medical or insurance information, will not be disclosed to third parties without my prior consent, except as strictly required by law. This confirmation should detail the measures taken to protect my information in accordance with legal requirements. 



XXXX. Prohibition of Unauthorized Disclosure under Consumer Privacy Protection Laws Additionally, in line with federal and state privacy laws, I demand that no information contained in my file be disclosed to insurance companies or any other third parties without my explicit, written approval, unless required by law. Any unauthorized disclosure will be considered a violation of my privacy rights and will result in appropriate legal action. 



I attempted to make this request through your agency 's online portal, but unfortunately was unable to complete the process. For this reason, I am submitting this request in writing to ensure that the credit freeze is implemented in a timely manner. 

Below is the information necessary to process this request : XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX, CA XXXX. 

XX/XX/XXXX SS XXXX

Consumer complaint narrative:
XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX, CT, XXXX XXXX XXXX XX/XX/year> National Credit Systems XXXX Naturally Fresh Blv XXXX XXXX GA, XXXX Subject : Request for Method of Verification Under FCRA Dear Sir/Madam, I recently disputed the accuracy of certain information on my credit report, and I have received your response. However, I am not satisfied with the outcome of the reinvestigation. Therefore, I am writing to request the method of verification for the following disputed item ( s ) : Disputed Item ( s ) : 1. Account Name : XXXX XXXX XXXX Account Number : XXXX Reason for Dispute : No acknowledge Under the Fair Credit Reporting Act ( FCRA ), Section 611 ( a ) ( 7 ), I have the right to request " a description of the procedure used to determine the accuracy and completeness of the information. '' Additionally, FCRA Section 607 ( b ) requires that credit reporting agencies " follow reasonable procedures to assure maximum possible accuracy of the information '' contained in consumer reports.

Please provide the specific details on how the investigation was conducted, including : 1. The name, address, and telephone number of the person or entity that verified the information. 
XXXX. The method and sources used for verification. 
I appreciate your prompt attention to this matter and look forward to your detailed response as required by law. 
Sincerely, XXXX XXXX

Vehicle loan or lease
Consumer complaint narrative:
I recently encountered a concerning issue with my auto loan servicing. On XX/XX/XXXX, I purchased a XXXX XXXX XXXX, with payments scheduled for the XXXX and XXXX of each month. Due to recent XXXX on my XXXX, I was XXXX  and unable to make my payment by the due date of XX/XX/XXXX. I informed XXXX via text message that I had just returned from the hospital and would be able to make the payment within the upcoming week and asked to let me rest. Instead of replying asking for a date, which would have been XX/XX/XXXX, he continued to allow the system to randomly run a process for the payment. 

Despite my clear communication, XXXX proceeded to process the payment on my account as soon as I unlocked my card for essential purchases such as XXXX  and a XXXX  diet. XXXX response to my situation was that he could not process payments for a later date and that he had tried calling me, to which I had mentioned my difficulty in speaking due to my XXXX and preferred to communicate via text. I asked why didnt he respond via text when he read the text. XXXX response was how was I supposed to know you couldnt speak. 

I am concerned about the lack of flexibility and understanding in this matter, especially given my health circumstances. Additionally, I believe that the company 's practices may not align with ethical customer service standards. 

I would appreciate a review of this situation and a resolution that considers my current health situation. Please let me know if there is a way to address this issue or if further steps need to be taken. 

Thank you for your attention to this matter.

Sub-issue: Reporting company used your report improperly
Consumer complaint narrative:
Details of the Complaint : I am filing this complaint due to unauthorized inquiries that have appeared on my Equifax credit report. These inquiries were not initiated by me, and I believe they may be the result of the XXXX  Equifax data breach, during which my personal information was compromised. 

Despite contacting Equifax to dispute these entries, they have not been removed, and I have not received a satisfactory resolution. The unauthorized inquiries include XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX  Inquiry date : XX/XX/XXXXXXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX Inquiry date : XX/XX/XXXXXXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX via Dealer - Inquiry date : XX/XX/XXXX XXXX XXXXXXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX Inquiry date : XX/XX/XXXXXXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX Inquiry date : XX/XX/XXXX Office XXXX XXXX Inquiry date : XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX Inquiry date XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXXXX/XX/XXXX These inquiries are negatively impacting my credit score and overall creditworthiness. As per the Fair Credit Reporting Act ( 15 U.S.C. 1681 ), I have the right to dispute inaccurate information on my credit report. Equifax is required to conduct a reasonable investigation under 15 U.S.C. 1681i and remove any unverifiable or inaccurate information. I have taken the following steps to address the issue : Submitted a dispute letter to Equifax detailing the unauthorized inquiries.

Filed an identity theft report with the Federal Trade Commission ( FTC ).

Included supporting documentation such as my driver 's license, Social Security card, and utility bill to verify my identity.

Despite my efforts, Equifax has not taken appropriate action to resolve the dispute. I request the CFPB 's assistance in ensuring that Equifax complies with federal law, removes unauthorized inquiries from my credit report, and provides written confirmation of their removal.

Attachments : Personal Statement to the Federal Trade Commission ( FTC ) Affidavit of Events FTC Identity Theft Report Dispute Letter to Equifax Supporting documents : driver 's license, Social Security card, and utility bill Resolution Requested : I would like the unauthorized inquiries to be removed from my credit report immediately. Additionally, I request confirmation from Equifax that the issue has been resolved. If Equifax fails to act, I will pursue further legal action to protect my rights.

Product: Credit reporting or other personal consumer reports
Issue: Problem with fraud alerts or security freezes
Consumer complaint narrative:
Date : XX/XX/XXXX Dear Sir/Madam I am writing to formally request that a security freeze be placed on my credit file, effective immediately, pursuant to Section 605A of the Fair Credit Reporting Act ( FCRA ) ( 15 U.S.C. 1681c-1 ).

1. Restriction on Disclosure of Information ( Section 604 of the FCRA, 15 U.S.C. 1681b ) Pursuant to Section 604 of the FCRA, I demand that no disclosure of my personal information, including consumer reports, be made to any person, organization, or entity that is not legally authorized to receive such information or that does not have my explicit consent.

2. Right to Privacy ( Section 609 of the FCRA, 15 U.S.C. 1681g ) In accordance with Section 609 of the FCRA, I request written confirmation that my personal information, including any medical or insurance information, will not be disclosed to third parties without my prior consent, except as strictly required by law. This confirmation should detail the measures taken to protect my information in accordance with legal requirements. 



XXXX. Prohibition of Unauthorized Disclosure under Consumer Privacy Protection Laws Additionally, in line with federal and state privacy laws, I demand that no information contained in my file be disclosed to insurance companies or any other third parties without my explicit, written approval, unless required by law. Any unauthorized disclosure will be considered a violation of my privacy rights and will result in appropriate legal action. 



I attempted to make this request through your agency 's online portal, but unfortunately was unable to complete the process. For this reason, I am submitting this request in writing to ensure that the credit freeze is implemented in a timely manner. 

Below is the information necessary to process this request : XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX, CA XXXX. 

XX/XX/XXXX SS XXXX

A new collection agency seem recently to take over same issue, were I have place my complain before. I'm tired of this harassment 's by XXXX XXXX, ONE THINHG HAVE NOTICE AND IS A the difference between this company and other this company did not provide any federal regulation information on back of the letter wich is required by law, just like the law states, in case for me to place a complain, but I know the law and my consumer right, see letter front and back provided by this company call SYSTEM, Including envelope were it was deliver to my house. 

I have provided to XXXX XXXX in the pass all evidence and police Report of a identity Theft including police report. 

I can't stretch this any more therefore, I ask the FTC, and the CFPB to please do not discard this letter or place back burner. 

I understand my consumer rights, and if this don't stop here, I will like the FTC to take over this case, from Know on. 

Please note all cases by Previous agency 's been close and How XXXX XXXX continue to Harassment.

False Statements are not right is why some of this company 's have drop there cases please note original complain back XXXX XXXX, XXXX this must stop by XXXX XXXX XXXX, please see documents provided on this complain.
