Issue: Problem with a company's investigation into an existing problem
Consumer complaint narrative:
I am writing to formally address serious concerns regarding the handling of my identity theft dispute with Experian. On XX/XX/year>, I submitted a dispute to Experian, providing all required documentation, including a government-issued ID, proof of address, and an identity theft report, as outlined under the Fair Credit Reporting Act ( FCRA ). However, on XX/XX/year>, I received a response denying my request to block the fraudulent information on my credit report, claiming a lack of sufficient documentation. 

This denial is not only unfounded but also constitutes a clear violation of both 15 U.S. Code 1681b ( 2 ) and 15 U.S. Code 1681c-2, which establish the permissible purposes for the inclusion of information in consumer reports and mandate the blocking of information resulting from identity theft.

Specifically : 15 U.S. Code 1681b ( 2 ) prohibits the furnishing of consumer reports without a permissible purpose, and there is no permissible purpose for retaining fraudulent accounts on my report.

15 U.S. Code 1681c-2 explicitly requires credit reporting agencies to block information related to identity theft when proper documentation is provided, which I have already done. 
Your failure to comply with these provisions opens the way for civil liability for both negligent and willful noncompliance under 15 U.S. Code 1681n. Under this statute, a victim of noncompliance is entitled to {$1000.00} per violation. The continued reporting of accounts that were fraudulently opened without my express written consent constitutes multiple violations, as these accounts remain on my report without my authorization. 

This lack of action on XXXX part has resulted in further damage to my financial well-being, and I am prepared to pursue all legal remedies available to me under the FCRA if this issue is not resolved promptly. 

I am requesting the following immediate actions : Immediate blocking of the disputed items on my credit report, as they resulted from identity theft. 
A written explanation as to why my request was denied despite my submission of all required documentation. 
Compensation for the damages incurred as a result of Experians negligent and willful noncompliance with the FCRA. 
If this matter is not resolved within 10 business days, I will pursue formal complaints with the Consumer Financial Protection Bureau ( CFPB ) and the Federal Trade Commission ( FTC ) and explore civil litigation to address these ongoing violations of my rights. 

Please take immediate steps to rectify this situation and ensure full compliance with the law.

On XX/XX/XXXX, while reviewing my credit report, I noticed several inaccuracies. As stipulated by the Fair Credit Reporting Act, consumer reporting agencies are required to follow reasonable procedures to ensure the maximum possible accuracy of the information in a consumer report. However, the following accounts on my report are neither complete nor accurate. 

XXXX XXXX XXXX : XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX Additionally, I'd like to point out that under 15 USC 1681s-2 , it is prohibited for any person to furnish information to a consumer reporting agency if they know or deliberately avoid knowing that the information is inaccurate. 

Please see the attached documents for further details.

Product: Credit reporting or other personal consumer reports
Issue: Problem with a company's investigation into an existing problem
Sub-issue: Their investigation did not fix an error on your report
Consumer complaint narrative:
XX/XX/XXXXXXXX XXXX XXXX XXXXXXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX, FL XXXX Subject : Request for Reinvestigation and Removal of Inaccurate Information ( 3rd Time ) Reference : Fair Credit Reporting Act ( 15 USC 1681i ( a ) ( 5 ) ( A ) ) Dear CFPB I am writing to formally request a reinvestigation of the following accounts listed in my consumer file, which I believe contain inaccurate information. As per the Fair Credit Reporting Act ( 15 USC 1681i ( a ) ( 5 ) ( A ) ), you are required to follow reasonable procedures to assure maximum possible accuracy of the information concerning me in my consumer file. 
Despite previous disputes, the following accounts continue to reflect incorrect details. I urge you to conduct a thorough and reasonable reinvestigation to determine the accuracy of this information and delete the inaccurate items from my consumer file. 
Account Name/Account Number : XXXXXXXX XXXX XXXXXXXX / [ Account Number XXXX ] Inaccuracy : There are significant discrepancies in the reporting of the account information across different credit bureaus, particularly concerning payment history, balance details, and account status. 
Specifics : High Balance : XXXX reports a high balance of {$13000.00}, while Experian reports {$0.00}. This inconsistency suggests that the high balance information has not been accurately updated across bureaus. 
Last Verified Date : XXXX lists the last verified date as XX/XX/XXXX, but Experian does not report a verification date. This lack of consistency indicates that the account verification process may not have been applied uniformly. 
Date of Last Activity : Both XXXX and Experian report the date of last activity as XX/XX/XXXX ; however, the subsequent account activity reported by XXXX suggests ongoing discrepancies. The last activity date should be accurately verified. 
Date Reported : XXXX reports the date as XX/XX/XXXX, while Experian lists it as XX/XX/XXXX. The accurate date reported should be consistent across both bureaus. 
Balance Owed : Both XXXX and Experian show a balance owed of {$0.00}, but the payment history and account status suggest discrepancies in how this account was closed or charged off. This needs to be verified and corrected. 
Closed Date : XXXX reports a closed date of XX/XX/XXXX, but Experian does not provide a closed date. The closed date should be consistent and accurate across all reports. 
Account Status : Both bureaus report the account as " Paid, '' but XXXX includes the remark " Payment after charge off/collection '' and " Canceled by credit grantor, '' while Experian states, " Account has been closed due to inactivity '' and " Unpaid balance reported as a loss by credit grantor. '' These differences in status and remarks should be reconciled and accurately reflected in all reports. 
Payment History : Experian reports delinquencies ( 30 days late in XXXX XXXX, 60 days late in XXXX and XX/XX/XXXX, etc. ), while XXXX shows no late payments reported. This discrepancy in payment history should be thoroughly investigated and corrected. 
Days Late - 7 Year History : XXXX reports no late payments, while Experian reports late payments in multiple months. This inconsistency must be addressed to ensure the accurate reporting of the payment history. 

Action Requested : Please conduct a comprehensive reinvestigation to ensure that all details, including the high balance, payment history, account status, and remarks, are accurately and consistently reported across all three credit bureaus. Any inaccuracies or inconsistencies should be corrected or deleted from my consumer file as required by the Fair Credit Reporting Act. 
You have 15 days from the receipt of this letter to conduct a reasonable investigation and rectify the inaccuracies as required by law. I expect all necessary changes to be made to my consumer file and for these changes to be forwarded to me at the address provided above. 
Please consider this my formal request for a reinvestigation and ensure that the inaccuracies are corrected promptly. I look forward to receiving confirmation of the changes made to my file. 
Thank you for your prompt attention to this matter. 
Sincerely, XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX

Consumer complaint narrative:
XXXX, XXXX, and Experian have refused to remove the negative accounts that do not belong to me from my credit reports. Despite multiple requests, these fraudulent accounts remain, damaging my credit and personal reputation. 

On XX/XX/year>, while applying for the Alaska Permanent Dividend Fund ( PFD ), I encountered a serious glitch on their website. As I was submitting my application, the page refreshed and began displaying another individuals personal information. This included their address, date of birth, Social Security number, and bank account details. 

On that same day, I received two phone calls from individuals who had seen my personal information on the PFD website during the glitch. They confirmed that they had access to all of my private information. 

Soon after this data breach, fraudulent accounts began appearing in my name, clearly using the information that was leaked through the PFD website. I did not authorize the use of my personal information in any form, and my identity was stolen to create these fraudulent accounts. 

I demand that XXXX, XXXX, and Experian immediately remove these fraudulent accounts from my credit reports. This is my last warning, and I would prefer to resolve this matter peacefully, without the need for court intervention. However, if this issue is not resolved promptly, I will take legal action. Under the Fair Credit Reporting Act ( FCRA ), I have the right to dispute inaccurate information, and you are legally obligated to ensure that my credit report only reflects legitimate accounts. If you continue to refuse to act, I will pursue all available legal remedies, including litigation, to hold you accountable for the damage caused by this negligence.

Consumer complaint narrative:
To Whomit May Concern This letter is being sent to you in response to a computer generated, unsigned letter dated XX/XX/year> ( XXXX ), letter received by Claimant from your offices. Be advised that your claim is disputed and validation and proof of claim of the disputed debt is requested in accordance with the Fair Debt Collection Practices Act, 15 USC 1692 and as amended by adding the following new Title 8 USC 802 et seq., and the Fair Credit Billing Act, 15 USC. 1666 et seq. All of which work in conjunction with each other, including the Truth In Lending Act ( TILA ) 15 USC 1601 et seq. It is not now, nor has it ever been, my intention to avoid paying any obligation that is lawfully owed by the Claimant. I refuse to pay this alleged debt until the proper validation of this debt is provided. Please cease and desist all collection activities until you can properly validate this alleged debt.

15 USC1692c ( c ) Ceasing communication If a consumer notifies a debt collector in writing that the consumer refuses to pay a debt or that the consumer wishes the debt collector to cease further communication with the consumer, the debt collector shall not communicate further with the consumer with respect to such debt.

If proper validation of this alleged debt is not provided within 30 calendar days of receiving this notice, I will assume this alleged debt to be invalid and you shall delete this account and stop all collection activities regarding this account. In order to make arrangements to pay an obligation which may be lawfully owed, please document and verify the debt by complying, in good faith, with this request for validation and return it to me, within thirty ( 30 ) days of receipt of this letter.

This is NOT a request for verification or proof of Claimant mailing address, but a request for VALIDATION and PROOF OF CLAIM made pursuant to the above-named Titles and Sections. I respectfully request that your offices provide Claimant with competent evidence as per the attached Declaration and Proof of Claim that I have any legal obligation to pay you the unsubstantiated alleged debt.

Provide under Rule 1002. Requirement of the Original An original writing, recording, or photograph is required in order to prove its content unless these rules or a federal statute provides otherwise.

Furthermore, you shall cease all verbal communication. No phone calls, no text messages, no social media contact, no ringless voicemail contact, no email contact, the only communication must be through the UNITED STATES POST OFFICE, to the Claimant.

At this time I will also inform you that if your offices have reported invalidated information to any of the XXXX major Consumer reporting agencies, such as, XXXX, Experian and XXXX prior to validation and proof of claim of the disputed debt, this action might constitute fraud under both Federal and State Laws. Due to this fact ; if any negative mark is found on any of Claimant consumer reports by your company or the company that you represent, I will not hesitate in bringing legal action against you and your client for the following : Violation of the Fair Credit Reporting Act Violation of the Fair Debt Collection Practices Act Defamation of Character Violation of United States Code TITLE 18 PART 1 CHAPTER 63 1341 ( Mail Fraud ) This debt is considered to be invalid until I receive proper validation and your offices provide Claimant with proof of claim of the disputed debt. Your offices have 30 days to produce the required documentation in accordance with FTC guidelines. During this validation period and proof of claim, if any action is taken which could be considered detrimental to any of Claimant consumer reports, said action will be considered a dishonor and cause the self-executing contract portion of this notice to be implemented. This includes any listing any information to a consumer reporting repository that could be inaccurate or invalidated.

If your offices fail to respond to this validation and proof of claim request within 30 days from the date of your receipt, all references to this account must be deleted and completely removed from Claimant credit file and a copy of such deletion request shall be sent to Claimant immediately.

Title 8 USC 809. Validation of debts [ 15 USC 1692g ] ( b ) If the consumer notifies the debt collector in writing within the thirty-day period described in subsection ( a ) that the debt, or any portion thereof, is disputed, or that the consumer requests the name and address of the original creditor, the debt collector shall cease collection of the debt, or any disputed portion thereof, until the debt collector obtains verification of the debt or any copy of a judgment, or the name and address of the original creditor, and a copy of such verification or judgment, or name and address of the original creditor, is mailed to the consumer by the debt collector.

BLACKS LAW DICTIONARY : VERIFICATION. Confirmation of correctness, truth, or authenticity, by affidavit, oath, or deposition.

In conjunction with the above request, upon further investigation I did not receive All MY TRUTH IN LENDING DISCLOSURES.

Provide me with my truth in lending disclosures 15 usc 1635 ( a ) The information and rescission forms required under this section together with a statement containing the material disclosures required under this subchapter.

The creditor shall clearly and conspicuously disclose, in accordance with regulations of the Bureau, to any obligor in a transaction subject to this section the rights of the obligor under this section.

The creditor shall also provide, in accordance with regulations of the Bureau, appropriate forms for the obligor to exercise his right to rescind any transaction subject to this section.

Under 15 U.S. Code 6802- Obligations with respect to disclosures of personal information You failed to prove me with the Required disclosures to OPT out of having my information reported.

The law is very clear and before you reported my information to any nonaffiliated 3rd party ( Consumer Reporting Agencies ) you should have given me the following disclosures and you did not.

Provide me with the following ; ( a ) NOTICE REQUIREMENTS Except as otherwise provided in this subchapter, a financial institution may not, directly or through any affiliate, disclose to a nonaffiliated third party any nonpublic personal information, unless such financial institution provides or has provided to the consumer a notice that complies with section 6803 of this title.

( b ) OPT OUT ( 1 ) IN GENERALA financial institution may not disclose nonpublic personal information to a nonaffiliated third party unless ( A ) such financial institution clearly and conspicuously discloses to the consumer, in writing or in electronic form or other form permitted by the regulations prescribed under section 6804 of this title, that such information may be disclosed to such third party ; ( B ) the consumer is given the opportunity, before the time that such information is initially disclosed, to direct that such information not be disclosed to such third party ; and ( C ) the consumer is given an explanation of how the consumer can exercise that nondisclosure option.

Counter Claim with Self-executing Contract If Respondent, such as by commission, omission, and otherwise : ( a ) Fails to provide VALIDATION 15 usc 1692gb and PROOF OF CLAIM within thirty ( 30 ) days ; ( b ) All disclosures listed in this this correspondence ( c ) Makes a false representation of the character of the herein above-referenced alleged debt ; ( d ) Makes a false representation of the legal status of the herein above-referenced alleged debt ; ( e ) Makes any threat of action that can not legally be taken, in violation of any applicable law, such as, the law codified at the Fair Debt Collection Practices Act, will be construed to be Respondents tacit acceptance of the terms and condition stated herein. In which case RESPONDENT agrees to : ( f ) Voluntarily report this account to all consumer reporting agencies as paid as agreed ; and, ( g ) Voluntarily waive all claims against Claimant, their Agent or Heirs with prejudice ; and, ( h ) The matter regarding the alleged debt is finally and totally settled ; and, ( i ) Voluntarily admits the Claimant is the depositor for this account, that Respondent risked none of their assets at any time regarding this account and that they failed to disclose these material facts to Claimant ; and, ( i ) Voluntarily report the date of last activity on this account is the date of this notice.

Furthermore, RESPONDENTS failure to Cease and Desist in accordance with the requirements of the FDCPA and other related law, and/or satisfy the above terms and conditions, constitutes RESPONDENTS Breach of Duty and voluntary agreement to compensate Claimant, by certified mail, with a cashiers check within thirty ( 30 ) days of the date of billing by Claimant, their Agent or Heirs, in the following amounts : I ) II ) XXXX XXXXXXXX XXXX ( {$1000.00} ) for each communication made to Claimant or their Agent or Heirs, whether telephonically or in writing, which is not in affidavit form, by a person who has first hand knowledge, regarding Respondents unsubstantiated claim ; and, XXXX XXXXXXXX XXXX ( {$50000.00} ) for each transaction initiated by Claimant where Claimants commercial ability is impeded due to you, your agents or assigns adverse credit reporting ; and, III ) XXXX XXXXXXXX XXXX ( {$5000.00} ) for each court appearance Claimant, their Agent or Heirs makes in response to Respondents unsubstantiated claims ; and, IV ) RESPONDENT owes Claimant the balance equal to the purported credit limit on this account, plus interest and fees, for money lent; and, V ) Three times the alleged claim amount of XXXX XXXXXXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX dollars ( {$160000.00} ) which equals ( {$490000.00} ) ; and, VI ) XXXXXXXX XXXX XXXX ( {$5000.00} ) per occurrence, for listing or reporting any information to a credit reporting repository which could be considered detrimental to Claimants credit history ; and, XXXX ) Punitive damages in the amount of ( {$270000.00} ) ; and XXXX ) Debt Collector XXXX agrees that Debt Collector will compensate Respondent for all costs ; fees and expenses incurred in defending against this and any and all continued collection attempts ( by anyone ) re the abovereferenced alleged account RESPONDENT also agrees to : 1. Voluntarily authorize Claimant to record a UCC-1 on RESPONDENT as debtor to secure the debt owed Claimant ; and, 2. Voluntarily compensate Claimant for ALL costs and attorneys/consultant fees ; and, 4. Resolve ALL claims by Claimant, against Respondent, et al, exclusively and finally through binding arbitration, if necessary, to enforce the above terms, conditions, fees, penalties and damages. Arbitration replaces the right to go to court except to confirm an arbitration award. The arbitration organization that is selected will apply its code or procedure in effect at the time the arbitration is filed, subject to this agreement. The arbitration will be conducted before a single arbitrator. The arbitrators authority is limited solely to the Claims between Claimant and Respondent alone. The arbitration will not be consolidated with any other arbitration proceeding. If Claimant prevails in the arbitration of any Claim against Respondent, Respondent will reimburse Claimant for any fees Claimant paid to the arbitration organization in connection with the arbitration. Any decision rendered in such arbitration proceedings will be final and binding on the parties, and judgment may be entered in a court of competent jurisdiction. This arbitration provision applies to all Claims now in existence or that may arise in the future. The arbitration provision shall survive any voluntary payment of Claimants claim against Respondent, in full, or any bankruptcy by Respondent.

Consumer complaint narrative:
I have been disputing with Experian Credit Bureau since XXXX regarding account XXXX XXXX. This account was deleted twice for inaccurate information. According to the Fair Credit Reporting Act ( FCRA ), specifically 15 U.S.C. 1681i ( a ) ( 5 ) ( B ), if a previously deleted item is reinserted into a consumer 's credit report, I am entitled to be notified within five business days of the reinsertion. I have not received such notification, and I believe that this item has been reinserted improperly. 
This account has been reporting as a charge-off since XX/XX/XXXX. I have not received a 1099C from the company or the IRS stating that my account has been filed as a charge-off since XX/XX/XXXX. This account is also reporting a charge-off in XX/XX/XXXX and XX/XX/XXXX, showing a repossession in XX/XX/XXXX and XX/XX/XXXX. This is very inaccurate and misleading information. 
This account is reporting the first delinquency occurred in XX/XX/XXXX and the last payment was made in XX/XX/XXXX Which both of these statements are inaccurate information.

Under the Fair Credit Reporting Act ( FCRA ), specifically 15 U.S.C. 1681s-2 ( a ), furnishers of information are required to provide accurate information. Repeatedly reporting the same repossession and Charge off as new violates has lead to a distortion of my creditworthiness.

Additionally, according to 15 U.S.C. 1681e ( b ), you, as a credit reporting agency, are required to follow reasonable procedures to ensure the maximum possible accuracy in the information reported. The presence of these duplicate entries is a clear indication that this standard has not been met.

15 U.S.C. 1681e ( b ), credit reporting agencies are required to follow reasonable procedures to ensure the maximum possible accuracy of the information they report. The dates listed for my account do not reflect the correct information, which results in an inaccurate portrayal of my payment history.

Furthermore, 15 U.S.C. 1681c places specific limits on the length of time that negative information, such as delinquencies, may remain on a consumers credit report. Reporting an incorrect date of first delinquency could result in unfairly prolonging the negative impact on my credit.

Re : Dispute of Inaccurate Information XXXX XXXX XXXX Account Number : XXXX Original Creditor : XXXX XXXX Bank XXXX. 

Dear Experian, I am writing to formally dispute the inaccurate information that has appeared on my credit report regarding a debt that was allegedly transferred to XXXX XXXX XXXX. The details of the account are as follows : Account Number : XXXX Original Creditor : XXXX XXXXXXXX XXXX XXXX. 
Date Opened : XX/XX/year> Account Status : Collection account with {$650.00} past due as of XX/XX/year> Balance : {$650.00} Original Balance : {$650.00} Dispute Points : Unauthorized Transfer of Debt : I have never agreed to or signed any contract allowing the transfer of my debt from XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXXXXXX. to XXXX XXXX XXXX. Furthermore, I was not notified of this transfer, which is a violation of my consumer rights under the Fair Debt Collection Practices Act ( FDCPA ). 

Privacy Violations : This unauthorized transfer and reporting of my personal financial information to XXXX XXXX XXXX is a violation of the Gramm-Leach-Bliley Act ( GLBA ), which protects my financial privacy. The handling and sharing of my information without my consent is illegal. 

Fair Credit Reporting Violations : The reporting of this collection account by XXXX XXXX XXXX is inaccurate and unlawful. XXXX XXXX XXXX is acting as a debt buyer and is required by the Fair Credit Reporting Act ( FCRA ) to ensure that the information they report is accurate and verifiable. Since I have not received any verifiable proof of the debt transfer or the legality of their collection efforts, this account must be removed. 

XXXX Requested : I demand the immediate removal of this collection account from my credit report. 
I request that you provide proof of the debts accuracy and documentation verifying that XXXX XXXX XXXX has the legal right to collect this debt. 
If this issue is not resolved, I will escalate the matter with the Federal Trade Commission ( FTC ), the Consumer Financial Protection Bureau ( CFPB ), and other appropriate government agencies for further legal action. 
Please complete this investigation promptly and notify me of the results in writing. 

Thank you for your immediate attention to this matter. 

Sincerely, XXXX XXXX [ Enclosures : Copy of Credit Report with highlighted inaccuracies, Proof of Identity ]

Under 15 U.S. Code 1681e ( b ) Accuracy of report Whenever a consumer reporting agency prepares a consumer report, it shall follow reasonable procedures to assure the maximum possible accuracy of the information concerning the individual about whom the report relates.

15 U.S. Code 1681i ( 5 ) Treatment of inaccurate or unverifiable information ( A ) In general if, after any reinvestigation under paragraph ( 1 ) of any information disputed by a consumer, an item of the information is found to be inaccurate or incomplete or can not be verified, the consumer reporting agency shalli ) promptly delete that item of information from the file of the consumer, or modify that item of information, as appropriate, based on the results of the reinvestigation; and ( ii ) promptly notify the furnisher of that information that the information has been modified or deleted from the file of the consumer.

I am writing to formally report that a XXXX  Line of Credit account with account number XXXX was fraudulently opened in my name, and I have been a victim of unauthorized charges associated with this account. I unequivocally state that I did not open this account nor authorize any charges associated with it. I did not receive any communication via email, phone, or mail regarding the opening of this account or the associated charges. Furthermore, I have been a victim of previous data breaches, including those from XXXX and XXXX, which I believe may have contributed to the unauthorized use of my personal information. 

I am requesting that you immediately investigate this matter and take the necessary steps to remove this fraudulent account and any related collections activity from my credit report. Product: Credit reporting or other personal consumer reports
Consumer complaint narrative:
My account with this company is being reported late and i was never late! I have had exceptional payment history with this company and all payments were placed on XXXX. This late payment that is reporting is a result on a systematic error on their end processing my payment. 

This was clearly a billing error made my the company and is not a reflection of my payment experience which violates USC Code 1681eb. This error has caused severe hard to my reputation, my character, my mode of living and to my family!

I demand the late payment reported in MONTHS REPORTING LATE to be removed They are not in compliance with the following law. 15 USC 1666b and its requirements set the standards and the guidance for a creditor to treat a payment as late, yet they are reporting a payment as late and they did not comply with the law!

15 USC 1666b ( a ) Time to make payments A creditor may not treat a payment on a credit card account under an open end consumer credit plan as late for any purpose, unless the creditor has adopted reasonable procedures designed to ensure that each periodic statement including the information required by section 1637 ( b ) of this title is mailed or delivered to the consumer not later than 21 days before the payment due date.

This company never sent the periodic statement along with the disclosures from section 1637 ( b ).

I have requested proof that this information was mailed or delivered 21 days before the payment due date and this information was requested in good faith pursuant rule 1002 and It was never provided. 

This is unfair, illegal, fraudulent, and not equitable to me as a consumer! 

Delete the late payments from my consumer reports.

Consumer complaint narrative:
I am writing to formally dispute inaccurate information that you have reported on my credit report. The entry in question is as follows : Account Number : unknown Reported Amount : {$610.00} & {$610.00} Nature of Dispute : I believe the information is incorrect and unverified. ] Under the Fair Credit Reporting Act ( FCRA ), specifically Section 1681s-2 ( b ), furnishers of information are required to ensure that the information they provide is accurate and verifiable. Furthermore, Section 1681i of the FCRA mandates that upon receiving a dispute from a consumer, the credit reporting agency must conduct a reasonable investigation to ensure the accuracy and completeness of the information reported.

I request that you investigate this matter thoroughly and provide me with a written response detailing the results of your investigation. If you are unable to verify the accuracy of this information, I expect it to be promptly corrected or removed from my credit report. Additionally, I request that you notify all three major credit bureaus ( XXXX, XXXX, and XXXX ) of these corrections. 

Please be advised that if this matter is not resolved to my satisfaction within [ 30 ] days, I will consider all available legal remedies, including but not limited to seeking litigation for violations of the FCRA and any other applicable consumer protection laws. I would prefer to resolve this matter amicably and without the need for legal action, but I am prepared to take all necessary steps to ensure that my rights are protected.

Consumer complaint narrative:
I am filing this complaint to inform you that Experian has unlawfully reported inaccurate information on my Experian consumer report. I wrote to Experian on XX/XX/XXXXXXXX  to resolve this issue no avail ( See Evidence ). It is the duty of every consumer reporting agency to investigate a consumer dispute and follow reasonable procedures to ensure maximum possible accuracy of a consumer report. 

My name is XXXX XXXX XXXX. I have no other name and no aliases. Any other name or spelling or abbreviations are inaccurate and must be deleted immediately. You, Experian, are furnishing 8 different variations of my name and this is inaccurate. 

My only address is : XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX, GA XXXX You, Experian, are furnishing 14 different addresses on my consumer report. This is inaccurate and must be deleted immediately. 

You, Experian, are furnishing 2 different social security numbers on my consumer report. Neither of these are mine! This is inaccurate. My only social security number is XXXX. Any other number is inaccurate. Delete any other social security number immediately. 

My only phone number is XXXX. You, Experian, are furnishing 3 different phone numbers and this is inaccurate. Delete all other phone numbers immediately. 

Delete all employers that you, Experian, are furnishing. I have no affiliation with any of those employers. 

You, Experian, are furnishing an inaccurate collection account on my consumer report. XXXX XXXX account number # XXXX  is not my account and must be deleted immediately. 

I am also requesting for the general or specific certifications pursuant to Rule 1002 required by 15 U.S.C. 1681b ( f ) to establish permissible purpose and compliance to furnish this account on my consumer report. This account has been reported since XX/XX/XXXX according to my consumer report, so I am requesting the general or specific certification that was given to you, Experian, at that time required by procedure to place this account on my report. If you claim to verify, validate this account, I am requesting the results of the reinvestigation and the procedure pursuant 15 USC 1681i ( a ) ( 6 ) and 15 USC 1681i ( a ) ( 7 ) to do so, as well as their sworn certification of accuracy. Experian is required to complete this reinvestigation pursuant 15 USC 1681i ( a ) ( 1 ) ( A ). I am likewise requesting the original documents pursuant Rule 1002. If you, Experian, can not verify this account under the requirements of the law, it must be deleted immediately! To be clear, I am requesting a preponderance of evidence to the facts ; not conjecture. 

References : Case Law : XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX  15 U.S.C. 1681s-2 ( a ) ( 8 ) ( E ) 15 U.S.C. 1681i ( a ) ( 6 ) 15 USC 1681i ( a ) ( 7 ) 15 U.S.C. 1681b ( f ) Rule 1002 Statutes Violated : 15 U.S.C. 1681b ( f ) 15 U.S.C. 1681e ( a ) 15 U.S.C. 1681q 18 U.S.C. 1028A

Additionally, the FCRA mandates that credit reporting agencies maintain accurate information XXXX XXXX XXXX ACCOUNT NUMBER : XXXX ( 15 U.S.C. 1681e ( b ) ). Repeatedly reporting the repossession each month creates an inaccurate and misleading credit report, which negatively impacts my credit score.

Moreover, the statute of limitations for reporting a repossession is seven years from the date of the first delinquency leading to the repossession ( 15 U.S.C. 1681c ( aX4 ) ). Reporting this repossession multiple times does not extend this statute and is therefore improper. 

I request that you promptly investigate this account and correct the inaccurate information by removing the repeated entries of the repossession from my payment history. 

Please update my credit report accordingly and provide me with a confirmation of these corrections. 
Thank you for your prompt attention to this matter.

Product: Credit reporting or other personal consumer reports
Consumer complaint narrative:
My account with this company is being reported late and i was never late! I have had exceptional payment history with this company and all payments were placed on Autopay. This late payment that is reporting is a result on a systematic error on their end processing my payment.

This was clearly a billing error made my the company and is not a reflection of my payment experience which violates USC Code 1681eb. This error has caused severe hard to my reputation, my character, my mode of living and to my family!

I demand the late payment reported in MONTHS REPORTING LATE to be removed They are not in compliance with the following law. 15 USC 1666b and its requirements set the standards and the guidance for a creditor to treat a payment as late, yet they are reporting a payment as late and they did not comply with the law!

15 USC 1666b ( a ) Time to make payments A creditor may not treat a payment on a credit card account under an open end consumer credit plan as late for any purpose, unless the creditor has adopted reasonable procedures designed to ensure that each periodic statement including the information required by section 1637 ( b ) of this title is mailed or delivered to the consumer not later than 21 days before the payment due date.

This company never sent the periodic statement along with the disclosures from section 1637 ( b ).

I have requested proof that this information was mailed or delivered 21 days before the payment due date and this information was requested in good faith pursuant rule 1002 and It was never provided.

This is unfair, illegal, fraudulent, and not equitable to me as a consumer!

Delete the late payments from my consumer reports.
Company public response: Company has responded to the consumer and the CFPB and chooses not to provide a public response

Consumer complaint narrative:
RE : You Violated The United States Code Law 15 U.S. Code 1681b - Permissible purposes of consumer reports ( a ) In general Subject to subsection ( c ), any consumer reporting agency may furnish a consumer report under the following circumstances and no other : ( 2 ) In accordance with the written instructions of the consumer to whom it relates.

Under 15 U.S. Code 1681b Permissible purposes of consumer reports I never gave you any written consent to report anything on my consumer report.

As a consumer by law these accounts on this letter must be deleted immediately or i will seek monetary damages in small claims court in my city and state. Also we already involved and sent this letter to the Consumer Financial Protection Bureau, Attorney Generals Office, Better Business Bureau, and Federal Trade Commission.

1. Under penalty of perjury I swear this account is false and misleading XXXX XXXXXXXX XXXX Account Number : XXXX Please remove it from my credit report. 




I am aware that you have been sending out form letters in response to many of the disputes and challenges that consumers have submitted, regardless of the specific information that they have provided. This is ILLEGAL, as each dispute and challenge must be addressed INDIVIDUALLY and on its own merits. My letters were created by software thats created for everyone.

If you dont process my letters, you are VIOLATING 15 U.S. Code 5 1681. Keep in mind, you are not allowed to delay processing letters from consumers based on the assumption that help from a third party, may be available. This is NOT a legal exception. 

I am the AUTHOR of any letters you receive with my name on them. Either I or my advisors wrote them with my FULL KNOWLEDGE and CONSENT. I am aware that there is no law that says you need to provide a POWER OF ATTORNEY in order to delay processing letters from a consumer. IF YOU DO NOT PROCESS MY LETTERS IN A TIMELY MANNER, I WILL consider it to be an INTENTIONAL disregard for my rights. 


Sincerely, XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX Consumer Financial Protection BureauXXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXXXXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX CC : Consumer Financial Protection Bureau CC : Attorney General 's Office CC : State Senate CC : Federal Deposit Insurance Corporation CC : Controller of the Currency CC : Federal Reserve System CC : XXXX XXXX XXXXXXXX XXXX : Federal Trade Commission CC : State Regulatory Agency

XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX, NC XXXX XXXX XX/XX/XXXX XX/XX/XXXX To : Experian Address : XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX CA XXXX I received a copy of my credit report, and I have found that in accordance with the FCRA you violated my rights under : 15 USC 1681 SECTION 602 WHICH STATES THAT I HAVE THE RIGHT TO PRIVACY, FURTHERMORE 15 USC 1681 SECTION 604a SECTION 2 ALSO STATES A CONSUMER REPORTING AGENCY CAN NOT FURNISH AN ACCOUNT WITHOUTOUT MY WRITTEN INSTRUCTIONS. 
Pursuant to 15 USC 1666b A creditor may not treat a payment on a credit card account under an open-end consumer credit plan as late for any purpose, unless the creditor has adopted reasonable procedures designed to ensure that each periodic statement including the information required by section 1637 ( b ) of this title is mailed or delivered to the consumer not later than 21 days before the payment due date. 

List : XXXX XXXXXXXX, XXXX, XX/XX/XXXX I NEVER gave you, OR the above-listed creditors any written instruction to furnish any information on my consumer report which is a violation of 15 USC 1681b. Credit Reporting Agency has caused severe stress and XXXX due to the abusive and unfair practices. 
You should be ashamed of yourself for ASSUMING this role and position to constantly commit fraud and cause harm to consumers! These accounts are listed with late or missed payments and that is incorrect. The ABOVE listed ACCOUNTS were NEVER late and should be listed as PAYS or PAID AS AGREED and update my payment history to a green check or gray it out. 
By the provisions of the Fair Credit Reporting Act, I demand that these items be investigated and removed from my report, and I demand that you provide me with concrete evidence and all documentation proving that I am or have been late. It is my understanding that you will recheck these items with the creditor who has posted them. 
Please remove any information that the creditor can not verify. I understand that under 15 U.S.C. Sec. 1681i ( a ), you must complete this investigation within 30 days of receipt of this letter. Please send an updated copy of my credit report reflecting the requested changes. 

Best Regards XXXX XXXX

Consumer complaint narrative:
XXXX XXXX Department XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX Subject : Formal Dispute of Inaccurate Information in Credit Report Dear XXXX, I am writing to formally dispute an inaccurate entry on my credit report under the Fair Credit Reporting Act ( FCRA ), XXXX5 U.S.C. 1681. The account in question does not belong to me and is negatively affecting my credit score.

The details of the disputed account are as follows : - I have never opened nor authorized this account. According to 281 SW715.719, I presume there is no evidence to support the alleged debt. Therefore, it can be concluded that no such debt actually exists. 

Under the FCRA, you are required to : 1. Investigate my dispute within 30 days of receipt.

2. Notify the creditor of my dispute.

3. Provide me with the results of your investigation in writing.

4. Delete or correct the inaccurate information if your investigation supports my claim. 

Enclosed, please find copies of the following documents to support my dispute : 1. A copy of my credit report highlighting the disputed account.

2. A copy of my driver 's license for identification.

3. A notarized affidavit of identity theft.

4. Any additional documents ( e.g., police report, FTC Identity Theft Report ) that support my claim. 

If this error is not corrected promptly, I will have no choice but to seek legal action to protect my rights. I trust that XXXX will address this matter swiftly to avoid litigation. 

Please confirm receipt of this dispute letter and initiate your investigation immediately. I expect a timely resolution as stipulated by the FCRA. 

Thank you for your prompt attention to this matter. 

Sincerely, XXXX

And according to 15 USC 1681 5 they are suppose to do this ( 5 ) Treatment of inaccurate or unverifiable information ( A ) In generally, after any reinvestigation under paragraph ( 1 ) of any information disputed by a consumer, an item of the information is found to be inaccurate or incomplete or can not be verified, the consumer reporting agency shall ( i ) promptly delete that item of information from the file of the consumer, or modify that item of information, as appropriate, based on the results of the reinvestigation; and ( ii ) promptly notify the furnisher of that information that the information has been modified or deleted from the file of the consumer.

and according to 15 USC 1681s-2 they are suppose to not furnish any information relating to a consumer to any consumer reporting agency if the person knows or has reasonable cause to believe that the information is inaccurate.

Product: Credit reporting or other personal consumer reports
Sub-issue: Reporting company used your report improperly
Consumer complaint narrative:
In accordance with the Fair Credit Reporting Act, the accounts listed below have violated my federally protected consumer rights to privacy and confidentiality under 15 U.S.C. 1681. The following accounts have violated my rights : ( Collection ) XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXXXXXX ( Collection ) XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX  ( Collection ) XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXXXXXX Upon reviewing my Experian credit report on XX/XX/2024, I noticed several inaccuracies and incomplete information. According to the Fair Credit Reporting Act, whenever a consumer reporting agency prepares a consumer report, it is required to follow reasonable procedures to ensure maximum possible accuracy of the information concerning the individual to whom the report relates ( 15 U.S.C. 1681e ( b ) ).

Furthermore, under 15 U.S.C. 1681i ( 5 ), it is stated that : ( A ) In general, if after any reinvestigation under paragraph ( 1 ) of any information disputed by a consumer, an item of information is found to be inaccurate, incomplete, or can not be verified, the consumer reporting agency shall : ( i ) Promptly delete that item of information from the consumer 's file or modify it as appropriate, based on the results of the reinvestigation.

( ii ) Promptly notify the furnisher of that information that the information has been modified or deleted from the consumer 's file.

Additionally, according to 15 U.S.C. 1681s-2, a person is prohibited from furnishing any information relating to a consumer to any consumer reporting agency if the person knows or has reasonable cause to believe that the information is inaccurate.

They are not in compliance with the following law. 15 USC 1666b and its requirements set the standards and the guidance for a creditor to treat a payment as late, yet they are reporting a payment as late and they did not comply with the law! 15 USC 1666b ( a ) Time to make payments A creditor may not treat a payment on a credit card account under an open end consumer credit plan as late for any purpose, unless the creditor has adopted reasonable procedures designed to ensure that each periodic statement including the information required by section 1637 ( b ) of this title is mailed or delivered to the consumer not later than 21 days before the payment due date. I have requested proof that this information was mailed or delivered 21 days before the payment due date and this information was requested in good faith pursuant rule 1002 and It was never provided. This is unfair, illegal, fraudulent, and not equitable to me as a consumer!

Consumer complaint narrative:
I am filing this formal complaint against Mohela for their gross negligence, inefficiency, and failure to properly manage my student loan account, which has caused significant distress and financial mismanagement on my part. 

During my XXXX  XXXX bankruptcy plan, when my loans were transferred from XXXX XXXX, Mohela failed to follow up or provide the necessary documentation to ensure a smooth transition. Furthermore, they have repeatedly failed to retain or furnish any records related to my loans prior to XXXX, including essential promissory notes and other loan documentation. This failure to maintain accurate records constitutes a severe breach of their responsibilities as a federal student loan servicer. 

Mohelas handling of my account has been unprofessional and negligent, placing an undue burden on me as the borrower. Their lack of transparency and failure to meet the standards of service expected of a federal loan servicer has caused significant frustration and financial complications.

Given these issues, I am requesting the Consumer Financial Protection Bureau investigate Mohelas actions and take necessary corrective measures to ensure that my loans are reassigned to a servicer that upholds the required standards of transparency, accountability, and professionalism.

I trust that the CFPB will address this matter swiftly and take appropriate action to protect borrowers like myself from further harm due to Mohelas mismanagement.

Thank you for your attention to this serious issue.

- Source : Experian - Company : XXXX XXXX, XXXX - Address : XXXX XXXX XXXX, XXXX XXXX, MN XXXX - Phone : ( XXXX ) XXXX - Activity : XXXX XXXX XXXX ( Collections ) - Balance Date : XX/XX/year> - Balance : {$830.00} The collection was reported by : XXXX XXXX XXXXXXXX XXXX on behalf of XXXX XXXX  for the amount of {$830.00}. 

It is a collection that does not belong in my credit report. 

Immediately, I filed a dispute to have this collection removed from my credit report to no avail. 

Experian refuses to remove this false collection from the credit report they publish. 
Experian, has stopped allowing me the ability to dispute this collection. Unless, I provide documentation for them to consider. 

There is no documentation to provide because this liability is not mine. 

I spoke to Experian representatives at one point by telephone call to address my dispute, but, we either got disconnected during the phone call or the representative hung up ( I do not know which ). 

During the phone call I asked for Experian to remove this collection from my credit report and/or to speak to someone in authority to do so. My request was not successful by phone either.

Sub-issue: Old information reappears or never goes away
Consumer complaint narrative:
Dear Experian, I have identified information on my report that are a result of identity theft these accounts do not belong to me XXXX XXXX XXXX # XXXX I am writing to dispute the reappearance of an account on my credit report. The account in question was previously deleted due to fraud, and an FTC Identity Theft Report was provided to Experian at that time. However, the account has now been reinserted without proper notification. 

Account Details : Creditor Name : XXXX XXXX Bank Account Number : XXXX This account was investigated and deleted by both XXXX and XXXX and has not been reentered on their reports. According to the Fair Credit Reporting Act ( FCRA ), specifically Section 611 ( a ) ( 5 ) ( B ), if a previously deleted item is reinserted into a consumers credit report, the consumer reporting agency must notify the consumer of the reinsertion within five business days. I did not receive any such notification regarding the reinsertion of this account.

I am providing Experian with a new FTC Identity Theft Report to support my dispute. I request that you investigate this matter and provide me with the required reinsertion notice. If the account can not be verified, I ask that it be permanently removed from my credit report. 

Thank you for your prompt attention to this matter.

Product: Student loan
Sub-issue: Problem with forgiveness, cancellation, or discharge
Consumer complaint narrative:
XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXXXXXX, Minnesota. XXXX XXXX  Consumer Financial Protection Bureau 1700 G Street XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX  Account : XXXX Complaint against Mohela Student Loan Server To : Whom It Concern Hello my name is XXXX XXXX and I am a recent XXXX  of XXXX XXXX XXXX located in XXXX XXXX, Minnesota. I have presented you with this complaint because I am totally baffled with the current Loans that I have been presented with by the student loan server MOHELA, as well as the department of education 's website. Not long ago I looked on the department of education website and I saw that all of my consolidated loans had been paid in full, meaning they were forgiven by the XXXX administration. I then went back to the website 2 or 3 weeks later and I noticed that there had been more loans posted and the entire loan amount that had initially been forgiven was now reposted. 

I then noticed that the loan server that was accusing me of having loans was MOHELA, which has not been my loan server, ( My Loan server is XXXX ). This is what left me baffled, the question that i asked myself was why in the world didnt MOHELA claim to be my loan server when I was consolidating all of my loans? And why didnt MOHELA bring up these new loans when all the rest was under review for loan forgiveness? Why did MOHELA wait until my previous loans were forgiven to implement new loans? The only answer that I could come up with is that MOHELA wanted to bring back the old loans by implementing new loans, making it seem as if I never received loan forgiveness. I feel that this is a plot to keep me going in circles and in dept with loans.

Enclosed is documentation to show that i sent other complaints in the past and no one has contacted me.

Your case has been submitted!

Case Number : XXXX What's Next?

Thank you for submitting your feedback. It may take up to 15 days for someone to contact you. 





Complaint sent prior to this one XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX, Minnesota. XXXX XXXX XXXX Department of education complaint department XXXXXXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX DC XXXX Suspected student loan fraud This complaint is in concern of a recent letter that I obtained from MOHELA federal student aid agency in XXXX, Missouri. XXXX, this letter is claiming that I have new loan consolidations and that I can start getting ready to pay these loans. the account number is # XXXX, this letter is showing two different loan amounts, one loan amount is XXXX, and the second loan amount is showing XXXX, both consolidation dates is XX/XX/XXXXXXXX 

The problem is that all of my loans have already been consolidated and this is shown by aid advantage, and all of my loans have also been forgiven, paid in full. This is also shown by the department of education, my total loan amount was only XXXX  and all of that has been consolidated. Those are the only loans that I had. 

My original loan server was XXXX, and then my loans were given to XXXX. And the amount never changed from server to server. 

These new loans are not my loans, there is no way that I could have borrowed over XXXX  dollars in student loans, and I know that I did not. this is a suspected fraud loan situation and I am contesting this loan. 



XXXX XXXX Department of Education OIG Complaint XXXX Inbox Search for all messages with label Inbox Remove label Inbox from this conversation XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX to me Thank you for contacting the Department of Education XXXX Office of Inspector General ( OIG XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX We have reviewed your complaint and determined the appropriate office to address your concerns is the Departments Office of Federal Student Aid ( FSA ). Consumer complaint narrative:
XXXXXXXX XXXX Account Number : XXXX I have never been late on this account, despite the company claiming otherwise. I have submitted proof that Ive always made my payments on time, but the company has ignored my evidence. Additionally, how can the company report me as late in XX/XX/year>, but not in the previous month or the following month? All other months show on-time payments. This discrepancy needs to be properly investigated. This account needs to reflect on-time payments only, as I have never been late. Please update and correct this information accordingly. 

XXXX Account XXXX : XXXX This account was never properly investigated, as there are no remarks on my credit report indicating that the bureau ever conducted an investigation, yet the information was marked as 'verified. ' How could you verify something that was never investigated? I request that this account be thoroughly investigated. If you can not verify this account, I ask that it be removed from my credit report immediately. 

XXXX XXXX Account Number : XXXX This account is showing as a charge-off but is still reflecting a balance, which constitutes a violation. Furthermore, this account was never investigated after I requested proof of its accurate reporting and validation of the debt. I have not received any response to my request for validation. I request that this issue be addressed immediately. 

I am requesting validation and verification for each account listed below. If your company or the original creditor can not provide verification or burden of proof, I request that these accounts be removed from my credit report immediately. Additionally, please remove any personal information that is outdated, old, or inaccurately reported from my credit report as well. 

Additional Accounts Listed Below : XXXX XXXX, XXXX XXXX Number : XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX Account Number : XXXX XXXX XXXX Account Number : XXXX XXXX Account Number : XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX Account Number : XXXX NCA ( Original Creditor : XXXX SPEEDYCASH XXXX / Account Number : XXXX If a company is claiming that I was late on payments, please provide proof of where and when these late payments occurred. I request a complete list of my payments and transaction history, including the date when I first became delinquent. If you are unable to provide this information, I ask that any and all late payments be removed from my credit report. 

Furthermore, I urge the Consumer Financial Protection Bureau ( CFPB ) to investigate the bureaus ' failure to properly investigate these accounts. It is crucial that the CFPB takes appropriate action to ensure compliance with investigation requirements and address these reporting discrepancies. 

Thank you for your attention to this matter.

Product: Payday loan, title loan, personal loan, or advance loan
Issue: Charged fees or interest you didn't expect
Consumer complaint narrative:
Dear CFPB, I am writing to formally submit a complaint regarding Navy Federal Credit Unions mishandling of a fraudulent loan account under my name. I have been a loyal member of Navy Federal for 17 years, during which time I have maintained several savings accounts, obtained car loans, and consistently supported the institution through a variety of financial products. Despite this long-standing relationship and strong track record, I recently became the victim of a sophisticated scam that has left me wrongfully liable for a {$5000.00} loan. 

On XX/XX/year>, I was contacted by scammers who masked their phone number to appear as though they were calling from Navy Federal Credit Union. Through this scam, they were able to access my account, apply for a personal loan of {$5000.00}, and transfer the funds via XXXX XXXX. Upon realizing I had been defrauded, I promptly notified Navy Federal and submitted all necessary documentation to demonstrate that this was a fraudulent act.

Despite my prompt reporting and Navy Federals stated " zero liability '' policy, which is supposed to protect members in cases of unauthorized transactions and fraud, they have failed to apply this protection to my case. Instead, I have been held responsible for this fraudulent loan. Since the incident, I have been repeatedly redirected between their Fraud, Collections, and Security departments, each providing conflicting information and inundating me with endless paperwork to submit, resubmit, revise, and resign, with no resolution in sight. The constant back-and-forth has made it nearly impossible to achieve any meaningful progress in my case. Additionally, each time I called Navy Federal, I was kept on hold for hours and transferred through multiple agents, all of whom provided conflicting information, further exacerbating the situation and contributing to my sense of frustration and helplessness. 

Throughout the investigation, I made numerous attempts to put the loan payments on hold while the fraud was under review. Despite these efforts, I was ignored and told that they could not place the loan on hold because it had not been open for 30 days. Later, I was informed that Navy Federal does not typically offer payment holds during an investigation. This left me with no option but to continue making payments on a loan I did not authorize, forcing me to financially bear the burden of a fraudulent transaction even while it was being reviewed. This practice is not only unfair, but potentially illegal under the Electronic Fund Transfer Act ( EFTA ), which provides protection against liability for unauthorized transactions. Navy Federal 's refusal to place a hold on the loan payments while investigating the fraud violates the spirit of these legal protections and has caused me undue financial stress.

The only formal written communication I have received from Navy Federal on this matter was a one-line notice stating : We have reviewed your request and hold you liable for this loan. If you have any additional questions, please contact us in writing via messenger or follow Navy Federal 's established process for disputes. This response, given the gravity of the situation, is inadequate and lacks any meaningful explanation of their investigation or why their " zero liability '' policy is not being applied.

At this point, I feel that Navy Federal, as a large institution, is overlooking their own commitment to protecting members from fraud. Despite my long-standing membership and solid financial history, my case has been handled without the proper consideration or transparency. The ongoing requests for additional paperwork, combined with the lack of clear communication, excessive hold times, and conflicting information from various agents, have left me feeling overwhelmed and abandoned by an institution I once trusted. 

Given my 17-year membership and responsible financial history, I believe I deserve fairer treatment and a thorough investigation under Navy Federals `` zero liability '' policy. I am requesting the Consumer Financial Protection Bureaus assistance in ensuring that Navy Federal absolves me of any liability for this fraudulent loan and improves their processes for handling fraud cases in a manner that is fair, transparent, and consistent with their stated policies, as well as with the EFTA. 

Thank you for your attention to this matter. I look forward to your prompt response and any further guidance you can provide.
Company public response: Company believes it acted appropriately as authorized by contract or law

Consumer complaint narrative: Today ( XX/XX/year> ), I received a very suspicious call from someone trying to pass themselves off as a fraud alert specialist from Bank of America ( BOFA ). They said that there were various suspicious charges made on my BOFA card from out-of-state + they suspected that my SSN had been compromised. They transferred me to someone who said they were an attorney with the CFPB + started asking me to verify all of my credit card info. They said that 4 of my 6 credit cards had been compromised + that they were going to need to shut down all of them and that I could not use any of these cards for 12 months. Then they tried to get my SSN number + started a long diatribe about how in the US, the credit card companies are charging exorbitant APRs + that I qualified for some type of debt relief. This is all seemed highly suspicious, so I kept the supposed CFPB official on hold, while I called BOFA to confirm whether or not there truly were fraudulent charges on my card + like I suspected, there were not. Then I called the CFPB directly to confirm if the complaint report # that was given to me by BOFA was valid + it wasn't. I proceeded to tell this " agent '' what had transpired + ended the call. The numbers that were used in this phishing expedition were : XXXX XXXX This was all obviously some type of identify theft scheme run out of a XXXX XXXX call center ( they all had XXXX accents ) + disguised as Bank of America + CFPB employees.

Consumer complaint narrative:
Subject : Equifaxs Failure to Adhere to FCRA Requirements for Victims of XXXX  and Blocking Information Date of Incident : XX/XX/year> Equifax Dispute Submitted on : XX/XX/year> at XXXX XXXX ( USPS Certified Mail Tracking Confirmation ) Complaint : I am filing a formal complaint against Equifax for violating the Fair Credit Reporting Act ( FCRA ), specifically related to protections for victims of XXXX under FCRA Section 605C ( 15 U.S.C. 1681c-3 ) and the obligation to block certain adverse information from consumer reports within the prescribed timeline. 
Background : On XX/XX/year>, at XXXX XXXX, Equifax received my dispute through certified mail, as confirmed by the USPS tracking receipt. In this dispute, I provided evidence that I am a victim of XXXX and requested that certain negative information be blocked from my credit report as per my rights under FCRA. 
According to the FCRA Section 605C and associated guidelines, Equifax was legally required to block the negative information from my consumer report within four business days of receiving my submission. This information has not been blocked as of today 's date, and I have not received any explanation or communication from Equifax justifying this delay or failure to act. 
Relevant Laws & Regulations : 1. FCRA Section 605C ( 15 U.S.C. 1681c-3 ) : o This section of the FCRA grants victims of human trafficking the right to have adverse information related to their trafficking experience blocked from their credit reports. Upon receiving appropriate documentation from the consumer, a credit reporting agency must block the specified adverse items within four business days.

2. 15 U.S.C. 1681i ( Dispute Resolution ) & 15 U.S.C. 1681s-2 : o Equifax has an obligation to conduct a timely investigation of disputed information and can not delay or ignore a dispute submitted by the consumer, especially in the case of special protections for XXXX  victims. Failure to investigate or correct inaccuracies can constitute a violation of the FCRA.

3. CFPBs Authority under 12 U.S.C. 5511 ( c ) : o The CFPB is responsible for enforcing consumer protection laws, including the FCRA, and ensuring that credit reporting agencies such as Equifax comply with the law.

Requested Action : I request that the CFPB investigate Equifaxs noncompliance with the FCRA and take appropriate action, including but not limited to : Immediate removal/blocking of the disputed adverse information in compliance with FCRA Section 605C.

Corrective action to ensure Equifax implements processes that meet the timeline of four business days for blocking information as required by law.

Any other penalties, fines, or disciplinary actions that are deemed necessary under FCRA for failure to adhere to legal obligations.

I appreciate the CFPBs assistance in addressing this violation and ensuring that Equifax complies with federal law, particularly for vulnerable consumers like victims of XXXX.

Sincerely, XXXX XXXX

Consumer complaint narrative:
XX/XX/year>XXXX  Re : Debt Validation Request I am writing to you in response to a notice I received regarding an alleged debt claimed to be owed by me. Under the Fair Debt Collection Practices Act ( FDCPA ), I am requesting that you validate this debt. Please provide the following information : 1. **The amount of the debt** : A complete breakdown of the amount owed, including any fees, interest, and principal balance.

2. **The name of the original creditor** : The name and address of the original creditor to whom this debt is owed.

3. **Verification that I owe the debt** : Documentation that verifies I have a contractual obligation to pay this debt, such as a copy of the original signed contract.

4. **Details of the debt assignment** : Proof that your company has the right to collect this debt, including documentation showing the chain of assignment of this debt from the original creditor to your company. 

Until you provide the requested validation, I am disputing this debt and requesting that you cease all collection activities in compliance with the FDCPA. Furthermore, please note that any attempt to report this debt to credit bureaus without proper validation is a violation of federal law and my rights under the FDCPA. 

I request that all future communication regarding this matter be done in writing. 

Thank you for your prompt attention to this matter.

Consumer complaint narrative: On XX/XX/year>, I visited XXXX and redeemed a XXXX for a Couple 's Massage ; I paid {$120.00} for the XXXX, with the XXXX 's Original Price being {$490.00}. I presented the XXXX code at checkout, clearly specifying I wanted a tip of 20 % to be added on the " AMOUNT PAID, '' - XXXX. An associate, XXXX, charged my debit card on file ( for what I believed to be {$25.00} ), yet she never asked me to sign a receipt, nor provided an immediate receipt, although I expected her to send one to my email address on file. The following day ( XX/XX/year> ) when checking my checking account statement, I still had not received a receipt ; however, I had noticed that {$68.00} had been charged instead. The charge was still marked as a " pending transaction '' and had not yet officially posted to my account. I immediately emailed XXXX, asking them to fix the mistake and apologizing for any inconvenience that may have been caused. I also sent a text via XXXX which showed it was delivered. They did not email back, nor text back, to fix the incorrect charge. I opened an Unauthorized Transaction Dispute with Navy Federal that day, XX/XX/year>. The dispute was closed two days later, with Navy Federal stating it appeared I was charged the " correct amount ''. I spoke to a Navy Federal supervisor, asking for details ; she stated that they needed an itemized receipt from the merchant to reopen the dispute. I received a receipt from XXXX on XX/XX/XXXX and emailed XXXXavy Federal the same day, via secure message, with a copy of an itemized receipt from XXXX, along with a copy of my XXXX receipt showing the Amount Paid that the 20 % tip was to be added to. The Itemized Receipt from XXXX clearly shows that I never signed/never authorized this transaction ( the company did not take my signature for this transaction ; there is no signature on the receipt. ) I also sent copies to Navy Federal of my email and text message to XXXX XXXX which I reiterated I had sent while the charge was still pending so XXXX could resolve before the payment had posted ). XXXX intentionally did not resolve the incorrect charge, nor did they email or text back to remediate the issue. I sent a follow-up message on XXXX XXXX to Navy Federal with a copy of all documentation to easily access in one message, and I asked them to reopen my dispute immediately. Since then, I have spoken with Navy Federal agents, and it appears that nobody has taken any action to reopen my dispute, nor respond to my emails.

Product: Checking or savings account
Consumer complaint narrative:
The Uniform Commercial Code ( UCC ) governs commercial transactions in the United States, including banking and financial transactions. While the UCC itself doesn't specifically address the opening of bank accounts, it does provide some principles that can be relevant. 

1. **Good Faith and Fair Dealing** : Under the UCC, there is an implied duty of good faith and fair dealing in all contracts. This means that banks must act honestly and fairly when dealing with customers. If a bank denies you an account without a valid reason, it could be argued that they are not adhering to this principle. 

2. **Discrimination Laws** : While the UCC focuses on commercial transactions, other laws, including federal and state anti-discrimination laws, may also apply. Banks can not deny services based on race, gender, religion, or other protected categories.

3. **Consumer Protection** : There are various consumer protection laws and regulations that banks must follow, which often require them to provide clear reasons for denying a service. If a bank fails to provide any reason for denial, it may be violating these regulations.

In summary, while the UCC may not directly state that it's illegal to deny an account without reason, principles of good faith, along with consumer protection laws, suggest that banks must provide legitimate reasons for their actions. If you feel you have been wrongfully denied an account, you may want to consider reaching out to a legal professional or a consumer protection agency for further guidance.

Consumer complaint narrative:
I am submitting this complaint against XXXX for permitting the re-addition of deleted accounts, improper re-aging of accounts, and the inclusion of discharged bankruptcy accounts without proper verification. These accounts were previously removed from my credit report after disputes but have been re-added without proper investigation or documentation. Additionally, there is evidence that certain accounts have been re-aged to make them appear more recent than they actually are.

The practice of re-aging and re-reporting discharged bankruptcy accounts contradicts both Fair Credit Reporting Act ( FCRA ) standards and bankruptcy protection laws, and it has caused continued harm to my credit report. 

Specific Issues : XXXX. Failure to Verify Accounts Properly : XXXX allowed accounts to be re-added after being deleted, without requiring any further verification or investigation from the original creditors or debt buyers. There is no proof that these accounts have been properly validated in terms of transaction history to allow me to examine and verify, balances, dates, or my liability as I was on end of life care during the time period in question. 



XXXX. Re-Aging of Accounts : I have observed re-aging of multiple accounts, where the dates of last activity have been altered to reflect more recent dates, making these debts appear more current than they are. This tactic extends the reporting period for accounts that should no longer be listed or should be closer to expiring on my credit report under statute of limitations. 



XXXX. Reporting of Discharged Bankruptcy Accounts : XXXX has allowed the re-reporting of accounts that were included and discharged in my bankruptcy case. These accounts were wiped out in bankruptcy and should no longer be reported. XXXX has failed to verify that these accounts are no longer collectable and should not be appearing as adverse items. 



XXXX. Circumventing Legal Verification Requirements : The re-addition and re-aging of accounts appear to be a tactic used by debt collectors and creditors to bypass FCRA requirements, avoiding the proper steps of verification. XXXX has failed to hold these furnishers accountable, thus violating my consumer rights. 



XXXX. Negative Impact on My Credit and Health : The continued re-reporting and re-aging of these accounts, along with the wrongful inclusion of discharged debts, has significantly harmed my credit score and increased stress, negatively impacting my health.

Consumer complaint narrative:
On XX/XX/year>, I sent formal dispute letters to [ Credit Bureau ( s ) ] ( Experian, XXXX, XXXX ) to address inaccuracies on my credit report. As per the Fair Credit Reporting Act ( FCRA ), 15 U.S.C. 1681i ( a ) ( 1 ), the credit bureaus are legally required to conduct a reasonable investigation and respond to disputes within 30 days. If additional information is provided, they are given 45 days to complete their investigation and respond to the consumer.

As of XXXX XXXX XXXX, it has been more than 45 days since the date of my original disputes, and I have yet to receive any response from Credit Bureaus. This is a direct violation of the FCRA, which mandates that the credit reporting agencies must provide the results of their investigation within the required time period. 

The failure of the Credit Bureaus to respond within the legal timeframe has significantly impacted my financial situation, as the inaccuracies on my credit report have remained unresolved. These inaccuracies may be affecting my credit score, access to financial services, and overall financial well-being.

Consumer complaint narrative: I just opened this card in XXXX, but never received the card in the mail. I called the credit card company to request a new card be sent because I never received the first XXXX. The credit card company said they were sending me a new card and were waiving all late fees. Once I got my credit card in the mail, I then made a credit card payment of my full balance minus the late fees because they said they were waiving the late fees. I even called a second time to make sure all of the late fees were being waived because it had been a couple months since I opened the account. They assured me they were waiving all late fees. Yet, then they reported a {$55.00} late fee as a missed payment to the credit bureau. Its the first missed payment that Ive had reported to the credit bureau in my 17 years of having a credit card. This late payment reporting reduced my credit score overnight by over XXXX points. I called the credit card company again after I saw this late payment posting, and they removed that late fee, but refused to remove the late payment reporting to the credit bureau.
