Product: Credit reporting or other personal consumer reports
Issue: Problem with a company's investigation into an existing problem
Sub-issue: Their investigation did not fix an error on your report
Consumer complaint narrative:
I am writing to dispute the continued reporting of accounts on my credit report that have not been properly verified, despite my requests for investigation. According to the Fair Credit Reporting Act ( FCRA ), specifically 15 U.S.C. 1681i ( Procedures in case of disputed accuracy ), you are required to conduct a reasonable investigation when a consumer disputes the accuracy of any information on their credit report. I have not received proper written notice of the results of any investigation, which is a violation of 15 U.S.C. 1681i ( a ) ( 6 ) ( Notification of results of reinvestigation ).

Furthermore, I question how you can verify that these accounts truly belong to me if you are not conducting a thorough investigation. If you can not provide documented proof of these accounts validity, you are legally obligated to remove them from my credit report under 15 U.S.C. 1681i ( a ) ( 5 ) ( Requirement to delete or modify information that can not be verified ). 

Additionally, I request that you remove any hard inquiries not associated with an open account, particularly those made within the last six months. Under 15 U.S.C. 1681b ( Permissible purposes of consumer reports ), inquiries can only be made with my explicit consent, and I have not applied for new credit recently. With the recent nationwide data breach in which my Social Security number was exposed, its possible that credit was applied for in my name without my knowledge.

Lastly, please ensure the removal of any duplicate information from my credit report, as accuracy is required under 15 U.S.C. 1681e ( b ) ( Compliance procedures ).

I trust you will follow the law and promptly investigate and correct the errors in my credit report. Failure to comply may result in further action to protect my rights. 

Account ( XXXX ) listed below : XXXX. XXXX XXXX XXXX. XXXX XXXX XXXX. XXXX XXXX I am writing to dispute the continued reporting of this account that was settled. As part of the settlement agreement with the company, they confirmed that they would no longer report this account on my credit report. Despite this, the account is still being reported. 
Please remove this account immediately, as its continued reporting is inconsistent with the terms of the settlement. 

XXXXXXXX XXXX XXXX  XXXX XXXX. XXXX XXXX this account that was paid in full. The account should reflect a XXXX balance, yet it continues to report an outstanding balance, which is inaccurate. 

If the credit bureaus or the creditor are unable to update the information to accurately reflect the paid status, I request that the account be removed or deleted from my credit report, as required by the Fair Credit Reporting Act ( FCRA ). 

XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX This account was previously removed from my credit report but has since been reinserted without proper notice. I was not notified of the reinsertion, which is a violation of my consumer rights under the Fair Credit Reporting Act. I kindly request that this issue be addressed immediately. 

XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX this account was sold to a debt buyer. 

I am also writing to request the removal of outdated and incorrect personal information from my credit report. Specifically, I have noticed that old and unverified addresses are still being reported. The only address that should be listed on my credit report is my current address. 

Please remove any old or unverified addresses, as they do not accurately reflect my current information. Thank you for your prompt attention to this matter. Old addresses are listed below : XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX Thank you for your prompt attention to this matter.

XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX TransUnion XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX I am filing a complaint against all three major credit reporting agenciesXXXX XXXX, and TransUnionregarding their failure to accurately report multiple accounts. I have formally disputed the following accounts, but they continue to reflect inaccurate and damaging information on my credit report : XXXX XXXX ( Account Number : XXXX ) Incorrect balance and inconsistent payment history. 

XXXX ( Account Number : XXXX ) Discrepancies in balance and payment status, resulting in a negative credit. 

XXXX XXXX XXXX ( Account Number : XXXX ) Reported collection account with inaccuracies in the date of the last payment and balance. 

XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX ( Account Number : XXXX XXXX ) Reported as a charge-off while currently in litigation under case number XXXX. 

These reporting errors are in direct violation of the Fair Credit Reporting Act ( FCRA ), specifically 15 USC 1681e ( b ), which requires credit reporting agencies to ensure maximum accuracy. The inaccuracies on my credit report have caused significant financial harm, hindering my ability to obtain necessary housing and transportation for my family. Additionally, the negative reporting has contributed to mental health issues such as anxiety and XXXX. 


I seek the assistance of the CFPB to ensure that these credit reporting agencies comply with the FCRA and correct these inaccuracies promptly.
Company public response: Company has responded to the consumer and the CFPB and chooses not to provide a public response

Product: Credit reporting or other personal consumer reports
Sub-issue: Reporting company used your report improperly
Consumer complaint narrative:
To Whomit May Concern This letter is being sent to you in response to a computer generated, unsigned letter dated XX/XX/2024 ( XXXX ), letter received by Claimant from your offices. Be advised that your claim is disputed and validation and proof of claim of the disputed debt is requested in accordance with the Fair Debt Collection Practices Act, 15 USC 1692 and as amended by adding the following new Title 8 USC 802 et seq., and the Fair Credit Billing Act, 15 USC. 1666 et seq. All of which work in conjunction with each other, including the Truth In Lending Act ( TILA ) 15 USC 1601 et seq. It is not now, nor has it ever been, my intention to avoid paying any obligation that is lawfully owed by the Claimant. I refuse to pay this alleged debt until the proper validation of this debt is provided. Please cease and desist all collection activities until you can properly validate this alleged debt.

15 USC1692c ( c ) Ceasing communication If a consumer notifies a debt collector in writing that the consumer refuses to pay a debt or that the consumer wishes the debt collector to cease further communication with the consumer, the debt collector shall not communicate further with the consumer with respect to such debt.

If proper validation of this alleged debt is not provided within XXXX  calendar days of receiving this notice, I will assume this alleged debt to be invalid and you shall delete this account and stop all collection activities regarding this account. In order to make arrangements to pay an obligation which may be lawfully owed, please document and verify the debt by complying, in good faith, with this request for validation and return it to me, within thirty ( XXXX  ) days of receipt of this letter.

This is NOT a request for verification or proof of Claimant mailing address, but a request for VALIDATION and PROOF OF CLAIM made pursuant to the above-named Titles and Sections. I respectfully request that your offices provide Claimant with competent evidence as per the attached Declaration and Proof of Claim that I have any legal obligation to pay you the unsubstantiated alleged debt.

Provide under Rule 1002. Requirement of the Original An original writing, recording, or photograph is required in order to prove its content unless these rules or a federal statute provides otherwise.

Furthermore, you shall cease all verbal communication. No phone calls, no text messages, no social media contact, no ringless voicemail contact, no email contact, the only communication must be through the UNITED STATES POST OFFICE, to the Claimant.

At this time I will also inform you that if your offices have reported invalidated information to any of the XXXX  major Consumer reporting agencies, such as, Equifax, XXXX and XXXX prior to validation and proof of claim of the disputed debt, this action might constitute fraud under both Federal and State Laws. Due to this fact ; if any negative mark is found on any of Claimant consumer reports by your company or the company that you represent, I will not hesitate in bringing legal action against you and your client for the following : Violation of the Fair Credit Reporting Act Violation of the Fair Debt Collection Practices Act Defamation of Character Violation of United States Code TITLE 18 PART 1 CHAPTER 63 1341 ( Mail Fraud ) This debt is considered to be invalid until I receive proper validation and your offices provide Claimant with proof of claim of the disputed debt. Your offices have XXXX  days to produce the required documentation in accordance with FTC guidelines. During this validation period and proof of claim, if any action is taken which could be considered detrimental to any of Claimant consumer reports, said action will be considered a dishonor and cause the self-executing contract portion of this notice to be implemented. This includes any listing any information to a consumer reporting repository that could be inaccurate or invalidated.

If your offices fail to respond to this validation and proof of claim request within XXXX  days from the date of your receipt, all references to this account must be deleted and completely removed from Claimant credit file and a copy of such deletion request shall be sent to Claimant immediately.

Title 8 USC 809. Validation of debts [ 15 USC 1692g ] ( b ) If the consumer notifies the debt collector in writing within the thirty-day period described in subsection ( a ) that the debt, or any portion thereof, is disputed, or that the consumer requests the name and address of the original creditor, the debt collector shall cease collection of the debt, or any disputed portion thereof, until the debt collector obtains verification of the debt or any copy of a judgment, or the name and address of the original creditor, and a copy of such verification or judgment, or name and address of the original creditor, is mailed to the consumer by the debt collector.

XXXX XXXX XXXX : VERIFICATION. Confirmation of correctness, truth, or authenticity, by affidavit, oath, or deposition.

In conjunction with the above request, upon further investigation I did not receive All MY TRUTH IN LENDING DISCLOSURES.

Provide me with my truth in lending disclosures 15 usc 1635 ( a ) The information and rescission forms required under this section together with a statement containing the material disclosures required under this subchapter.

The creditor shall clearly and conspicuously disclose, in accordance with regulations of the Bureau, to any obligor in a transaction subject to this section the rights of the obligor under this section.

The creditor shall also provide, in accordance with regulations of the Bureau, appropriate forms for the obligor to exercise his right to rescind any transaction subject to this section.

Under 15 U.S. Code 6802- Obligations with respect to disclosures of personal information You failed to prove me with the Required disclosures to OPT out of having my information reported. 
The law is very clear and before you reported my information to any nonaffiliated 3rd party ( Consumer Reporting Agencies ) you should have given me the following disclosures and you did not.

Provide me with the following ; ( a ) NOTICE REQUIREMENTS Except as otherwise provided in this subchapter, a financial institution may not, directly or through any affiliate, disclose to a nonaffiliated third party any nonpublic personal information, unless such financial institution provides or has provided to the consumer a notice that complies with section 6803 of this title.

( b ) OPT OUT ( 1 ) IN GENERALA financial institution may not disclose nonpublic personal information to a nonaffiliated third party unless ( A ) such financial institution clearly and conspicuously discloses to the consumer, in writing or in electronic form or other form permitted by the regulations prescribed under section 6804 of this title, that such information may be disclosed to such third party ; ( B ) the consumer is given the opportunity, before the time that such information is initially disclosed, to direct that such information not be disclosed to such third party ; and ( C ) the consumer is given an explanation of how the consumer can exercise that nondisclosure option.

Counter Claim with Self-executing Contract If Respondent, such as by commission, omission, and otherwise : ( a ) Fails to provide VALIDATION 15 usc 1692gb and PROOF OF CLAIM within thirty ( 30 ) days ; ( b ) All disclosures listed in this this correspondence ( c ) Makes a false representation of the character of the herein above-referenced alleged debt ; ( d ) Makes a false representation of the legal status of the herein above-referenced alleged debt ; ( e ) Makes any threat of action that can not legally be taken, in violation of any applicable law, such as, the law codified at the Fair Debt Collection Practices Act, will be construed to be Respondents tacit acceptance of the terms and condition stated herein. In which case RESPONDENT agrees to : ( f ) Voluntarily report this account to all consumer reporting agencies as paid as agreed ; and, ( g ) Voluntarily waive all claims against Claimant, their Agent or Heirs with prejudice ; and, ( h ) The matter regarding the alleged debt is finally and totally settled ; and, ( i ) Voluntarily admits the Claimant is the depositor for this account, that Respondent risked none of their assets at any time regarding this account and that they failed to disclose these material facts to Claimant ; and, ( i ) Voluntarily report the date of last activity on this account is the date of this notice.

Furthermore, RESPONDENTS failure to Cease and Desist in accordance with the requirements of the FDCPA and other related law, and/or satisfy the above terms and conditions, constitutes RESPONDENTS Breach of Duty and voluntary agreement to compensate Claimant, by certified mail, with a cashiers check within thirty ( 30 ) days of the date of billing by Claimant, their Agent or Heirs, in the following amounts : I ) II ) XXXX XXXXXXXX XXXX  ( {$1000.00} ) for each communication made to Claimant or their Agent or Heirs, whether telephonically or in writing, which is not in affidavit form, by a person who has first hand knowledge, regarding Respondents unsubstantiated claim ; and, XXXX XXXX XXXX  ( {$50000.00} ) for each transaction initiated by Claimant where Claimants commercial ability is impeded due to you, your agents or assigns adverse credit reporting ; and, III ) XXXXXXXX XXXX XXXX ( {$5000.00} ) for each court appearance Claimant, their Agent or Heirs makes in response to Respondents unsubstantiated claims ; and, IV ) RESPONDENT owes Claimant the balance equal to the purported credit limit on this account, plus interest and fees, for money lent; and, V ) Three times the alleged claim amount of XXXX XXXXXXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXXXXXX XXXX XXXX ( {$160000.00} ) which equals ( {$490000.00} ) ; and, VI ) XXXX XXXXXXXX XXXX ( {$5000.00} ) per occurrence, for listing or reporting any information to a credit reporting repository which could be considered detrimental to Claimants credit history ; and, VII ) Punitive damages in the amount of ( {$270000.00} ) ; and VIII ) Debt Collector tacitly agrees that Debt Collector will compensate Respondent for all costs ; fees and expenses incurred in defending against this and any and all continued collection attempts ( by anyone ) re the abovereferenced alleged account RESPONDENT also agrees to : 1. Voluntarily authorize Claimant to record a UCC-1 on RESPONDENT as debtor to secure the debt owed Claimant ; and, 2. Voluntarily prove their claim as a RESPONDENT in possession of Claimant property in a involuntary bankruptcy proceeding process ; and, 3. Voluntarily compensate Claimant for ALL costs and attorneys/consultant fees ; and, 4. Resolve ALL claims by Claimant, against Respondent, et al, exclusively and finally through binding arbitration, if necessary, to enforce the above terms, conditions, fees, penalties and damages. Arbitration replaces the right to go to court except to confirm an arbitration award. The arbitration organization that is selected will apply its code or procedure in effect at the time the arbitration is filed, subject to this agreement. The arbitration will be conducted before a single arbitrator. The arbitrators authority is limited solely to the Claims between Claimant and Respondent alone. The arbitration will not be consolidated with any other arbitration proceeding. If Claimant prevails in the arbitration of any Claim against Respondent, Respondent will reimburse Claimant for any fees Claimant paid to the arbitration organization in connection with the arbitration. Any decision rendered in such arbitration proceedings will be final and binding on the parties, and judgment may be entered in a court of competent jurisdiction. This arbitration provision applies to all Claims now in existence or that may arise in the future. The arbitration provision shall survive any voluntary payment of Claimants claim against Respondent, in full, or any bankruptcy by Respondent.

This is a private communication and is intended to affect an out-of-court settlement of this matter. Conduct yourself accordingly. Should any provision on this agreement be found to not be enforceable by order of a court of competent jurisdiction, it shall not adversely affect any other provision of this agreement and reasonable opportunity and effort shall be taken to modify it to become enforceable.

Equality under the Law is PARAMOUNT and MANDATORY by Law NOTICETOTHEPRINCIPALISNOTICETOTHEAGENT NOTICETOTHEAGENTISNOTICETOTHEPRINCIPAL Applicable to all successors and assigns Silence is Acquiescence/Agreement/Dishonor Executed on this XXXX day of XXXX, XXXX  by, XXXX XXXX You are the second party that has written a letter purporting to represent, or have as your client, XXXX XXXX Bank, the first was not registered as a debt collector in Maine and they have not answered the debt validation request presented to them. This is Notice that I do not recognize the Respondent from which the Claimant has received a computer generated debt collection attempt, and I must necessarily dispute part, or all, of the alleged until the following is received...

CREDITOR/DEBT COLLECTOR DECLARATION and PROOF OF CLAIM Please provide all of the following information and submit the appropriate forms and paperwork back to me along with an Affidavit signed In Accordance with 28 U.S.C. 1746 within 30 days from the date of your receipt of this request for validation and proof of claim.

1. Alleged Name and Address of Creditor 2. NameonFile of Alleged Debtor : 3. Alleged Account # : 4. Amount of alleged debt : 5. Date that this alleged debt became/becomes payable : 6. Date of original charge off or delinquency : 7. Amount paid if debt was purchased : 8. Please attach a copy of any signed agreement alleged debtor/claimant has made with debt collector, or other verifiable proof that debtor/claimant has a contractual obligation to pay debt collector.

9. Furnish a copy of the original promissory note/agreement redacting my social security number to prevent identity theft and state that your client named above is the holder in due course of the note agreement and will produce the original for my own and a judges inspection should there be a trial to contest these matters.

10. Produce the account and general ledger statement showing the full accounting of the alleged obligation that you are now attempting to collect. Such as ; FR 2046 balance sheet ( OMB # s 2XXXX XXXX XXXX  ), 1099 OID report, S-3/A registration XXXXstatement, 424-B5 prospectus, RC-S & RC-B call schedules 11. Identify by name and address all persons, corporations, associations, or any other parties having an interest in legal proceedings regarding the alleged debt.

12. Verified specifically, name ( s ) of person ( s ) assigned as Trustee to handle Corporations affairs and to be held accountable for the actions of the Corporation. Such as CFO and subordinates responsible for debt collections.

13. Verify as a third-party debt collector, you have not purchased evidence of the alleged debt and are proceeding with collection activity in the name of the original maker of the note.

14. Verify you know and understand that certain clauses in a contract of adhesion, such as a so-called forum selection clause, are unenforceable unless the party to whom the contract is extended could have rejected the clause without impunity.

15. Provide verification from the stated creditor that you are authorized to act for them.

16. Verify that you know and understand that contacting me again after receipt of this notice without providing procedurally proper validation of the debt constitutes the use of interstate communications in a scheme of fraud by advancing a writing, which you know is false with the intention that others rely on the written communication to their detriment a violation of United States Code TITLE 18 PART 1 CHAPTER 63 1341. Disputing the Debt, Dated this XXXX day of XXXX, XXXX  By : XXXX XXXX ( expressly all rights reserved ), Real Party in Interest, Live breathing man.

Sincerely, XXXX XXXX

Under 15 U.S. Code 1681e ( b ) Accuracy of report Whenever a consumer reporting agency prepares a consumer report, it shall follow reasonable procedures to assure the maximum possible accuracy of the information concerning the individual about whom the report relates.

15 U.S. Code 1681i ( 5 ) Treatment of inaccurate or unverifiable information ( A ) In general if, after any reinvestigation under paragraph ( 1 ) of any information disputed by a consumer, an item of the information is found to be inaccurate or incomplete or can not be verified, the consumer reporting agency shalli ) promptly delete that item of information from the file of the consumer, or modify that item of information, as appropriate, based on the results of the reinvestigation; and ( ii ) promptly notify the furnisher of that information that the information has been modified or deleted from the file of the consumer.

Sub-issue: Their investigation did not fix an error on your report
Consumer complaint narrative:
I am writing to formally dispute inaccurate information that you have reported on my credit report. The entry in question is as follows : Account Number : unknown Reported Amount : {$610.00} & {$610.00} Nature of Dispute : I believe the information is incorrect and unverified. ] Under the Fair Credit Reporting Act ( FCRA ), specifically Section 1681s-2 ( b ), furnishers of information are required to ensure that the information they provide is accurate and verifiable. Furthermore, Section 1681i of the FCRA mandates that upon receiving a dispute from a consumer, the credit reporting agency must conduct a reasonable investigation to ensure the accuracy and completeness of the information reported. 

I request that you investigate this matter thoroughly and provide me with a written response detailing the results of your investigation. If you are unable to verify the accuracy of this information, I expect it to be promptly corrected or removed from my credit report. Additionally, I request that you notify all three major credit bureaus ( XXXX, XXXX, and TransUnion ) of these corrections. 

Please be advised that if this matter is not resolved to my satisfaction within [ 30 ] days, I will consider all available legal remedies, including but not limited to seeking litigation for violations of the FCRA and any other applicable consumer protection laws. I would prefer to resolve this matter amicably and without the need for legal action, but I am prepared to take all necessary steps to ensure that my rights are protected.

Product: Credit reporting or other personal consumer reports
Credit reporting or other personal consumer reports
Issue: Problem with a company's investigation into an existing problem
Consumer complaint narrative:
Subject : FORMAL DISPUTE AND DEMAND FOR IMMEDIATE REMOVAL OF INACCURATE INFORMATION AND DEBT VALIDATION Account : XXXX XXXX - XXXX XXXX Account Numbers : XXXX Notice to Agent is Notice to Principle and Notice to Principle is Notice to Agent, I am writing to demand the immediate removal of inaccurate and conflicting information on my credit file for the accounts listed above. Under the Fair Credit Reporting Act ( FCRA ), you are legally required to report only accurate and verifiable information. Failure to comply with FCRA Section 611 mandates the removal or correction of inaccurate information within 30 days. 

Due to the recent XXXX XX/XX/XXXX data breach, which exposed sensitive consumer data, it is imperative that my information be handled with utmost care to mitigate risks of identity theft and fraud. 

Discrepancies in Reporting : The XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX account, under account number XXXX, exhibits significant inconsistencies : XXXX. Conflicting Status Update Dates : XXXX report lists a charge-off status update in XX/XX/XXXX, while another lists it in XX/XX/XXXX. 
XXXX. Payment History Mismatch : Inconsistencies in the payment history for charge-offs and delinquency periods between the XXXX accounts. 
XXXX. Missing Original Creditor Information : XXXX XXXX is listed as the original creditor in XXXX report but omitted in another. 
XXXX. Unverified Highest Balance Information : XXXX report states the highest balance as {$1900.00}, while the other omits this information. 

This conflicting information is unverifiable and does not accurately reflect my credit activity. Under FCRA Section 611, I demand the immediate removal of this account from my credit report. 

Demand for Debt Validation : Under the Fair Debt Collection Practices Act ( FDCPA ), I request full validation of this debt. You are required to provide : XXXX. Proof the debt belongs to me. 
XXXX. A full accounting of the balance, including how {$1800.00} was calculated. 
XXXX. Copies of the original signed agreement indicating my legal obligation to pay this debt. 
XXXX. Name and contact information of the original creditor, along with all related documentation. 

If this debt can not be fully validated within 30 days, you must remove it from my credit report and cease all reporting. Non-compliance will be considered a willful violation of FCRA Section 611 and FDCPA, prompting me to pursue all available legal remedies, including filing complaints with the CFPB and considering a lawsuit under federal law. 

Expectations for Resolution : An immediate investigation into this account is mandatory. Provide verifiable proof that this debt is mine and accurate, or remove this item from my credit report. 

Failure to resolve this matter within 30 days will result in : XXXX. Filing formal complaints with the CFPB and FTC. 
XXXX. Considering legal action for damages due to willful non-compliance under the FCRA, entitling me to statutory damages and compensation for harm caused by incorrect reporting. 

Given the data breach, the urgency of this matter can not be overstated. Notify me in writing of the investigation results and provide an updated copy of my credit report once changes are made. 

Thank you for your prompt attention to this serious matter. 

Sincerely, XXXX XXXX [ Agent/Beneficiary ] without prejudice, all natural inalienable rights reserved.

Product: Credit reporting or other personal consumer reports
Consumer complaint narrative:
My account with XXXXXXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX was never late! I have had exceptional payment history witH XXXX XXXX and all payments were placed on Autopay. This late payment that is reporting is a result on a systematic error on their end processing my payment.

This was clearly a billing error made my the company and is not a reflection of my payment experience which violates USC Code 1681eb. This error has caused severe hard to my reputation, my character, my mode of living and to my family!

I demand the late payment reported in to be removed.

They are not in compliance with the following law. 15 USC 1666b and its requirements set the standards and the guidance for a creditor to treat a payment as late, yet they are reporting a payment as late and they did not comply with the law!

15 USC 1666b ( a ) Time to make payments A creditor may not treat a payment on a credit card account under an open end consumer credit plan as late for any purpose, unless the creditor has adopted reasonable procedures designed to ensure that each periodic statement including the information required by section 1637 ( b ) of this title is mailed or delivered to the consumer not later than 21 days before the payment due date. 

XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX never sent the periodic statement along with the disclosures from section 1637 ( b ).

I have requested proof that this information was mailed or delivered 21 days before the payment due date and this information was requested in good faith pursuant rule 1002 and It was never provided.

This is unfair, illegal, fraudulent, and not equitable to me as a consumer!

Delete the late payments from my consumer reports

Consumer complaint narrative:
This letter serves as my final attempt to resolve this matter before escalating to legal proceedings. Despite multiple previous disputes and my clear evidence that these accounts are inaccurately reported, you have failed to remove the erroneous information from my credit report. Your continued reporting of these items is a direct violation of the Fair Credit Reporting Act ( FCRA ) and the Fair Debt Collection Practices Act ( FDCPA ). 

Violations include but are not limited to : Failure to Conduct a Proper Investigation : As required under 15 USC 1681i ( a ) ( 1 ), credit reporting agencies must conduct a reasonable investigation of any disputed items. Your investigations have clearly been inadequate, as the same inaccurate information remains on my credit report. 

Reporting Inaccurate Information : Under 15 USC 1681s-2 ( a ) ( 1 ), furnishers of information are required to provide accurate information. These accounts are incorrect and have not been verified with my signed consent. 

Failure to Respond to Dispute : As per FCRA 611 ( a ) ( 1 ) ( A ), you are required to respond to disputes within 30 days. Your repeated failure to adequately address my disputes is unacceptable. 

I have provided clear evidence that the accounts listed below are not mine and should not be reported under my credit file :

Consumer complaint narrative:
XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXXXXXX, MI XXXX XXXX XXXX Dear Navy Federal Credit Union, I hope this letter finds you well. I am writing to humbly request your consideration for a goodwill adjustment regarding my account and the late payments that occurred during XXXX and XXXX of XXXX. 
I understand the importance of maintaining a good payment history, and it is with a heavy XXXX that I find myself in this position. Unfortunately, during that time, I faced a series of deeply XXXX  personal events that severely impacted my ability to meet my financial obligations. 
In early XXXX, my mother, who had been battling a XXXX XXXX for several years, experienced a significant health crisis that required my immediate attention and care. The situation escalated quickly, leading to a hospitalization that kept her in critical condition for weeks. As her XXXX XXXX I found myself torn between managing her medical needs and maintaining my responsibilities at work. The overwhelming stress and emotional toll of watching my mother suffer was indescribable. 
To make matters worse, shortly after my XXXX XXXX XXXX, I was involved in a XXXX XXXX XXXX while rushing to the hospital to be by her side. The XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX that made even the simplest daily tasks feel like XXXX  challenges. During this time, my focus was solely on family and recovery, and as a result, I fell behind on important financial commitments, including my payments to XXXX XXXX. 
I take my credit obligations seriously, and it pains me to have these late payments on my record. Thankfully, my mother has since shown signs of recovery, and I am in a better place both emotionally and physically. I am now ready to stabilize my finances and commit to paying off my account in full. 
Given these circumstances, I kindly ask for your understanding and support in removing the late payment marks for XXXX and XXXX. This goodwill adjustment would not only help restore my credit standing but also alleviate a significant burden as I work to rebuild my life after these trying months. I assure you of my continued commitment to timely payments moving forward. 
Thank you for considering my request. I appreciate your understanding and compassion during this difficult time. I look forward to your positive response and hope to continue my relationship with Navy Federal Credit Union. 
Warm regards, XXXX XXXX

Product: Credit reporting or other personal consumer reports
Sub-issue: Reporting company used your report improperly
Consumer complaint narrative:
XX/XX/XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX, TX XXXX Re : Request for Reinvestigation and Removal of Inaccurate Information under 15 USC 1681i ( a ) ( 5 ) ( A ) To Whom It May Concern, I am writing to formally dispute the accuracy of several accounts that are currently listed on my consumer credit report. Under the Fair Credit Reporting Act, I understand that you are required to follow reasonable procedures to ensure maximum possible accuracy of the information in my consumer file. 

However, I believe that the following accounts contain inaccuracies, and I request that you conduct a reasonable reinvestigation to determine whether the disputed information is inaccurate. Please delete the following items from my consumer file in accordance with 15 USC 1681i ( a ) ( 5 ) ( A ) : 1. Account XXXX : XXXX Account Number : XXXX Inaccuracy : The information reported for this account across the three credit bureaus contains discrepancies, including incorrect payment statuses, balance information, and reporting dates. 
Specifics : 1. Payment Status Discrepancy : o XXXX reports the payment status as " Collection/Chargeoff '' with several " CO '' ( charge-off ) notations from XX/XX/XXXX through XX/XX/XXXX, but no " CO '' notation for XX/XX/XXXX, despite the account being reported as derogatory. 
o Equifax also reports the payment status as " Collection/Chargeoff '' with charge-off notations for multiple months. However, no " CO '' notation is reported for XX/XX/XXXX and XX/XX/XXXX. 
o XXXX does not report any payment history, which is inconsistent with the other bureaus. 
2. Balance Inconsistency : o XXXX reports a balance owed of {$460.00} with a past due amount of {$460.00} as of XX/XX/XXXX, but also lists a " High Balance '' as {$0.00}. 
o Equifax reports the same balance of {$460.00}, but the high balance is also listed as {$460.00}, which differs from XXXX 's report. 
XXXX. Account Status Discrepancy : o XXXX reports the account as " Closed '' with a status of " Collection/Chargeoff '' but also notes " Customer disputed account - reported by subscriber, '' indicating a dispute that is no longer active. 
o Equifax reports the account status as " Closed '' with a status of " Collection/Chargeoff '' and indicates " Consumer disputes this account information, '' but does not clarify whether the dispute is resolved. 
4. Date Discrepancies : o The Date of Last Activity reported by XXXX is XX/XX/XXXX, while Equifax reports it as XX/XX/XXXX. The Last Verified dates and Date Reported dates also do not match across the bureaus, with XXXXreporting XX/XX/XXXX and XX/XX/XXXX, respectively, and Equifax reporting XX/XX/XXXX and XX/XX/XXXX. 
5. Remarks Discrepancy : o XXXX includes remarks such as " Customer disputed account - reported by subscriber, '' whereas Equifax states " Consumer disputes this account information '' without clarity on the resolution status, indicating potential inaccuracies in the reporting of the dispute status. 


2. Account Name : XXXX XXXX XXXXXXXX Account Number : XXXX Inaccuracy : The reporting for this account shows several inconsistencies across the credit bureaus, particularly regarding payment status, balance owed, and account history. 
Specifics : 1. Balance Inconsistency : o XXXX reports a balance of {$0.00} as of XX/XX/XXXX, while XXXX and Equifax report a balance of {$190.00} on the same date. 
2. Payment Status Discrepancy : o XXXX lists the payment status as " Late 30 Days '' and " Settled - less than full balance, '' whereas XXXX and Equifax report the account as " Collection/Chargeoff '' with varying charge-off dates. 
3. Account Remarks Discrepancy : o XXXX and Equifax mention " Unpaid balance reported as a loss by the credit grantor '' and " Accounts closed by credit grantor, '' but XXXX does not include these remarks. 
4. Date Discrepancy : o The Date of Last Activity is reported as XX/XX/XXXX by XXXX, but XXXX and Equifax report it as XX/XX/XXXX. 
5. Payment History Inconsistencies : o XXXX shows different late payment notations compared to XXXX and Equifax, with varying " 30, '' " 60, '' " 90, '' and " 120 days late '' entries, leading to conflicting payment histories. 



Please complete this reinvestigation within the 15 days allowed by law and provide me with written confirmation of the results of your investigation. If the information can not be verified, I request that these items be deleted from my consumer file and that you forward any corrections to all relevant parties who received my credit report in the past six months.

Thank you for your prompt attention to this matter. Please send any updates regarding this dispute to the address listed above. 

Sincerely, XXXX XXXX XXXX

I did not approve these transactions to be included in my consumer report, neither in writing nor verbally. Therefore, I formally request that these accounts be blocked and removed from my record. This is not a mistake or a misrepresentation. These transactions were included without my explicit consent or instruction. 

I am stressing this to highlight the seriousness of my request. It is based on accurate information, and I am not attempting to deceive or manipulate the situation in any way. My intent is solely to ensure that my consumer report reflects only those transactions that I have authorized. I am committed to maintaining the integrity of my financial records and ensuring that they are accurate and truthful. My request is genuine and aimed at correcting an unauthorized inclusion, not at exploiting any system or misleading any party involved.

Consumer complaint narrative:
Subject : Failure to Provide Proper Validation and Verification of Disputed Credit Report Items Dear CFPB, I am filing this complaint to address the failure of both Equifax and certain collection agencies to provide the required validation and verification documentation for several accounts I disputed. Despite my attempts to resolve these disputes through the proper channels, I was not provided with the appropriate validation of these debts, as required under the Fair Credit Reporting Act ( FCRA ) and the Fair Debt Collection Practices Act ( FDCPA ). 

Details of the Complaint : 1. Collection Agency : XXXX XXXX Account Number : XXXX Original Creditor : XXXX  Original Amount : {$290.00} Dispute Outcome : Verified as accurate, but no supporting validation or verification documents were provided. 
Despite my dispute, I was informed that this account " belongs to me '' without any proof, such as a signed contract or a detailed statement outlining the debt. 
2. Collection Agency : XXXX XXXX XXXX. 
Account Numbers : XXXX, XXXX, XXXX Original Creditor : XXXX XXXX XXXXXXXX. 
Original Amounts : {$40.00}, {$130.00}, {$39.00} ( balance amounts updated to {$49.00}, {$170.00}, and {$53.00}, respectively ) Dispute Outcome : Verified as accurate, with some fields updated, but no supporting validation documents were provided. These utility accounts were reported as being delinquent, but the collection agency failed to provide any original agreements, billing details, or verification showing that I owe these amounts. 
XXXX. Deletion of Items by XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX 
Account Numbers : XXXX and XXXX Dispute Outcome : These items were deleted after investigation, which implies that these debts were likely unverifiable. 
While this is a step in the right direction, it further demonstrates the overall lack of diligence in verifying the accuracy of items on my credit report. 
My Complaint : In each of these cases, I requested proper validation and verification of the debts in accordance with my rights under the FCRA and FDCPA. However, I was not provided with any documentation proving the validity of the debts, such as : Original contracts or signed agreements. 
Billing statements showing the origin of the debt and the amounts. 
Proof that these debts were legitimately assigned or sold to the collection agencies. 
Instead, the reporting agencies and collection agencies merely " verified '' the debts without offering any tangible proof or explanation. This practice violates my rights as a consumer to verify the accuracy of debts that are negatively impacting my credit report. 

Action Requested : I request that the CFPB : Investigate the failure of Equifax, XXXX XXXX, and XXXX XXXX XXXX to provide the required validation and verification documentation. 
Ensure that these disputed items are either validated with proper documentation or removed from my credit report. 
Provide any remedies available under the FCRA and FDCPA for non-compliance, including removing unverifiable accounts from my report. 
I have attached a copy of the dispute results from Equifax for your reference. 

Thank you for your time and attention to this matter. Please feel free to contact me if additional information or documentation is required. 

Sincerely, XXXX XXXX XXXX Address : XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX

Consumer complaint narrative:
My account with XXXX XXXX XXXX was never late! I have had exceptional payment history witH XXXX XXXX and all payments were placed on Autopay. This late payment that is reporting is a result on a systematic error on their end processing my payment. 

This was clearly a billing error made my the company and is not a reflection of my payment experience which violates USC Code 1681eb. This error has caused severe hard to my reputation, my character, my mode of living and to my family! 

I demand the late payment reported to be removed. 

They are not in compliance with the following law. 15 USC 1666b and its requirements set the standards and the guidance for a creditor to treat a payment as late, yet they are reporting a payment as late and they did not comply with the law! 

15 USC 1666b ( a ) Time to make payments A creditor may not treat a payment on a credit card account under an open end consumer credit plan as late for any purpose, unless the creditor has adopted reasonable procedures designed to ensure that each periodic statement including the information required by section 1637 ( b ) of this title is mailed or delivered to the consumer not later than 21 days before the payment due date. 

XXXX XXXX XXXX  never sent the periodic statement along with the disclosures from section 1637 ( b ). 

I have requested proof that this information was mailed or delivered 21 days before the payment due date and this information was requested in good faith pursuant rule 1002 and It was never provided. 

This is unfair, illegal, fraudulent, and not equitable to me as a consumer! 

Delete the late payments from my consumer reports

Consumer complaint narrative:
Dear XXXX XXXX  and CFPB, I am writing to formally dispute the inaccurate, outdated, and misleading information associated with my credit report regarding the account listed by XXXX XXXX. This account contains numerous discrepancies that not only misrepresent my financial history but also jeopardize my credit health and overall quality of life. 

The following inaccuracies have been identified in the report : 1. **Unverified Information** : The report indicates a " Balance Owed '' of {$500.00}, with the " Last Verified '' date marked as " - ''. This lack of verification raises serious concerns about the legitimacy of this account. Under 15 USC 1681e ( b ), I am entitled to have accurate information reported, and it is clear that this account fails to meet that standard.

2. **Outdated Activity Dates** : The " Date of Last Activity '' is listed as XX/XX/XXXX, yet the " Date Reported '' is XX/XX/XXXX. This discrepancy implies that the information being reported is not current and reflects poorly on my credit history. Such inaccuracies can lead to unjust penalties on my credit score and may hinder my ability to secure loans or favorable interest rates.

3. **Misleading Account Status** : The report states that the " Account Status '' is " Open '' with a " Payment Status '' of " Late 120 Days. '' This misleading information suggests that I am not maintaining my financial obligations, which is simply untrue. Additionally, the " Dispute Status '' indicates that this account is under investigation, yet every time I have reached out to Equifax regarding this matter, the account remains marked as " being verified. '' This ongoing ambiguity creates a negative impact on my credit health and personal finances.

4. **Consumer Rights Violations** : The inaccuracies present in this report violate my rights under 15 USC 1681e ( b ), which requires consumer reporting agencies to follow reasonable procedures to ensure maximum possible accuracy of the information they report. Additionally, 15 USC 1681i mandates that consumers have the right to dispute inaccuracies in their reports and to have them corrected in a timely manner. 

The ongoing presence of this inaccurate and misleading information on my credit report has a profound impact on my life. It limits my access to credit, increases my financial burdens, and causes undue stress and anxiety regarding my financial future. I have made numerous attempts to resolve this issue with Equifax, yet their investigations have yielded no resolution, leaving me in a state of uncertainty and frustration. 

Given the severity of these issues, I respectfully request that XXXX XXXX immediately conduct a thorough investigation into this account and take corrective action to ensure that my credit report accurately reflects my financial history. I expect the necessary updates to my account to be completed promptly, as my financial well-being depends on it. 

I appreciate your attention to this matter and look forward to your prompt response. 

Sincerely, XXXX XXXX XXXX : XXXX

Consumer complaint narrative:
In accordance with the Fair Credit Reporting Act, the accounts listed below have violated my federally protected consumer rights to privacy and confidentiality under 15 U.S.C. 1681. The following accounts have violated my rights : XXXX XXXX XXXX  XXXX XXXX : # XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX Upon reviewing my Equifax credit report on XX/XX/year>, I noticed several inaccuracies and incomplete information. According to the Fair Credit Reporting Act, whenever a consumer reporting agency prepares a consumer report, it is required to follow reasonable procedures to ensure maximum possible accuracy of the information concerning the individual to whom the report relates ( 15 U.S.C. 1681e ( b ) ).

Furthermore, under 15 U.S.C. 1681i ( 5 ), it is stated that : ( A ) In general, if after any reinvestigation under paragraph ( 1 ) of any information disputed by a consumer, an item of information is found to be inaccurate, incomplete, or can not be verified, the consumer reporting agency shall : ( i ) Promptly delete that item of information from the consumer 's file or modify it as appropriate, based on the results of the reinvestigation. 
( ii ) Promptly notify the furnisher of that information that the information has been modified or deleted from the consumer 's file. 
Additionally, according to 15 U.S.C. 1681s-2, a person is prohibited from furnishing any information relating to a consumer to any consumer reporting agency if the person knows or has reasonable cause to believe that the information is inaccurate.

Product: Mortgage
Consumer complaint narrative:
I needed help with property taxes because of the pandemic and hurricane Ida damage. Three years ago, I started seeking help from NJ for the mold and rodent problem caused by Ida. No help there. 
Carrington paid the taxes to help but added items to what I owed them, especially in determining residency and appraisers, etc. Currently, I owe them some {$28000.00} outside of the {$300000.00}. Unbeknownst to me they went ahead with foreclosure and now a sheriff 's sale on XX/XX/XXXX. I had asked for a postponement XX/XX/XXXX because of medical issues. In the meantime I held out hope for financial assistance from the state. I figured if I could fix the mold and rodent problems, I would be able to get a fair market value for the sale of the house rather than foreclosure. XXXX is interested in another class action against Carrington and asked me to be a plaintiff. This involves padding charges, charging for services not necessarily done. I contacted Carrington for a total list of transactions on my account on XX/XX/XXXX. 
I am XXXX XXXX XXXXr on a fixed income. My home is where my business is. I have not been able to work full time as that area is where the mold is. 
Carrington has been very hard to contact or communicate with. I have used email, snail mail and fax. I called a number and person to call. I left a voicemail which was never answered. Their law firm served me in XXXX. They asked for info which I sent them to ask for a chance to get on my feet as I had surgeries scheduled. They never acknowledged it. The next item was to respond to them about disputing charges. I did but they did not acknowledge it. My next thing I know is the sheriff 's sale is on. I have known this since early last week. Today I received their letter about the sheriff 's sale. If Carrington and their law firm had written before or at least kept me in the loop, I believe I would have had time to try more avenues for relief. They strung me along and bam - the sheriff 's sale. I did not choose Carrington. The original lender was XXXX Mortgage who sold it to XXXX which went bankrupt and Carrington took over. Please caution older people about reverse mortgages. Rules and regulations were changed after I got the mortgage. I tried to refinance when I had more assets at least 4 times. Now my only assets are a XXXX XXXX XXXX cargo van and my artwork.

Consumer complaint narrative:
Heres the revised letter addressed to TransUnion : -- - **TransUnion** XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX, PA XXXX Subject : Immediate Removal of Fraudulent Collection Account from Credit Report To Whom It May Concern, I am writing to dispute the results of your recent investigation regarding a fraudulent collection account on my credit report. The account in question, reported by XXXXXXXX XXXX XXXX, is not mine and the conclusion that it is accurate is **false**. I am a victim of identity theft and demand that this fraudulent account be removed from my credit report **as soon as possible**. 

I have never conducted any business with XXXX XXXX XXXX or the original creditor associated with this account. Additionally, I have filed a police report with the XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX to document the identity theft : - **Police Report Number** : XXXX - **Officer in Charge** : XXXX. XXXX ( # XXXX ) This fraudulent account was placed on my credit report without any prior communication from the original creditor. Moreover, I was contacted by XXXX XXXX  XXXX representatives, who unlawfully threatened legal action if I did not pay this debt, which is a violation of the Fair Debt Collection Practices Act ( FDCPA ), 15 U.S.C. 1692d.

As per my rights under the Fair Credit Reporting Act ( FCRA ), 15 U.S.C. 1681, I demand the **immediate removal** of this account from my credit report. You are required to ensure that only accurate and verifiable information appears on my credit report, and this account is clearly fraudulent. I expect written confirmation of its deletion within 30 days of receiving this letter. 

If this matter is not resolved promptly, I will have no choice but to escalate the issue, including filing complaints with the Consumer Financial Protection Bureau ( CFPB ), the Federal Trade Commission ( FTC ), and seeking all available legal remedies. 

Thank you for your attention to this urgent matter. I look forward to your prompt response and resolution. 

Sincerely, XXXX XXXX

Consumer complaint narrative:
XX/XX/XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX, FL XXXX Subject : Request for Reinvestigation and Removal of Inaccurate Information ( 3rd Time ) Reference : Fair Credit Reporting Act ( 15 USC 1681i ( a ) ( 5 ) ( A ) ) Dear CFPB I am writing to formally request a reinvestigation of the following accounts listed in my consumer file, which I believe contain inaccurate information. As per the Fair Credit Reporting Act ( 15 USC 1681i ( a ) ( 5 ) ( A ) ), you are required to follow reasonable procedures to assure maximum possible accuracy of the information concerning me in my consumer file. 
Despite previous disputes, the following accounts continue to reflect incorrect details. I urge you to conduct a thorough and reasonable reinvestigation to determine the accuracy of this information and delete the inaccurate items from my consumer file. 
Account Name/Account Number : XXXX XXXX XXXXXXXX / [ Account Number XXXX ] Inaccuracy : There are significant discrepancies in the reporting of the account information across different credit bureaus, particularly concerning payment history, balance details, and account status. 
Specifics : High Balance : TransUnion reports a high balance of {$13000.00}, while XXXX reports {$0.00}. This inconsistency suggests that the high balance information has not been accurately updated across bureaus. 
Last Verified Date : TransUnion lists the last verified date as XX/XX/XXXX, but XXXX does not report a verification date. This lack of consistency indicates that the account verification process may not have been applied uniformly. 
Date of Last Activity : Both TransUnion and XXXX report the date of last activity as XX/XX/XXXX ; however, the subsequent account activity reported by TransUnion suggests ongoing discrepancies. The last activity date should be accurately verified. 
Date Reported : TransUnion reports the date as XX/XX/XXXX, while XXXX lists it as XX/XX/XXXX. The accurate date reported should be consistent across both bureaus. 
Balance Owed : Both TransUnion and XXXX show a balance owed of {$0.00}, but the payment history and account status suggest discrepancies in how this account was closed or charged off. This needs to be verified and corrected. 
Closed Date : TransUnion reports a closed date of XX/XX/XXXX, but XXXX does not provide a closed date. The closed date should be consistent and accurate across all reports. 
Account Status : Both bureaus report the account as " Paid, '' but TransUnion includes the remark " Payment after charge off/collection '' and " Canceled by credit grantor, '' while XXXX states, " Account has been closed due to inactivity '' and " Unpaid balance reported as a loss by credit grantor. '' These differences in status and remarks should be reconciled and accurately reflected in all reports. 
Payment History : XXXX reports delinquencies ( 30 days late in March 2024, 60 days late in XXXX and XX/XX/XXXX, etc. ), while TransUnion shows no late payments reported. This discrepancy in payment history should be thoroughly investigated and corrected. 
Days Late - 7 Year History : TransUnion reports no late payments, while XXXX reports late payments in multiple months. This inconsistency must be addressed to ensure the accurate reporting of the payment history. 

Action Requested : Please conduct a comprehensive reinvestigation to ensure that all details, including the high balance, payment history, account status, and remarks, are accurately and consistently reported across all three credit bureaus. Any inaccuracies or inconsistencies should be corrected or deleted from my consumer file as required by the Fair Credit Reporting Act. 
You have 15 days from the receipt of this letter to conduct a reasonable investigation and rectify the inaccuracies as required by law. I expect all necessary changes to be made to my consumer file and for these changes to be forwarded to me at the address provided above. 
Please consider this my formal request for a reinvestigation and ensure that the inaccuracies are corrected promptly. I look forward to receiving confirmation of the changes made to my file. 
Thank you for your prompt attention to this matter. 
Sincerely, XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX

Consumer complaint narrative:
My account with XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX  was never late! I have had exceptional payment history witH XXXX XXXX and all payments were placed on Autopay. This late payment that is reporting is a result on a systematic error on their end processing my payment.

This was clearly a billing error made my the company and is not a reflection of my payment experience which violates USC Code 1681eb. This error has caused severe hard to my reputation, my character, my mode of living and to my family! 

I demand the late payment reported in XXXX, XXXX, AND XXXX to be removed. 

They are not in compliance with the following law. 15 USC 1666b and its requirements set the standards and the guidance for a creditor to treat a payment as late, yet they are reporting a payment as late and they did not comply with the law!

15 USC 1666b ( a ) Time to make payments A creditor may not treat a payment on a credit card account under an open end consumer credit plan as late for any purpose, unless the creditor has adopted reasonable procedures designed to ensure that each periodic statement including the information required by section 1637 ( b ) of this title is mailed or delivered to the consumer not later than 21 days before the payment due date. 

XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXXXXXX never sent the periodic statement along with the disclosures from section 1637 ( b ).

I have requested proof that this information was mailed or delivered 21 days before the payment due date and this information was requested in good faith pursuant rule 1002 and It was never provided.

This is unfair, illegal, fraudulent, and not equitable to me as a consumer!

Delete the late payments from my consumer reports

Consumer complaint narrative:
My account with this company is being reported late and i was never late! I have had exceptional payment history with this company and all payments were placed on Autopay. This late payment that is reporting is a result on a systematic error on their end processing my payment.

This was clearly a billing error made my the company and is not a reflection of my payment experience which violates USC Code 1681eb. This error has caused severe hard to my reputation, my character, my mode of living and to my family! 

I demand the late payment reported in MONTHS REPORTING LATE to be removed They are not in compliance with the following law. 15 USC 1666b and its requirements set the standards and the guidance for a creditor to treat a payment as late, yet they are reporting a payment as late and they did not comply with the law!

15 USC 1666b ( a ) Time to make payments A creditor may not treat a payment on a credit card account under an open end consumer credit plan as late for any purpose, unless the creditor has adopted reasonable procedures designed to ensure that each periodic statement including the information required by section 1637 ( b ) of this title is mailed or delivered to the consumer not later than 21 days before the payment due date.

This company never sent the periodic statement along with the disclosures from section 1637 ( b ).

I have requested proof that this information was mailed or delivered 21 days before the payment due date and this information was requested in good faith pursuant rule 1002 and It was never provided.

This is unfair, illegal, fraudulent, and not equitable to me as a consumer!

Delete the late payments from my consumer reports.

Consumer complaint narrative: I Have recently received a copy of my ( XXXX or TransUnion ) consumer report, and I noticed that it is reporting my experience with this company. The line of credit I have with this company, which is characterized as Debt collection on my consumer reports. THIS COMPANY IS ILLEGALLY REPORTING THIS EXPERIENCE ( Debt collection ) on my consumer reports! XXXX this company is in clear violation of the law. Pursuant 15 USC 1681a 2 ( A ) ( i ) EXCLUSIONS- Except as provided in paragraph ( 3 ), the term consumer report does not include ( A ) subject to section 1681s3 of this title, any ( i ) report containing information solely as to transactions or experiences between the consumer and the person making the report ; THE LAW CLEARLY STATES : Transactions or Experiences between the consumer ( ME ) and the person ( YOU ) ( XXXX ) Making the report is NOT INCLUDED on my Consumer report! Debt collection is an experience with the line of credit that was extended between the consumer ( ME ) and the person ( YOU ) [ XXXX ] that is making the report. CONGRESS clearly states that the reporting of Transactions or experiences between the CONSUMER and the PERSON making the report is not included on the consumer reports! YOU HAVE VIOLATED THE FCRA 15USC 1681a 2Ai by reporting this transaction or experience ( Utilization ) on my consumer reports which CONGRESS clearly states IS NOT included on my CONSUMER REPORTS. You have 10 calendar days to update my utilization to 5 % or below and or delete all Utilization from the below account/s XXXX Failure to respond satisfactorily with deletion of the above Debt collection, will result in legal actions being taken against your company, for which I will also be seeking { {$1000.00} } per violation for : 1. Defamation of Character 2. Negligent Non-Compliance 3. Civil Liability 4. Mental Anguish 5. Fair Credit Reporting Act 15USC 1681 violations for willful noncompliance - 616. Civil liability for willful noncompliance [ 15 U.S.C. 1681n ] Best regards, XXXX

Issue: Problem with a company's investigation into an existing problem
Sub-issue: Their investigation did not fix an error on your report
Consumer complaint narrative:
I have been disputing with TransUnion Credit Bureau since 2019 regarding account XXXX XXXX. This account was deleted twice for inaccurate information. According to the Fair Credit Reporting Act ( FCRA ), specifically 15 U.S.C. 1681i ( a ) ( 5 ) ( B ), if a previously deleted item is reinserted into a consumer 's credit report, I am entitled to be notified within XXXX business days of the reinsertion. I have not received such notification, and I believe that this item has been reinserted improperly. 
This account has been reported as a charge-off since XXXX  2019. I have not received a 1099C from the company or the IRS stating that my account has been filed as a charge-off since XX/XX/2019. This account is also reporting a charge-off in XXXX  2019, showing a XXXX  in XXXX  2019 and XXXX  2019. This is very inaccurate and misleading information. 
This account is reporting the last payment was made in XXXX XXXX  2020 this statement is inaccurate information. 
Under the Fair Credit Reporting Act ( FCRA ), specifically 15 U.S.C. 1681s-2 ( a ), furnishers of information are required to provide accurate information. Repeatedly reporting the same XXXX and Charge off as new violates has lead to a distortion of my creditworthiness. 
Additionally, according to 15 U.S.C. 1681e ( b ), you, as a credit reporting agency, are required to follow reasonable procedures to ensure the maximum possible accuracy in the information reported. The presence of these duplicate entries is a clear indication that this standard has not been met. 
15 U.S.C. 1681e ( b ), credit reporting agencies are required to follow reasonable procedures to ensure the maximum possible accuracy of the information they report. The dates listed for my account do not reflect the correct information, which results in an inaccurate portrayal of my payment history. 
Furthermore, 15 U.S.C. 1681c places specific limits on the length of time that negative information, such as delinquencies, may remain on a consumers credit report. Reporting an incorrect date of first delinquency could result in unfairly prolonging the negative impact on my credit.

Product: Credit reporting or other personal consumer reports
Issue: Problem with a company's investigation into an existing problem
Sub-issue: Difficulty submitting a dispute or getting information about a dispute over the phone
Consumer complaint narrative:
I am filing a formal complaint against TransUnion LLC for their improper handling of my request to block fraudulent inquiries and their failure to provide adequate assistance in resolving this matter. My name is XXXX XXXX, and my file number is XXXX. 

**Background : ** On XX/XX/2024, I received an unsatisfactory and unsupported response from TransUnion concerning my request to block fraudulent inquiries. TransUnion incorrectly declined to block inquiries made by XXXX ( XX/XX/2024 ) and XXXX XXXX XXXXXXXX ( XX/XX/2024 ), claiming that the Federal Trade Commission ( FTC ) Identity Theft Report I submitted was not a valid document. This decision is inconsistent with the requirements of the Fair Credit Reporting Act ( FCRA ) and California state laws. 

**Specific Issues : ** 1. **Refusal to Block Fraudulent Inquiries : ** Despite providing a valid FTC Identity Theft Report ( Report Number : XXXX ), which complies with both federal and state laws, TransUnion refused to block the fraudulent inquiries. This refusal violates FCRA Section 605B and California Civil Code 1798.92.

2. **Inadequate Phone Assistance : ** I have attempted to follow up on this issue via phone. During these calls, representatives disconnected the line, refused assistance, and provided misleading information about protocols and procedures. This pattern of behavior has included : - Representatives disconnecting calls without resolution. 
- Misleading statements regarding dispute processes. 
- Refusal to acknowledge or act upon the valid documentation I provided. 

**Violation of Federal and State Laws : ** - **Federal Law ( FCRA, Section 605B ) : ** Under FCRA, TransUnion is obligated to block fraudulent information when provided with a valid FTC Identity Theft Report. Their refusal to comply violates this requirement.

- **California State Law : ** The California Identity Theft Act mandates that credit reporting agencies must promptly investigate and block fraudulent accounts upon receiving proper documentation. TransUnion 's failure to act on the FTC Identity Theft Report contravenes this law as well. 

**Details of the Fraudulent Inquiries : ** - **XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX ** These inquiries were unauthorized and result from identity theft. The continued presence of these inquiries on my credit report is harming my credit standing and financial opportunities. 

**Actions Requested : ** I request the CFPB to intervene and compel TransUnion to : 1. Immediately block the fraudulent inquiries from XXXX and XXXX XXXX XXXXXXXX. 
2. Comply with FCRA Section 605B and California Civil Code 1798.92.

3. Provide a detailed explanation of their investigation methods, including all communications with XXXX, XXXX XXXX XXXXXXXX, and any other relevant parties. 
4. Provide me with an updated credit report reflecting the removal of the fraudulent inquiries.

5. Ensure that TransUnion ceases further violations of my consumer rights under federal and state laws. 

**Supporting Documentation : ** - FTC Identity Theft Report ( Report Number : XXXX ) - TransUnion Response ( Dated : XX/XX/2024 ) - Records of phone calls with TransUnion representatives TransUnions refusal to address my legitimate concerns and their improper handling of my disputes is a clear violation of consumer protection laws. I respectfully request that the CFPB investigate this matter and enforce appropriate actions to protect my rights as a victim of identity theft.

Consumer complaint narrative:
I am writing to dispute unauthorized hard inquiries that appear on my credit report. These inquiries were made without my knowledge or consent and may involve the fraudulent use of my personal information, a violation of **18 USC 1028**, which addresses fraud related to identification documents, authentication features, and personal identity information.

The details of the unauthorized inquiries are as follows : I did not authorize these inquiries and have not applied for any credit or services from these companies. Given the serious nature of identity fraud under **18 USC 1028**, I request that you take immediate action to : 1. **Remove these unauthorized hard inquiries** from my credit report.

2. Conduct an investigation into the inquiries in accordance with the Fair Credit Reporting Act ( FCRA ), and provide me with a written statement of the findings.

3. Provide any documentation or evidence that these inquiries were authorized by me, if such records exist.

Enclosed are copies of my identification, a copy of the relevant pages of my credit report showing the inquiries, and any additional supporting documents.

Failure to act on this matter may result in further action, including filing complaints with the Consumer Financial Protection Bureau ( CFPB ) and other legal avenues to protect my rights under federal law. 

Thank you for your prompt attention to this serious issue. I look forward to receiving confirmation that these inquiries have been removed from my credit report.

Consumer complaint narrative:
On XX/XX/2024, I sent formal dispute letters to [ Credit Bureau ( s ) ] ( XXXX, TransUnion, XXXX ) to address inaccuracies on my credit report. As per the Fair Credit Reporting Act ( FCRA ), 15 U.S.C. 1681i ( a ) ( 1 ), the credit bureaus are legally required to conduct a reasonable investigation and respond to disputes within 30 days. If additional information is provided, they are given 45 days to complete their investigation and respond to the consumer. 

As of XX/XX/2024, it has been more than 45 days since the date of my original disputes, and I have yet to receive any response from Credit Bureaus. This is a direct violation of the FCRA, which mandates that the credit reporting agencies must provide the results of their investigation within the required time period. 

The failure of the Credit Bureaus to respond within the legal timeframe has significantly impacted my financial situation, as the inaccuracies on my credit report have remained unresolved. These inaccuracies may be affecting my credit score, access to financial services, and overall financial well-being.

Product: Credit reporting or other personal consumer reports
Issue: Problem with a company's investigation into an existing problem
Sub-issue: Their investigation did not fix an error on your report
Consumer complaint narrative:
On XX/XX/2024, I received an improper and unsupported response from TransUnion regarding my fraud block request ( File Number : XXXX ). TransUnion incorrectly declined to block fraudulent inquiries by XXXX ( XX/XX/2024 ) and XXXX XXXX XXXX ( XX/XX/2024 ), falsely claiming that the Federal Trade Commission ( FTC ) Identity Theft Report I submitted was not an official, valid document. This decision violates both the federal Fair Credit Reporting Act ( FCRA ) and California state laws designed to protect consumers from identity theft and fraudulent activity. 

# # # **Violation of Federal Law ( FCRA, Section 605B ) : ** Under the FCRA ( 15 U.S. Code 1681c-2 ), TransUnion is required to block fraudulent information on a credit report when a valid Identity Theft Report is provided by the consumer. The FTC Identity Theft Report I submitted ( Report Number XXXX XXXX  ) was generated through the FTCs authorized online platform, www.identitytheft.gov, and fully complies with federal law. This document included my personal identifying information, the specific fraudulent accounts in question, and a certification that I was a victim of identity theft. There is no legal requirement to provide a separate law enforcement report when the FTC Identity Theft Report is provided.

Despite fulfilling all the requirements outlined by the FCRA, TransUnion refused to block the fraudulent inquiries. Their failure to comply with this legal obligation violates federal law and constitutes a violation of my consumer rights.

# # # **Violation of California State Laws : ** As a California resident, I am also protected by the California Identity Theft Act ( California Civil Code 1798.92 et seq. ), which provides additional protections for victims of identity theft. Under California law, credit reporting agencies are required to investigate and block fraudulent accounts promptly upon receiving proper documentation. The FTC Identity Theft Report qualifies as an official document under both federal and state law, yet TransUnion has refused to take the required action, further infringing upon my rights.

# # # **Details of the Fraudulent Inquiries : ** - XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XX/XX/2024 ) ** Both inquiries were made without my authorization and are the result of identity theft. I have provided all necessary documentation, yet TransUnions refusal to block these inquiries from my credit report continues to cause harm to my credit standing and financial opportunities. 

# # # **Actions Requested : ** I request the CFPBs assistance in compelling TransUnion to : 1. Immediately block the fraudulent inquiries from XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX 
2. Comply with the FCRA, Section 605B, and XXXX Civil Code 1798.92.

3. Provide a detailed explanation of their investigation method, including copies of all communications between TransUnion, XXXX, XXXX XXXX XXXXXXXX, and any other relevant parties. 
4. Provide me with an updated credit report reflecting the removal of the fraudulent inquiries.

5. Prevent further violations of my consumer rights under both federal and state law.

# # # **Conclusion : ** TransUnions refusal to block the fraudulent items despite receiving valid documentation is a clear violation of both the FCRA and XXXX  state laws. I respectfully request that the CFPB investigate this matter and enforce compliance to protect my rights as a consumer and victim of identity theft. 

**Supporting Documentation : ** - FTC Identity Theft Report ( Report Number : XXXX ) - TransUnion Response ( XXXX : XX/XX/2024 )

On XXXX XXXX, XXXX, the XXXX credit bureau publicly revealed its computer networks had suffered a data leak that exposed the personal information of XXXX XXXX consumers, a number later raised to XXXX XXXX. That data included consumers names, addresses, dates of birth, Social Security numbers and credit card numbers all of which could lead to identity fraud and other financial crimes. 

XXXX, one of the XXXX XXXX information services groups, experienced a significant data breach in XX/XX/XXXX. This breach exposed the personal information of millions of consumers due to unauthorized access to data from a server that contained information for clients, including XXXX. The incident was particularly concerning due to the nature of XXXX XXXX business, which involves handling sensitive personal credit information.

To Whom It May Concern : I am writing to dispute for the XXXX time the following information that appears on my Transunion credit report as of XX/XX/XXXX ( XXXX dispute XX/XX/XXXX ) ( XXXX dispute XX/XX/XXXX ) : Tradeline # XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX with account # XXXX opened on XX/XX/XXXX and has a balance of {$9800.00} with XXXX late payment delinquencies for XX/XX/XXXX, XX/XX/XXXX and XX/XX/XXXX. 
I previously disputed this account with XXXX  XXXX directly online on XX/XX/XXXX with supporting documents regarding the late payment delinquencies reported during the year of XXXX.On XX/XX/XXXX, XXXX  XXXX submitted a response back in writing after their investigation indicating the following : There are no delinquencies reporting for the month ( s ) of ( XXXX XX/XX/XXXX ). Overall, XXXX XXXX failed and/or neglected to investigate the primary credit reporting concerns, which is a violation of the FCRA. However, consumer reporting agencies must correct or delete inaccurate, incomplete, or unverifiable information. Inaccurate, incomplete, or unverifiable information must be removed or corrected, usually within 30 days. Please send me proof of your previous investigations and proof of the negative payment status for this account or delete the negative information in this account. Please reinvestigate these matters and delete or correct the disputed information as soon as possible. 
Also, since Transunion is limited to accepting uploaded files in a certain format, I have submitted the audio recording of my conversation with the furnisher/creditor XXXX  XXXX to the CEO XXXX XXXX via email, which supports my dispute and request for the late delinquencies for XX/XX/XXXX, XX/XX/XXXX and XX/XX/XXXX to be removed.

XXXX ) : As per this section of the FCRA, I am requesting that these fraudulent accounts be blocked from my credit report immediately. In addition, I demand the following actions : Immediate investigation and removal of the disputed accounts. 
Implementation of a fraud alert and security freeze to prevent further fraudulent activity. 

Provide confirmation that the accounts have been removed or corrected. 

Thank you for your prompt attention to this matter. Please confirm receipt of this letter and inform me of the outcome of your investigation. 

Sincerely, XXXX XXXX
