Consumer complaint narrative:
Demand for Deletion of Unauthorized and Unverifiable Hard Inquiries Dear TransUnion, I am writing to formally dispute and demand the immediate deletion of unauthorized and unverifiable hard inquiries that appear on my credit report maintained by TransUnion LLC. Pursuant to my rights under the Fair Credit Reporting Act ( FCRA ), specifically 15 USC 1681b, I request that you conduct a thorough investigation into the following inquiries : 1. XXXX date : XX/XX/2023 XXXX XXXX date : XX/XX/2022 These inquiries are a violation of my privacy rights and have been made without my consent. 

2. **Verification of inquiries : ** For each inquiry listed, please provide verification that it was authorized by me or otherwise permissible under the provisions of the FCRA . This includes any permissible purpose under 15 USC 1681b. 

According to 15 USC 1681b, consumer reporting agencies such as TransUnion must ensure that any information they report is accurate, up-to-date, and verifiable. Unauthorized inquiries not only jeopardize my credit score but also infringe upon my rights under federal law. 

I demand that all unauthorized and unverifiable hard inquiries be promptly deleted from my credit report. Please provide written confirmation once this investigation is completed and the unauthorized inquiries have been removed. 

Additionally, as per the FCRA, I request that you provide me with a free copy of my updated credit report once the unauthorized inquiries have been removed. 

Please respond in writing within XXXX  days of receipt of this letter. Failure to comply with these requests will leave me no choice but to pursue legal remedies available to me under federal law. 

Thank you for your prompt attention to this matter. I look forward to your timely response. 

Sincerely, XXXX XXXX

Consumer complaint narrative:
I am writing to report multiple fraudulent activities and unauthorized accounts impacting my credit profile. The following issues require investigation and immediate resolution : 1. XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX : I did not authorize the opening of this account or any of the charges associated with it. I have no knowledge of this account and request that it be removed from my credit report as a fraudulent account. 

2. XXXXXXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX ( Issued by XXXX ) ** : I did not authorize the opening of this credit card account or the transactions made under this account. I am disputing this account and any associated charges, requesting its removal from my credit report as fraudulent. 

XXXX. **XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX : A charge-off for this mobile phone bill appears on my credit report. I did not authorize or initiate this account and dispute the legitimacy of this charge. I request its removal as a fraudulent entry. 

These accounts are clear violations of my consumer rights under the **Fair Credit Reporting Act ( FCRA ) **, 15 U.S.C. 1681, which entitles me to accurate and fair credit reporting. Under this law, I request that the credit reporting agencies conduct a thorough investigation and delete the aforementioned fraudulent accounts from my credit profile. Additionally, under the **Fair Debt Collection Practices Act ( FDCPA ) **, I demand that no further collections or attempts to recover these alleged debts take place, as they are invalid.

Consumer complaint narrative:
XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XX/XX/XXXX Federal Trade Commission XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX, XXXXXXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX  Subject : Dispute of Credit Report Inaccuracy an privacy violation Due to Data Breach Dear Sir/Madam, I am writing to formally dispute inaccuracies on my credit report that I believe have arisen as a result of a recent data breach involving my personal information. My dispute is made under the Fair Credit Reporting Act ( FCRA ), specifically 15 U.S.C. 1681, which governs the accuracy and privacy of information contained in consumer credit reports. 
Details of the Dispute : Name : XXXX XXXX Social Security Number : XXXX Date of Birth : XX/XX/XXXX Description of the Issue : I was informed that my personal information was compromised in a data breach at the credit reporting agencies, Transunion XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX This breach has likely led to the erroneous reporting of information on my credit report, including but not limited to inaccuracies on my credit report also a violation of the FCRA and my rite to privacy in leaked information as my social, address, account information and more. 
Requested Action : I ask that these following accounts be remove from my credit report immediately XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX I request that you investigate this matter and ensure that any inaccurate or fraudulent information related to this data breach is corrected or removed from my credit report. I also ask for confirmation in writing once these corrections have been made. 
Please provide me with a written response detailing the actions taken in this matter within [ reasonable timeframe, e.g., 30 days ] as stipulated by the FCRA. 
Thank you for your attention to this matter. I trust that you will act promptly to rectify any inaccuracies that have resulted from this unfortunate breach of my personal information. 
Sincerely, XXXX XXXX

( A ) In general. A consumer reporting agency shall provide written notice to a consumer of the results of a reinvestigation under this subsection not later than 5 business days after the completion of the reinvestigation, by mail or, if authorized by the consumer for that purpose, by other means available to the agency ( B ) Contents. Consumer complaint narrative:
RE : You Violated the United States Code Law 15 U.S.C. 1681 ( c ) ( 1 ) ( A ) ( B ) ( i ) ( 3 ) FURNISHING reports in connection with credit or insurance transactions that are not initiated by consumer.

After pulling a copy of my Consumer credit report I noticed that your agency is in multiple violations and Im entitled to monetary compensation under FCRA 15 U.S. Code 1681s2 - 15 U.S.C. 1681 ( c ) ( 1 ) ( A ) ( B ) ( i ) ( 3 ) FURNISHING reports in connection with credit or insurance transactions that are not initiated by consumer ( Inquires ) - ( 1 ) In general A consumer reporting agency may furnish a consumer report relating to any consumer pursuant to subparagraph ( A ) or ( C ) of subsection ( a ) ( 3 ) in connection with any credit or insurance transaction that is not initiated by the consumer only if ( A ) the consumer authorizes the agency to provide such report to such person or ( B ) ( i ) the transaction consists of a firm offer of credit or insurance.

( 3 ) INFORMATION regarding inquiries Except as provided in section 1681g ( a ) ( 5 ) of this title, a consumer reporting agency shall not furnish to any person a record of inquiries in connection with a credit or insurance transaction that is not initiated by a consumer. 



Under FCRA 15 U.S. Code 1681n ( b ) ( B ) in the case of liability of a natural person for obtaining a consumer report under false pretenses or knowingly without a permissible purpose, actual damages sustained by the consumer as a result of the failure or {$1000.00}, whichever is greater ( 2 ) such number of punitive damages as the court may allow.

I did not initiate any of these inquires furthermore if you feel like I did please send me copies of my written signature giving consent to this matter please.

The items below should all be removed from my consumer report under 15 US Code 1681 ( c ) ( 1 ) ( A ) ( B ) ( i ) ( 3 ).

Consumer complaint narrative:
Dispute Authorization and Multiple Violations of Fair Credit Reporting Act I '' hereby authorize this dispute. It is important to note that this dispute was not sent by an unauthorized third party or credit clinic, '' I am writing to address the ongoing violations of the Fair Credit Reporting Act ( FCRA ) that have yet to be resolved, despite my previous dispute letter. The violations are as follows : FCRA Section 607 ( a ) ( 4 ) - Consumer Right to Privacy : You are continuing to report fraudulent accounts on my credit report that do not belong to me, which is a clear infringement upon my privacy rights. As I mentioned before, I have the sole authority to determine what information should be considered private. I insist that my hard inquiries and account information not be shared on my credit report. FCRA Section 623 ( a ) ( 2 ) - Misleading False Reporting : The information you continue to report falsely suggests that I applied for multiple inquiries and accounts when in reality, these were the result of a scammer 's actions. This misleading and unverified reporting is in direct violation of the Fair Credit Reporting Act ( FCRA ) and its fairness requirements. FCRA Section 616 - Civil Liability for Willful Noncompliance : Despite my previous dispute, you have failed to verify the accuracy of the credit information you have accepted, thereby demonstrating willful noncompliance. This non-compliance is subject to civil liability of up to {$1000.00} per violation. FCRA Section 605B - Aggravated Identity Theft : Your continued sharing of my personal information with numerous creditors without obtaining my consent is a criminal act of aggravated identity theft. I remind you that this offense carries a penalty of up to 2 years of imprisonment. FCRA Section 603 ( d ) ( 2 ) ( A ) - Obligations with Respect to Disclosures of Personal Information : You have yet to fulfill your obligation to disclose my right to opt out of sharing my personal information. This omission is deceptive and a direct violation of my consumer rights. FORA Section 623 ( a ) ( 3 ) - Furnishing Deceptive Forms : Despite my previous dispute, you persist in furnishing inaccurate inquiries and accounts without proper validation, which potentially violates Generally Accepted Accounting Principles ( GAAP ). Reporting such deceptive information is unacceptable In addition to the aforementioned violations, I remind you of the previous violations outlined in my initial dispute letter, including the violation of the Debt Collection Practices Act, Identity Theft Laws, Acquiring Location Information Regulations, Timely Payments Regulations, Finance Charge Determination, and Credit Report Permissible Purposes. These violations require your immediate attention and resolution. Once again, I demand that you take immediate action to address these violations and fulfill the following requests : Unauthorized Inquiry : XXXX Date of inquiry : XX/XX/XXXX Request : DELETE!!! 

XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX

Despite multiple previous disputes and my clear evidence that these accounts are inaccurately reported, you have failed to remove the erroneous information from my credit report. Your continued reporting of these items is a direct violation of the Fair Credit Reporting Act ( FCRA ) and the Fair Debt Collection Practices Act ( FDCPA ). 

Violations include but are not limited to : Failure to Conduct a Proper Investigation : As required under 15 USC 1681i ( a ) ( 1 ), credit reporting agencies must conduct a reasonable investigation of any disputed items. Your investigations have clearly been inadequate, as the same inaccurate information remains on my credit report. 

Reporting Inaccurate Information : Under 15 USC 1681s-2 ( a ) ( 1 ), furnishers of information are required to provide accurate information. These accounts are incorrect and have not been verified with my signed consent. 

Failure to Respond to Dispute : As per FCRA 611 ( a ) ( 1 ) ( A ), you are required to respond to disputes within 30 days. Your repeated failure to adequately address my disputes is unacceptable.

Consumer complaint narrative:
XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX, NC XXXX XXXX XX/XX/XXXX XX/XX/XXXX To : Transunion Address : TransUnion Consumer Solutions XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXXXXXX. XXXX, PA XXXX. 

I received a copy of my credit report, and I have found that in accordance with the FCRA you violated my rights under : 15 USC 1681 SECTION 602 WHICH STATES THAT I HAVE THE RIGHT TO PRIVACY, FURTHERMORE 15 USC 1681 SECTION 604a SECTION 2 ALSO STATES A CONSUMER REPORTING AGENCY CAN NOT FURNISH AN ACCOUNT WITHOUTOUT MY WRITTEN INSTRUCTIONS.

Pursuant to 15 USC 1666b A creditor may not treat a payment on a credit card account under an open-end consumer credit plan as late for any purpose, unless the creditor has adopted reasonable procedures designed to ensure
that each periodic statement including the information required by section 1637 ( b ) of this title is mailed or delivered to the consumer not later than 21 days before the payment due date. 

List : XXXX XXXX, XXXX, XX/XX/XXXX I NEVER gave you, OR the above-listed creditors any written instruction to furnish any information on my consumer report which is a violation of 15 USC 1681b. Credit Reporting Agency has caused XXXX  stress and XXXX  due to the abusive and unfair practices.

You should be ashamed of yourself for ASSUMING this role and position to constantly commit fraud and cause harm to consumers! These accounts are listed with late or missed payments and that is incorrect. The ABOVE listed ACCOUNTS were NEVER late and should be listed as PAYS or PAID AS AGREED and update my payment history to a green check or gray it out. 
By the provisions of the Fair Credit Reporting Act, I demand that these items be investigated and removed from my report, and I demand that you provide me with concrete evidence and all documentation proving that I am or have been late. It is my understanding that you will recheck these items with the creditor who has posted them. 
Please remove any information that the creditor can not verify. I understand that under 15 U.S.C. Sec. 1681i ( a ), you must complete this investigation within 30 days of receipt of this letter. Please send an updated copy of my credit report reflecting the requested changes. 

Best Regards XXXX XXXX

This letter serves as my final attempt to resolve this matter before escalating to legal proceedings. Despite multiple previous disputes and my clear evidence that these accounts are inaccurately reported, you have failed to remove the erroneous information from my credit report. Your continued reporting of these items is a direct violation of the Fair Credit Reporting Act ( FCRA ) and the Fair Debt Collection Practices Act ( FDCPA ).

Violations include but are not limited to : Failure to Conduct a Proper Investigation : As required under 15 USC 1681i ( a ) ( 1 ), credit reporting agencies must conduct a reasonable investigation of any disputed items. Your investigations have clearly been inadequate, as the same inaccurate information remains on my credit report.

Reporting Inaccurate Information : Under 15 USC 1681s-2 ( a ) ( 1 ), furnishers of information are required to provide accurate information. These accounts are incorrect and have not been verified with my signed consent.

Failure to Respond to Dispute : As per FCRA 611 ( a ) ( 1 ) ( A ), you are required to respond to disputes within XXXX  days. Your repeated failure to adequately address my disputes is unacceptable.

I have provided clear evidence that the accounts listed below are not mine and should not be reported under my credit file :

Consumer complaint narrative:
My account with this company is being reported late and i was never late! I have had exceptional payment history with this company and all payments were placed on XXXX. This late payment that is reporting is a result on a systematic error on their end processing my payment. 

This was clearly a billing error made my the company and is not a reflection of my payment experience which violates USC Code 1681eb. This error has caused severe hard to my reputation, my character, my mode of living and to my family!

I demand the late payment reported in MONTHS REPORTING LATE to be removed They are not in compliance with the following law. 15 USC 1666b and its requirements set the standards and the guidance for a creditor to treat a payment as late, yet they are reporting a payment as late and they did not comply with the law!

15 USC 1666b ( a ) Time to make payments A creditor may not treat a payment on a credit card account under an open end consumer credit plan as late for any purpose, unless the creditor has adopted reasonable procedures designed to ensure that each periodic statement including the information required by section 1637 ( b ) of this title is mailed or delivered to the consumer not later than 21 days before the payment due date.

This company never sent the periodic statement along with the disclosures from section 1637 ( b ). 

I have requested proof that this information was mailed or delivered 21 days before the payment due date and this information was requested in good faith pursuant rule 1002 and It was never provided. 

This is unfair, illegal, fraudulent, and not equitable to me as a consumer! 

Delete the late payments from my consumer reports.

Consumer complaint narrative:
In accordance with the Fair Credit Reporting Act, the accounts listed below have violated my federally protected consumer rights to privacy and confidentiality under 15 U.S.C. 1681. The following accounts have violated my rights : ( Collection ) XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX ( Collection ) XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX ( Collection ) XXXX XXXX : # XXXX ( Collection ) XXXX XXXX : # XXXX Upon reviewing my TransUnion credit report on XX/XX/2024, I noticed several inaccuracies and incomplete information. According to the Fair Credit Reporting Act, whenever a consumer reporting agency prepares a consumer report, it is required to follow reasonable procedures to ensure maximum possible accuracy of the information concerning the individual to whom the report relates ( 15 U.S.C. 1681e ( b ) ).

Furthermore, under 15 U.S.C. 1681i ( 5 ), it is stated that : ( A ) In general, if after any reinvestigation under paragraph ( 1 ) of any information disputed by a consumer, an item of information is found to be inaccurate, incomplete, or can not be verified, the consumer reporting agency shall : ( i ) Promptly delete that item of information from the consumer 's file or modify it as appropriate, based on the results of the reinvestigation. 
( ii ) Promptly notify the furnisher of that information that the information has been modified or deleted from the consumer 's file. 
Additionally, according to 15 U.S.C. 1681s-2, a person is prohibited from furnishing any information relating to a consumer to any consumer reporting agency if the person knows or has reasonable cause to believe that the information is inaccurate.

At no point did I authorize these entries, and their presence on my report is unwarranted. Consequently, I am formally requesting that these accounts be blocked and removed from my report immediately. 

It is important to clarify that this request is not due to any error or negligence on my part. There has been no oversight or misunderstanding on my end. Instead, this issue arises solely from the fact that I did not explicitly authorize the inclusion of these transactions in my report. I am diligent about maintaining the accuracy and privacy of my financial records, and these unauthorized entries compromise that integrity. 

I trust that you will handle this matter with the urgency and seriousness it deserves. Please confirm the removal of these transactions from my report as soon as possible. Thank you for your prompt attention to this issue.

Consumer complaint narrative:
My account with this company is being reported late and i was never late! I have had exceptional payment history with this company and all payments were placed on Autopay. This late payment that is reporting is a result on a systematic error on their end processing my payment.

This was clearly a billing error made my the company and is not a reflection of my payment experience which violates USC Code 1681eb. This error has caused severe hard to my reputation, my character, my mode of living and to my family!

I demand the late payment reported in MONTHS REPORTING LATE to be removed They are not in compliance with the following law. 15 USC 1666b and its requirements set the standards and the guidance for a creditor to treat a payment as late, yet they are reporting a payment as late and they did not comply with the law!

15 USC 1666b ( a ) Time to make payments A creditor may not treat a payment on a credit card account under an open end consumer credit plan as late for any purpose, unless the creditor has adopted reasonable procedures designed to ensure that each periodic statement including the information required by section 1637 ( b ) of this title is mailed or delivered to the consumer not later than 21 days before the payment due date.

This company never sent the periodic statement along with the disclosures from section 1637 ( b ).

I have requested proof that this information was mailed or delivered 21 days before the payment due date and this information was requested in good faith pursuant rule 1002 and It was never provided.

This is unfair, illegal, fraudulent, and not equitable to me as a consumer!

Delete the late payments from my consumer reports.

Product: Credit reporting or other personal consumer reports
Consumer complaint narrative:
TransUnion XXXX XXXX XXXX  XXXX, PA XXXX Subject : Dispute of Negative Accounts Appearing on Credit Report Due to National Data Breach To Whom It May Concern, I am writing to formally dispute the inaccurate and negative information appearing on my credit report as a result of the national data breach. These negative accounts were not initiated by me and are the result of identity theft stemming from this breach. 
In accordance with the Fair Credit Reporting Act ( FCRA ) and Metro 2 dispute guidelines, I am submitting this dispute under the following format for your immediate review and action : Account Name : XXXX XXXX Account Name : XXXX XXXX Account Name : XXXX XXXXXXXX XXXX XXXX Reason for Dispute : Account created due to breach, identity theft, and unauthorized access. 

Metro 2 Compliance and Dispute Codes : Compliance Condition Code : XB ( Consumer Disputes This Information ) Dispute Reason Code : 103 ( Not Mine Fraud or Identity Theft ) FCRA 605B ( 15 U.S.C. 1681c-2 ) : As per this section of the FCRA, I am requesting that these fraudulent accounts be blocked from my credit report immediately. In addition, I demand the following actions : Immediate investigation and removal of the disputed accounts.

Implementation of a fraud alert and security freeze to prevent further fraudulent activity.

Provide confirmation that the accounts have been removed or corrected.

Attached are the necessary supporting documents, including an identity theft report and any correspondence related to this issue. As required by law, I expect a response and resolution within 30 days of receiving this dispute.

Thank you for your prompt attention to this matter. Please confirm receipt of this letter and inform me of the outcome of your investigation. 

Sincerely, XXXX XXXX

Consumer complaint narrative: Consumer Name : ( XXXX XXXX XXXX ), Consumer Social Security Number : ( XXXX ), Consumer Date of Birth : ( XX/XX/XXXX ), Contents of Complaint : This CFPB complaint has been filed to request pursuant to FCRA 605B ( 15 U.S.C. 1681c-2 ) that you, the XXXX credit reporting agency, block information appearing on my consumer credit report that is the result of identity theft and fraud within 4 business days of you receiving this complaint. This fraudulent, inaccurate, and false information consists of : XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX These accounts have resulted in several fraudulent collections appearing on my consumer FICO credit report. I've attached a list of the ACCOUNTS/ADDRESSES in question as well as a copy of the consumer FICO credit report maintained by you which shows the aforementioned fraudulent items. I do not recognize the aforementioned accounts, collections as reported. Product: Credit card
Sub-product: General-purpose credit card or charge card
Issue: Advertising and marketing, including promotional offers
Sub-issue: Didn't receive advertised or promotional terms
Consumer complaint narrative:
Capital One solicited me for a Business Card at 0 % for 12 months on purchases. Somewhere along the process they bait and switched me to a standard offer. This was not clear at any point during the process. This was clearly an unfair and deceptive practice. There is no reason I would not have received the premium offer with strong credit and a well established relationship with Cap One. 

I spoke to servicing and all they would say is NO, NO, and NO. They enticed me with the offer, I am just beginning to establish my business along with maintaining a full time job. This is not OK! If it was clear I would not 1. Accepted the offer and 2. Used the card to make a large purchase.

Also, this is a Business Card and they are reporting it to my consumer file, that was not clearly communicated. Unfair and Deceptive!!!

Product: Vehicle loan or lease
Sub-issue: Problem with additional products or services purchased with the loan
Consumer complaint narrative:
Hi, I would like to start off this complete by introducing myself and my family. I am a small business owner in my community, and my husband is a XXXX  who both work very hard with two XXXX  children. 

We have been Kia customers since XXXX and have leased 6 Kias. To say that we have been abused emotionally, financially and mentally, exploited, manipulated, robbed and bullied is a complete understatement. 

I leased my sixth Kia back in XX/XX/XXXX located at XXXX XXXX XXXX and in an Unfortunate event my car was flooded but not a total loss on XX/XX/XXXX. I decided to have the vehicle towed back to the Kia dealership ( on XXXX XXXX ) so they can try to fix the issues. XXXX paid the dealership for my vehicle to be stored on their property while all of the issues were being attended to. Within the three months of leaving my vehicle with the Kia dealership, not only Was my vehicle left out on the XXXX XXXX XXXXXXXX Streets and in that time frame incurred 4 tickets That Kia hid from me each time I went to check on the car and the status. After the fourth time my car, then was booted the day before XXXX was going to pick it up and it was only then that the manager XXXX called me so then let me know my car is no longer in their possession but now with the XXXX XXXX XXXX financial division. I was lied to. I was treated inappropriately once I claimed that the dealership had to pay for the tickets. XXXX was the head manager who berated me yelled at me and told me that they were legally allowed to leave the cars out on the street although XXXX has been paying for a storage fee to make sure that my car was placed on their property. They wanted nothing to do with the situation, No one will pick up the calls for me. No one wanted to speak with me and it wasnt until I went down to the financial district that I even find out that they were four tickets That were thrown away by one of the employees. It gets worse- Through these actions, my situation with my car, completely spiraled out of control to the point in which I had to Miss many days of work, fighting the case for many hours and degrading conversation with the staff, Emotionally drained, I then had to continue to pay out of pocket for a replacement vehicle. Pay out of pocket for my car lease and out of pocket for my insurance. And to add insult to injury, my car was never recovered from this situation. 

This entire mess could have been prevented and avoided had Kia the dealership left my vehicle on their property. Never again will I be utilizing this company and allow for this type of abuse. What a precarious situation and I was fully taken advantage of!!!

Product: Credit reporting or other personal consumer reports
Consumer complaint narrative:
My account with this company is being reported late and i was never late! I have had exceptional payment history with this company and all payments were placed on Autopay. This late payment that is reporting is a result on a systematic error on their end processing my payment.

This was clearly a billing error made my the company and is not a reflection of my payment experience which violates USC Code 1681eb. This error has caused severe hard to my reputation, my character, my mode of living and to my family!

I demand the late payment reported in MONTHS REPORTING LATE to be removed They are not in compliance with the following law. 15 USC 1666b and its requirements set the standards and the guidance for a creditor to treat a payment as late, yet they are reporting a payment as late and they did not comply with the law!

15 USC 1666b ( a ) Time to make payments A creditor may not treat a payment on a credit card account under an open end consumer credit plan as late for any purpose, unless the creditor has adopted reasonable procedures designed to ensure that each periodic statement including the information required by section 1637 ( b ) of this title is mailed or delivered to the consumer not later than 21 days before the payment due date.

This company never sent the periodic statement along with the disclosures from section 1637 ( b ).

I have requested proof that this information was mailed or delivered 21 days before the payment due date and this information was requested in good faith pursuant rule 1002 and It was never provided.

This is unfair, illegal, fraudulent, and not equitable to me as a consumer!

Delete the late payments from my consumer reports.

Product: Credit reporting or other personal consumer reports
Consumer complaint narrative:
Equifax Information Services LLC XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX, GA XXXX Dear Sir or Madam : Subject : Dispute of Negative Credit Information Resulting from Equifax Data Breach I am writing to dispute inaccurate and negative information that has been reported on my credit report as a result of the data breach that Equifax suffered. As you are aware, the breach exposed sensitive personal information, including names, Social Security numbers, birth dates, addresses, and in some cases, driver 's license numbers. As a result of this breach, I believe that fraudulent activity may have affected my credit report and resulted in inaccurate reporting. 

Under the Fair Credit Reporting Act ( FCRA ), I am entitled to dispute any information that I believe to be incorrect or the result of identity theft. According to Section 611 of the FCRA ( 15 U.S.C. 1681i ), credit reporting agencies are required to investigate disputes, and if any information is found to be inaccurate or unverifiable, it must be promptly corrected or removed from the credit report. 

Specifically, I am disputing the following items on my credit report : XXXX XXXX - Account number : XXXX XXXX XXXX  - Account Number : XXXX XXXXXXXX XXXX XXXX - Account Number : XXXX XXXX - Account Number : XXXX XXXX - Account Number : XXXX I am requesting that these items be investigated and corrected or removed from my credit report. I believe they are the result of fraudulent activity and should not reflect negatively on my credit history. 

Please investigate this matter and provide a response within the 30-day period required under the FCRA. I also request that Equifax send me a copy of the corrected report once the investigation is complete, and that any corrections be communicated to other credit reporting agencies. 

In the meantime, I ask that a note be added to my file stating that this information is disputed and under investigation in compliance with Section 611 of the FCRA. 

Attached are copies of my identification, proof of address, and any supporting documentation related to this dispute. I appreciate your prompt attention to this matter and look forward to your timely resolution. 

Sincerely, XXXX XXXX

XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX I received a copy of my credit report, and I have found that in accordance with the FCRA you violated my rights under : 15 USC 1681 SECTION 602 WHICH STATES THAT I HAVE THE RIGHT TO PRIVACY, FURTHERMORE 15 USC 1681 SECTION 604a SECTION 2 ALSO STATES A CONSUMER REPORTING AGENCY CAN NOT FURNISH AN ACCOUNT WITHOUTOUT MY WRITTEN INSTRUCTIONS.

Pursuant to 15 USC 1666b A creditor may not treat a payment on a credit card account under an open-end consumer credit plan as late for any purpose, unless the creditor has adopted reasonable procedures designed to ensure that each periodic statement including the information required by section 1637 ( b ) of this title is mailed or delivered to the consumer not later than 21 days before the payment due date. 

XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXXXX/XX/XXXX I NEVER gave you, OR the above-listed creditors any written instruction to furnish any information on my consumer report which is a violation of 15 USC 1681b. Credit Reporting Agency has caused severe stress and anxiety due to the abusive and unfair practices. 
You should be ashamed of yourself for ASSUMING this role and position to constantly commit fraud and cause harm to consumers! These accounts are listed with late or missed payments and that is incorrect. The ABOVE listed ACCOUNTS were NEVER late and should be listed as PAYS or PAID AS AGREED and update my payment history to a green check or gray it out. 
By the provisions of the Fair Credit Reporting Act, I demand that these items be investigated and removed from my report, and I demand that you provide me with concrete evidence and all documentation proving that I am or have been late. It is my understanding that you will recheck these items with the creditor who has posted them. 
Please remove any information that the creditor can not verify. I understand that under 15 U.S.C. Sec. 1681i ( a ), you must complete this investigation within 30 days of receipt of this letter. Please send an updated copy of my credit report reflecting the requested changes. 

Best Regards XXXX XXXX

Consumer complaint narrative:
Date : XX/XX/XXXX Dear Sir/Madam I am writing to formally request that a security freeze be placed on my credit file, effective immediately, pursuant to Section 605A of the Fair Credit Reporting Act ( FCRA ) ( 15 U.S.C. 1681c-1 ).

1. Restriction on Disclosure of Information ( Section 604 of the FCRA, 15 U.S.C. 1681b ) Pursuant to Section 604 of the FCRA, I demand that no disclosure of my personal information, including consumer reports, be made to any person, organization, or entity that is not legally authorized to receive such information or that does not have my explicit consent.

2. Right to Privacy ( Section 609 of the FCRA, 15 U.S.C. 1681g ) In accordance with Section 609 of the FCRA, I request written confirmation that my personal information, including any medical or insurance information, will not be disclosed to third parties without my prior consent, except as strictly required by law. This confirmation should detail the measures taken to protect my information in accordance with legal requirements. 



XXXX. Prohibition of Unauthorized Disclosure under Consumer Privacy Protection Laws Additionally, in line with federal and state privacy laws, I demand that no information contained in my file be disclosed to insurance companies or any other third parties without my explicit, written approval, unless required by law. Any unauthorized disclosure will be considered a violation of my privacy rights and will result in appropriate legal action.

Equifax Dispute Department XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX, GA XXXX Subject : Formal Dispute of Inaccurate Information in Credit Report Dear Equifax, I am writing to formally dispute an inaccurate entry on my credit report under the Fair Credit Reporting Act ( FCRA ), 15 U.S.C. 1681. The account in question does not belong to me and is negatively affecting my credit score.

The details of the disputed account are as follows : I have never opened nor authorized this account. According to 281 SW715.719, I presume there is no evidence to support the alleged debt. Therefore, it can be concluded that no such debt actually exists.

Under the FCRA, you are required to : 1. Investigate my dispute within 30 days of receipt. 
2. Notify the creditor of my dispute.

3. Provide me with the results of your investigation in writing.

4. Delete or correct the inaccurate information if your investigation supports my claim.

Enclosed, please find copies of the following documents to support my dispute : 1. A copy of my credit report highlighting the disputed account.

2. A copy of my driver 's license for identification.

3. A notarized affidavit of identity theft.

4. Any additional documents ( e.g., police report, FTC Identity Theft Report ) that support my claim. 

If this error is not corrected promptly, I will have no choice but to seek legal action to protect my rights. I trust that Equifax will address this matter swiftly to avoid litigation. 

Please confirm receipt of this dispute letter and initiate your investigation immediately. I expect a timely resolution as stipulated by the FCRA. 

Thank you for your prompt attention to this matter. 

Sincerely, XXXX

Consumer complaint narrative:
I am writing to dispute the continued reporting of accounts on my credit report that have not been properly verified, despite my requests for investigation. According to the Fair Credit Reporting Act ( FCRA ), specifically 15 U.S.C. 1681i ( Procedures in case of disputed accuracy ), you are required to conduct a reasonable investigation when a consumer disputes the accuracy of any information on their credit report. I have not received proper written notice of the results of any investigation, which is a violation of 15 U.S.C. 1681i ( a ) ( 6 ) ( Notification of results of reinvestigation ).

Furthermore, I question how you can verify that these accounts truly belong to me if you are not conducting a thorough investigation. If you can not provide documented proof of these accounts validity, you are legally obligated to remove them from my credit report under 15 U.S.C. 1681i ( a ) ( 5 ) ( Requirement to delete or modify information that can not be verified ).

Additionally, I request that you remove any hard inquiries not associated with an open account, particularly those made within the last six months. Under 15 U.S.C. 1681b ( Permissible purposes of consumer reports ), inquiries can only be made with my explicit consent, and I have not applied for new credit recently. With the recent nationwide data breach in which my Social Security number was exposed, its possible that credit was applied for in my name without my knowledge.

Lastly, please ensure the removal of any duplicate information from my credit report, as accuracy is required under 15 U.S.C. 1681e ( b ) ( Compliance procedures ).

I trust you will follow the law and promptly investigate and correct the errors in my credit report. Failure to comply may result in further action to protect my rights. 

Account ( XXXX ) listed below : XXXX. XXXX XXXX XXXX. XXXX XXXX XXXX. XXXX XXXX I am writing to dispute the continued reporting of this account that was settled. As part of the settlement agreement with the company, they confirmed that they would no longer report this account on my credit report. Despite this, the account is still being reported. 
Please remove this account immediately, as its continued reporting is inconsistent with the terms of the settlement. 

XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX this account that was paid in full. The account should reflect a XXXX balance, yet it continues to report an outstanding balance, which is inaccurate. 

If the credit bureaus or the creditor are unable to update the information to accurately reflect the paid status, I request that the account be removed or deleted from my credit report, as required by the Fair Credit Reporting Act ( FCRA ). 

XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX This account was previously removed from my credit report but has since been reinserted without proper notice. I was not notified of the reinsertion, which is a violation of my consumer rights under the Fair Credit Reporting Act. I kindly request that this issue be addressed immediately. 

XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX this account was sold to a debt buyer. 

I am also writing to request the removal of outdated and incorrect personal information from my credit report. Specifically, I have noticed that old and unverified addresses are still being reported. The only address that should be listed on my credit report is my current address. 

Please remove any old or unverified addresses, as they do not accurately reflect my current information. Thank you for your prompt attention to this matter. Old addresses are listed below : XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX  Thank you for your prompt attention to this matter.

1666b. Timing of payments ( a ) Time to make payments A creditor may not treat a payment on a cred-it card account under an open end consumer credit plan as late for any purpose, unless the creditor has adopted reasonable procedures de- signed to ensure that each periodic statement including the information required by section 1637 ( b ) of this title is mailed or delivered to the consumer not later than 21 days before the pay-ment due date. ( b ) Grace period If an open end consumer credit plan provides a time period within which an obligor may repay any portion of the credit extended without in-curring an additional finance charge, such addi-tional finance charge may not be imposed with respect to such portion of the credit extended for the billing cycle of which such period is a part, unless a statement which includes the amount upon which the finance charge for the period is based was mailed or delivered to the consumer not later than 21 days before the date specified in the statement by which payment must be made in order to avoid imposition of that finance charge.

XXXX ID is XXXX. 

I am writing to express my dissatisfaction regarding the unexpected closure of my account and the unresolved issue of my unredeemed rewards. 

On XX/XX/XXXX, I reached out via online message to inquire about why my account was closed without having received any prior notice. On the same day, I received a response stating that I needed to use my card within 30 days of the date of the letter to keep the account open. All relevant conversations regarding this matter are shown in the attached files, XXXX. 

Following that, on XX/XX/XXXX, which was within the 30-day timeframe, I called Barclays again to ask for a replacement card since my original card was damaged and also about redeeming my XXXX miles in rewards. The agent informed me that I could redeem them for cash back and that a check would be mailed to me ( see attached file XXXX ). However, despite more than two months having passed since that conversation, I have not yet received the check. 

I have reached out multiple times via online message but have not received any valid or actionable response from Barclays. I called your customer service team again tonight, but unfortunately, there was still no response or resolution to my issue. 

Note all phone have been recorded. 

I am extremely disappointed with this lack of communication and follow-through and would appreciate immediate action on this matter. Please advise on the status of my rewards redemption and provide a timeline for when I can expect to receive the promised check.

Consumer complaint narrative:
On XX/XX/XXXX, I closed on my home at XXXX XXXX XXXX in XXXX, IL for {$170000.00} ( put {$20000.00} down ) with CITIZENS BANK. The appraisal done at the time showed a value of {$270000.00}. I purchased the home from family for {$100000.00} less than they paid for it due to it needing a number of repairs due to negligence since purchase approximately a year and a half before. I didn't notice at first I was being charge PMI insurance at first, which is entirely my fault, however I shouldn't be charged PMI insurance when the bank ordered appraisal shows a value of {$270000.00} and after downpayment I only owed {$150000.00}. Product: Credit card
Sub-product: General-purpose credit card or charge card
Consumer complaint narrative:
I am writing to formally dispute the late fees and interest charges that have been applied to my account due to fraudulent activity, as well as inform you to the deplorable customer experience your teams have delivered. I have previously disputed these charges, and I am dismayed to find that they have not been resolved in accordance with applicable laws and regulations. 

The charges in question are the result of fraud, and I should not be held liable for any fees or interest related to this fraudulent activity. I request that you immediately remove all late fees and interest charges associated with the fraudulent transactions and adjust my account accordingly.

This request is in accordance with the following laws and regulations : 1. The Fair Credit Billing Act ( FCBA ), 15 U.S.C. 1666 : This law stipulates that creditors must promptly credit or refund overpayments and correct billing errors, including unauthorized charges. The FCBA limits a cardholder 's liability for unauthorized use of their credit card to {$50.00}. 
2. The Electronic Fund Transfer Act ( EFTA ), 15 U.S.C. 1693 : While primarily applicable to debit cards, this act also provides protections against fraudulent transactions and limits consumer liability for unauthorized electronic fund transfers.

3. The Truth in Lending Act ( TILA ), 15 U.S.C. 1601 et seq. : This act requires creditors to provide clear and accurate disclosures about the terms and costs of consumer credit, including how interest is calculated and when it is applied.

4. Regulation Z, 12 C.F.R. 226 : This regulation implements TILA and provides specific rules for credit card issuers, including how to handle billing errors and unauthorized use claims.

5. The Fair Credit Reporting Act ( FCRA ), 15 U.S.C. 1681 et seq. : This act requires that credit reporting agencies and furnishers of information ( such as credit card companies ) ensure the accuracy of information in consumer credit reports.

Furthermore, I remind you of your obligations under the Dodd-Frank Wall Street Reform and Consumer Protection Act, which prohibits unfair, deceptive, or abusive acts or practices ( UDAAP ) in consumer financial products and services.

I request that you conduct a thorough investigation of this matter and provide a written explanation of your findings within 30 days, as required by the FCBA. If you find that the charges were indeed fraudulent, I expect all related fees and interest charges to be removed from my account immediately.

If you fail to comply with this request, I will not hesitate to file a complaint with the Consumer Financial Protection Bureau ( CFPB ) and seek legal counsel to enforce my rights under the aforementioned laws.

Additionally, your customer services is negligent and completely unsatisfactory. Earlier today, I spent over 2 hours on the phone, transferred to 7 different teams and managers, and was hung up on 3 times by Discover. Not once did an agent or manager attempt to return a call after voluntarily disconnecting. Not one was able to help, nor did any of them move the ball forward. 

Please confirm receipt of this letter and provide a timeline for resolving this issue. All future correspondence regarding this matter should be made in writing and sent to the email address listed on my account.
Company: CAPITAL ONE, NATIONAL ASSOCIATION - GREENWOOD DELAWARE BRANCH

Consumer complaint narrative:
I was denied credit by WELLS FARGO when they closed my existing line of credit. 
According to the Equal Credit Opportunity Act adverse action against a consumer is against the law which is codified in 15 USC 1691c and is pursuant to civil liability under 15 USC 1692k. WELLS FARGO subject to criminal liability for violating 15 USC as I have proof that I was discriminated against due to the correspondence I received.

WELLS FARGO is in violation of 15 USC 1642, 15 USC 1681m and 12 CFR 1002 because I, the consumer, opened an account in good faith, but credit was WRONGFULLY terminated. 
I also noticed WELLS FARGO was furnishing information to XXXX, XXXX and XXXX that violate my Fair Credit Reporting Act rights as a consumer. The reporting of this account has caused severe damage to my character, my reputation, my general ability of living as well as my ability to obtain credit obligations for personal purposes. Ultimately this negligence has damaged my livelihood and my ability of using credit in my life. This account is not compliant and is violating multiple FCRA laws. 
15 USC 1681b- Permissible Purpose of Consumer reports- ( a ) IN GENERAL Subject to subsection ( c ), any consumer reporting agency may furnish a consumer report under the following circumstances and no other : ( 2 ) In accordance with the written instructions of the consumer to whom it relates. 15 USC 1681e ( b ) Compliance and procedures ( b ) ACCURACY OF REPORT Whenever a consumer reporting agency prepares a consumer report it shall follow reasonable procedures to assure maximum possible accuracy of the information concerning the individual about whom the report relates. 15 USC 1681 section 602 ( a ) There is a need to insure that consumer reporting agencies exercise their grave responsibilities with fairness, impartiality, and a respect for the consumers right to privacy. XXXX, XXXX and XXXX are consumer reporting agencies, and I am the Consumer. Which means that I have the right to make sure my private information isn't shared and is backed by 15 USC 1681. 15 USC 1681 Congressional Findings and Statement of Purpose ( a ) ACCURACY AND FAIRNESS OF CREDIT REPORTING The Congress makes the following findings : ( 1 ) The banking system is dependent upon fair and accurate credit reporting. Inaccurate credit reports directly impair the efficiency of the banking system, and unfair credit reporting methods undermine the public confidence which is essential to the continued functioning of the banking system. ( 2 ) An elaborate mechanism has been developed for investigating and evaluating the credit worthiness, credit standing, credit capacity, character, and general reputation of consumers. ( 3 ) Consumer reporting agencies have assumed a vital role in assembling and evaluating consumer credit and other information on consumers. ( 4 ) There is a need to insure that consumer reporting agencies exercise their grave responsibilities with fairness, impartiality, and a respect for the consumers right to privacy. Incorrect reporting to my consumer file is damaging my ability to be approved for credit and is a misrepresentation of my character. This is a violation of my rights, negligent behavior. 12 CFR 1016.7 states that A consumer may exercise the right to opt out at any time. '' Per the FCRA, as a federally protected consumer, I am hereby formally opting out of any and all authorization, I the consumer, may have given WELLS FARGO, whether it be written, unwritten, verbal and non verbal per 15 USC 6802. Effective immediately and indefinitely. 15 USC 6802 ( b ) ( c ) states that " A financial institution may not disclose nonpublic personal information to a nonaffiliated third party unless the consumer is given an explanation of how the consumer can exercise that nondisclosure option. '' WELLS FARGO never informed me of my right to exercise my nondisclosure option. This will of course limit the amount of care I receive, but to be honest and I mean this from the bottom of my heart -- I would rather die from some future illness or disease than to deal with medical collections. So therefore I will be canceling my future XXXX and XXXX XXXX. I can't rely on insurance based care. I'll still have medical insurance but I just won ; t use it anymore. 
On the Primary level I'll just have to focus on healthy eating, exercise, and the services from my Direct Primay Care Practice. 
I don't want to die from any illness, but I just lost all faith in the insurance based system. All it takes is one person to forget to send an invoice out and then I end up in collections. Not the way I want to go.

Consumer complaint narrative:
I was attempting to sell a couch & smaller items online via multiple locally-serviced e-commerce sites ( XXXX & XXXX ) for several weeks and finally found a local buyer, XXXX XXXX XXXX who initially messaged me on XX/XX/XXXX at XXXX : XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX Hello am interested in this can you text me XXXX XXXX XXXXXXXX so we can talk more about the pick up. 

On XX/XX/XXXX at XXXX, I sent a text message warning them that the couch has lived with me & my XXXX  cats, so if he is XXXX, I would not proceed, and received a response at XXXX, from XXXX  cousin XXXX from ( XXXX ) XXXX, saying XXXX would be in touch with me soon about it. 

XXXX claimed he had a cat, so this wouldnt be a problem, but he was out of town, and his cousin would pick up the couch up the following day if it was still available, offering to pay immediately via XXXX or XXXX. 
Yes, I fell for it. I never make online transfers, which may be what saved me from more loss, because my bank & lack of prior electronic transfers that arent from verified XXXX XXXX ( XXXX, XXXX ) freaked my bank out, especially on a long holiday weekend. 

I didnt receive any notifications of financial transfer attempts. XXXX claimed there was an issue, and sent a screenshot, which gave me faith that this was real. It was my 1st & last time at that rodeo. 

I then received an email alleging to be from XXXX, claiming that the money had been sent from XXXX, but was being held because I rarely transfer money online via non-fdic-associated & the activity looked suspicious. 

Usually I check headers of every single email, especially after the recent XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX  leaks, but because of the corroboration from XXXX & many other stressful factors, including why I was selling the couch in the first place, ( I want to stay housed ) made me react rather than think critically, even though I know in selling something, one should not have to pay their buyer. 

This is how I didnt notice that the email originated from XXXX and not XXXX or any subdomain, XXXX XXXX XXXX  or anything ending in XXXX - I had a XXXX XXXX  at age XXXX and the internet was different. 

I am autistic and when I am right, I will still be wrong. My suspicion is taken for paranoia and my kindness is seen as weakness. My intuition told me to not do any of it. My hope in people being decent prevailed & got crushed I called the number in the email, ( XXXX ) XXXX & immediately received an answer. Since I am losing work to XXXX  ( my union struck over it last year ) & XXXX  took over, Ive become accustomed to it taking work to get customer service reps on the phone. To get the same person over and over again without numeric menus or holds also felt wrong - I believe he gave his name as XXXX XXXX or a variation on that - and thats when can I send XXXX XXXX XXXX  via the XXXX XXXX XXXX in increments of {$400.00} XXXX and I did. Not one email address was duplicated - every attempt to a new email address. My bank locked me out again. What these people didnt know is that I live below the poverty line, receive food stamps, so I am the worst person to target for this. My brain began melting. I wanted to hang up and say eff this guy but I wanted to believe XXXX too. 

Then the Fake XXXX guy broke character and asked for the code my bank texted me, and I was done because I know that is not for anyone but me and an agent at my bank. I called my bank ( via the number on the back of my debit card ) & spoke to XXXX directly via my XXXX  need support or a callback? settings. My bank took a lot of pity on me, an XXXX wiped out all of todays charges, save for one that slipped through to my fathers credit card, explaining that to him will be great. 

I have all the text messages, many screenshots, my bank logged & can confirm the entire situation. I will find out by Wednesday how much damage they were able to undo, because I fear that the digital XXXX XXXX  value ( common scam/fraud tactic, I know ) was immediately cashed in. 

XXXX  XXXX XXXX forgave & reversed the hole I wound up in - BMO/Diners Club , a card my family has held for about 30 years, admonished me for my stupidity and has yet to meaningfully discuss the issue with me, this week has made me want to walk into the ocean, I feel like human trash.
Company public response: Company has responded to the consumer and the CFPB and chooses not to provide a public response

Inaccurate credit reports directly impair the efficiency of the banking system, and unfair credit reporting methods undermine the public confidence which is essential to the continued functioning of the banking system. ( 2 ) An elaborate mechanism has been developed for investigating and evaluating the credit worthiness, credit standing, credit capacity, character, and general reputation of consumers. ( 3 ) Consumer reporting agencies have assumed a vital role in assembling and evaluating consumer credit and other information on consumers. Consumer complaint narrative:
I have contacted this company XXXX a few times they responded back with a letter stating that they sold the debt to DNF. I have also contacted them sending them debt validation letters and debt verification letters requesting that they validate this debt. 
I have written this company two times to request a debt validation letter and verification letter and did not receive the letter. I have also written all three credit bureaus requesting the same information previously twice as well. 
After carefully investigating the company DNF, they are not even licensed to collect in my state that I live in Iowa. 

As such, any attempt to collect the alleged debt from me is in violation of Iowa state law and the Fair Debt Collection Practices Act ( FDCPA ).

Product: Mortgage
Issue: Applying for a mortgage or refinancing an existing mortgage
Consumer complaint narrative:
We are submitting a formal complaint about the lengthy and challenging VA loan assumption process we are experiencing with XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX and their servicing company, Dovenmuehle. 
On XX/XX/year>, we entered into a contract to purchase a home owned by a veteran. This property was advertised with a VA assumable mortgage at an attractive interest rate, a key selling point for us. Just three days later, the veteran submitted an application to XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX for us to assume this loan. Initially, we were informed that all communication would be conducted exclusively through mail, with no option for phone or email contact. 
After weeks of waiting without any communication, the seller managed to obtain an email address. We promptly sent an email and received the application documents, which we returned on the same day. Additionally, we overnighted a paper copy to the service provider, Dovenmuehle. Despite responding to all requests within 24 hours, communication from Dovenmuehle has been consistently slow. The process finally entered underwriting on XX/XX/XXXX. We were required to send a check for {$4100.00}, which was cashed on XX/XX/year>. 
It has now been over 120 days since we initiated this process, with more than 74 days spent in underwriting. The initial documentation indicated that the entire process could take up to 90 days, including up to 45 days in underwriting. 
Communication with Dovenmuehle has been extremely difficult. Although the seller submitted official documentation authorizing both us and his realtor to inquire about the loan assumption, customer service representatives eventually stopped recognizing this authorization and imposed additional requirements to receive updates. 
Meanwhile, we are unable to close on the purchase of this home. Due to a job-related move to a new state, this situation is incredibly frustrating, costly ( exceeding $ XXXX in rental fees ), and challenging for both us and the seller. 

Please note : we have detailed records of all our communication with these companies related to this issue, if requested.

My husband ( XXXX XXXX and I ( XXXX ) were First Republic checking account customers - After Chase acquired First Republic, we became Chase customers and our three checking accounts ( XXXX individual for XXXX and XXXX, and one joint ) got moved to Chase and with the full integration that happened in XXXX timeframe, the three accounts got assigned different Chase tiers- this created confusion and we set up time with XXXX XXXX XXXX from Chase 's XXXX MA branch to discuss the matter.

We talked about the difference between " Sapphire '' and " Private Client '' levels specifically, and in particular we were told that : " For Sapphire level we need to qualify individually ( $ XXXX per person ), but Private Client level allows us to be treated as a household and we can meet the $ XXXX minimum requirements together. '' Further, Private Client level allows for fees on self-directed accounts to be waived and we can include those balances also towards the $ XXXX minimum requirement. 

SEE ATTACHMENT 1 3. We relied on the above information provided and moved new funds into Chase to meet " Private Client '' level of service and opened three new brokerage ( XXXX, XXXX, Joint ) and three new investment accounts ( XXXX, XXXX, Joint ) ; We currently have NINE accounts total, including the three original checking accounts that ported over from XXXX ( XXXX, XXXX, Joint ), and we exceed the $ XXXX minimum when considering all XXXX Chase accounts. 

XXXX. On XX/XX/year> - we received an email saying that our account balances do not meet the minimum requirements for " Private Client '' level, with a warning that fees will be levied. XXXX. However, moving to a lower tier of service will impose other fees on the brokerage and self-directed accounts we have opened since the conversation on XX/XX/year> - we only opened these accounts because of the " Private Client '' benefits/fee waivers. Further, these investment accounts have {$75.00} closing fees per account ( {$450.00} total ) - so we asked if these fees could be waived and we could then downgrade to a lower tier of checking accounts. Notwithstanding her promises, we were charged a total of {$70.00} ( two {$35.00} charges on both XXXX and XXXX 's checking accounts ) on XX/XX/year> and expect this will continues every month until this matter is resolved. XXXX XXXX has been unresponsive to both emails and phone calls over the last two weeks as the situation has worsened.

The experience with the LO was highly unprofessional and him trying to coerce out of a better contract to line his pockets better is atrocious. I had to have family who work in the real estate industry to advise me, if I did not know this I would've been taken advantage of. 

Upon reviewing the terms of our agreement, I find no specific provision that authorizes Rocket Mortgage to retain part of my deposit. The agreement vaguely states that the deposit may or may not be refundable depending on the status of your loan. However, no appraisal or credit report had been completed, and no other substantive services were provided at the time I withdrew from the process. 

Given this lack of clarity and service, I am requesting a full refund of my deposit. Please provide a detailed explanation, in writing, for why the deposit was withheld and on what grounds Rocket Mortgage believes it is entitled to retain these funds. 

I chose a better mortgage option with that better aligns with my financial situation better sets me up for the future. 

Thank you for your attention to this matter. I look forward to your reply.

Consumer complaint narrative:
Complaint about the Failure to Obtain the Early Warning Report Respected Consumer Financial Protection Bureau : I am lodging a complaint here against Early Warning because it has been a week since I applied for the report and I still have not received it, with no news at all. 

I have provided all the necessary information required by Early Warning to apply for the report, including but not limited to social security number, name, address, date of birth, and phone number. I also followed their instructions and submitted the application through the specified methods. 

However, a week has passed and I have not received any notice about the progress of the report, nor have I received the report itself. I have tried to contact Early Warning 's customer service department multiple times, but each time I either encountered a long waiting time or was unable to get through. 

This situation has caused me great distress and inconvenience because I need this report to understand the relevant information and make important decisions. 

I believe that Early Warning 's failure to provide the report in a timely manner is an irresponsible behavior that has seriously affected my rights and interests. I hope that your bureau can intervene in the investigation of this matter, prompt Early Warning to provide the report I applied for as soon as possible, and improve their services to avoid similar situations from happening again. 

Thank you for your attention and support regarding this matter. I look forward to a prompt resolution. 

Complainant : [ XXXX XXXX ] XXXX XXXX : [ XXXX ] Date : XX/XX/year>

Consumer complaint narrative:
Date : XX/XX/XXXX Dear Sir/Madam I am writing to formally request that a security freeze be placed on my credit file, effective immediately, pursuant to Section 605A of the Fair Credit Reporting Act ( FCRA ) ( 15 U.S.C. 1681c-1 ).

1. Restriction on Disclosure of Information ( Section 604 of the FCRA, 15 U.S.C. 1681b ) Pursuant to Section 604 of the FCRA, I demand that no disclosure of my personal information, including consumer reports, be made to any person, organization, or entity that is not legally authorized to receive such information or that does not have my explicit consent.

2. Right to Privacy ( Section 609 of the FCRA, 15 U.S.C. 1681g ) In accordance with Section 609 of the FCRA, I request written confirmation that my personal information, including any medical or insurance information, will not be disclosed to third parties without my prior consent, except as strictly required by law. This confirmation should detail the measures taken to protect my information in accordance with legal requirements. 



XXXX. Prohibition of Unauthorized Disclosure under Consumer Privacy Protection Laws Additionally, in line with federal and state privacy laws, I demand that no information contained in my file be disclosed to insurance companies or any other third parties without my explicit, written approval, unless required by law. Any unauthorized disclosure will be considered a violation of my privacy rights and will result in appropriate legal action. 



I attempted to make this request through your agency 's online portal, but unfortunately was unable to complete the process. For this reason, I am submitting this request in writing to ensure that the credit freeze is implemented in a timely manner. 

Below is the information necessary to process this request : XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX, CA XXXX. 

XX/XX/XXXX SS XXXX

They have a phone verification process through which they want to use to verify my daughter so we went and got her a phone in her name. The phone comes back unverifiable because the tool is used to match public records or accounts to my daughter and that number. My daughter turned 18 14 days ago, so she has no public records, credit, accounts or anything. We were told that she can't verify in the branch because she isn't a minor. The branch assistant manager called the " back office '' o our behalf stating that she directed my daughter to sign the check over to me and for me to make the deposit and that she id verified my daughter and I and that it was not a case of fraud. They still would not release my daughters funds to us. The branch head manager called as well with no luck. We are still coping with her father 's death and on top of that were fighting for her funds that is unjustly being held. Please help resolve this issue and get my daughter her funds. The funds have cleared, their employees are calling on my behalf and it still isn't enough. I have emailed any and eveyrone in the company that i could and spoke with a lot of customer service reps.

Product: Debt collection
Issue: Attempts to collect debt not owed
Consumer complaint narrative:
This letter is regarding debt you say I owe, which you claim is a collection that I have with your company. This is a formal notice that your claim is disputed. 

I am requesting validation, made pursuant to the Fair Debt Collection Act. Please note that I am requesting validation, that is competent evidence bearing my signature, showing that I have ( or ever had ) some contractual obligation to pay you. 

Please also be aware that any negative mark found on my credit reports ( including XXXX, XXXX and XXXX ) from your company or any company that you represent for a debt that I dont owe, is a violation of the Fair Debt Collection Practices Act FDCPA 807 [ 15 USC 1962e ] ; therefore, if you can not validate the debt, you must request that all credit reporting agencies delete the entry. 

Pending the outcome of my investigation of any evidence that you submit, you are instructed to take no action that could be detrimental to any of my credit reports. 

Failure to respond within XXXX  days of receipt of this certified letter will result in small claims legal action against your company at my local venue. I will be seeking up to {$5000.00} in damage for : 1. Defamation 2. Negligent Enablement of Identity Fraud 3. Violation of the fair Credit Reporting Act and fair Debt Collection Practices Act You will be required to appear in a court venue local to me, since you are clearly doing business in my area. 

For the purpose of 15 USC 1692 et seq., the Notice has the same effect as a dispute to the validity of the alleged debt and a dispute to the validity of your claim. 

Please Note : This notice is an attempt to correct your records, and any information received from you will be collected as evidence should any further action be necessary. This is a request for information only, and is not a statement, election, waiver status. 

XXXX XXXX

Product: Credit reporting or other personal consumer reports
Issue: Problem with a company's investigation into an existing problem
Consumer complaint narrative:
Subject : FORMAL DISPUTE AND DEMAND FOR IMMEDIATE REMOVAL OF INACCURATE INFORMATION AND DEBT VALIDATION Account : APPLE CARD - GS BANK Account Numbers : XXXX Notice to Agent is Notice to Principle and Notice to Principle is Notice to Agent, I am writing to demand the immediate removal of inaccurate and conflicting information on my credit file for the accounts listed above. Under the Fair Credit Reporting Act ( FCRA ), you are legally required to report only accurate and verifiable information. Failure to comply with FCRA Section 611 mandates the removal or correction of inaccurate information within 30 days. 

Due to the recent XXXX XX/XX/XXXX data breach, which exposed sensitive consumer data, it is imperative that my information be handled with utmost care to mitigate risks of identity theft and fraud. 

Discrepancies in Reporting : The APPLE CARD - GS BANK account, under account number XXXX, exhibits significant inconsistencies : 1. Conflicting Status Update Dates : One report lists a charge-off status update in XX/XX/XXXX, while another lists it in XX/XX/XXXX. 
2. Payment History Mismatch : Inconsistencies in the payment history for charge-offs and delinquency periods between the two accounts.

3. Missing Original Creditor Information : Goldman Sachs is listed as the original creditor in one report but omitted in another.

4. Unverified Highest Balance Information : One report states the highest balance as {$1900.00}, while the other omits this information. 

This conflicting information is unverifiable and does not accurately reflect my credit activity. Under FCRA Section 611, I demand the immediate removal of this account from my credit report.

Demand for Debt Validation : Under the Fair Debt Collection Practices Act ( FDCPA ), I request full validation of this debt. You are required to provide : 1. Proof the debt belongs to me.

2. A full accounting of the balance, including how {$1800.00} was calculated.

3. Copies of the original signed agreement indicating my legal obligation to pay this debt.

4. Name and contact information of the original creditor, along with all related documentation. 

If this debt can not be fully validated within 30 days, you must remove it from my credit report and cease all reporting. Non-compliance will be considered a willful violation of FCRA Section 611 and FDCPA, prompting me to pursue all available legal remedies, including filing complaints with the CFPB and considering a lawsuit under federal law.

Expectations for Resolution : An immediate investigation into this account is mandatory. Provide verifiable proof that this debt is mine and accurate, or remove this item from my credit report.

Failure to resolve this matter within 30 days will result in : 1. Filing formal complaints with the CFPB and FTC.

2. Considering legal action for damages due to willful non-compliance under the FCRA, entitling me to statutory damages and compensation for harm caused by incorrect reporting. 

Given the data breach, the urgency of this matter can not be overstated. Notify me in writing of the investigation results and provide an updated copy of my credit report once changes are made. 

Thank you for your prompt attention to this serious matter. 

Sincerely, XXXX XXXX [ Agent/Beneficiary ] without prejudice, all natural inalienable rights reserved.

Product: Credit reporting or other personal consumer reports
Sub-issue: Reporting company used your report improperly
Consumer complaint narrative:
I am writing to this company the 8th time to dispute the unauthorized furnishing of my personal credit information by your company. According to my recent credit report, there are entries that I did not authorize and which I believe are in violation of my rights under the Fair Credit Reporting Act ( FCRA ). This is the 7 letter and dispute I have sent to this creditor along with my police report, FTC report, and supporting identity documents verifying my identity. I indicated in all my letters and police report that I am indeed a victim of identity theft, and this creditors violating my consumer rights and not protecting me as an American consumer according to the stated laws. This is my 7th notice to this company notifying you guys that these listed accounts are fraud. My information isnt protected, and this creditor/company isnt honoring my identity theft claim. I am now pursuing litigation, I am suing this credit company, for AGGRAVATED IDENTITY THEFT, ILLEGALLY FURNISHING FRAUD ACCOUNTS ON MY CREDIT PROFILE, PAIN AND SUFFERING, AND DEFAMATION OF CHARACTER. This company did not honor my consumer rights as a citizen in America regarding my consumer credit file, this company ignored not 1, but 7 documented and certified complaints and letters regarding my identity being compromised. Under stated consumer rights law this company didnt protect, honor, or respect my claim and rights. I provided evidence, police reports, FTC reports, and supporting valid identity documents to verify myself throughout this 6-month process. This company did not honor my rights or acknowledge my supporting documents regarding identity theft. I was incarcerated for 10 years with proof when all these accounts were open illegally and fraudulently and Ive proven this matter and will prove it in court without a doubt. 

I DID NOT OPEN OR AUTHORIZE THESE ACCOUNTS, NOR WAS I INVOLVED IN ANY TRANSACTIONS ASSOCIATED WITH THESE ACCOUNTS. UNDER 18 U.S. CODE 1028 ( AGGRAVATED IDENTITY THEFT ), THE USE OF MY IDENTITY WITHOUT MY KNOWLEDGE OR CONSENT TO COMMIT FRAUDULENT ACTIVITY IS A SERIOUS FEDERAL CRIME. THIS COMPANY IS CONTINUING TO COMMIT A CRIME BY FUNISHING AND REPORTING ACCOUNTS UTILIZING MY IDENTITY WITHOUT MY CONSENT AFTER I MADE THIS COMPANY AWARE OF THE FRAUD, AND IDENTITY THEFT. THIS COMPANY BY LAW IS IN VIOLATION OF MY RIGHTS, AND THIS COMPANY IS A SUSPECT IN THIS IDENTITY THEFT CASE
