Product: Credit reporting or other personal consumer reports
Consumer complaint narrative:
I am writing to formally address concerns regarding the reporting of late payments by [ insert the name of the creditor/financial institution ], which I believe may violate the Fair Credit Reporting Act ( FCRA ). I request your intervention to ensure compliance with the appropriate regulations governing accurate and fair credit reporting.

Under the FCRA ( 15 U.S.C. 1681 ), creditors and financial institutions are legally required to report accurate and timely information to credit reporting agencies. According to the law : Accuracy of Information ( 1681s-2 ( a ) ) : Furnishers of credit information are required to report accurate information to credit reporting agencies. If inaccurate information is identified, it must be corrected promptly.

Duty to Correct and Update Information ( 1681s-2 ( a ) ( 2 ) ) : Furnishers must correct and update information when they become aware that previously provided information is inaccurate or incomplete.

Reasonable Investigation ( 1681s-2 ( b ) ) : When a consumer disputes the accuracy of reported information, creditors must conduct a reasonable investigation and provide corrections if inaccuracies are found.

Based on my review, [ insert specific details about the late payment reporting, such as the dates and nature of the incorrect reporting ], I believe this information needs to be more accurate and align with the requirements outlined in the FCRA. This inaccurate reporting negatively impacts my creditworthiness and financial well-being.

I request that the CFPB investigate this matter to ensure that [ creditor/financial institution ] complies with the FCRAs requirements. Specifically, I ask that they be directed to : Correct any inaccuracies in my credit report related to the late payment.

Ensure all future reporting adheres strictly to FCRA standards.

Provide written confirmation of the actions taken to correct these inaccuracies.

Thank you for your attention to this matter. I look forward to your prompt assistance in upholding my rights under the Fair Credit Reporting Act. 

Sincerely, XXXX XXXX

In accordance with the Fair Credit Reporting act. The List of accounts below has violated my federally protected consumer rights to privacy and confidentiality under 15 USC 1681. 
Account name : # XXXX : XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXXXXXX, NJ XXXX Account name : # XXXXXXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX, MA XXXX has violated my rights. 

15 USC 1681 section 602 A. State I have a right to privacy 15 section 604 A section 2 : It also states a consumer reporting agency can not furnish a account without my written instructions 15 U.S.C. 1681s-2 ( A ) ( 1 ) A person shall not furnish any information relating to a consumer to any consumer reporting agency if the person knows or has reasonable cause to believe that the information is inaccurate.

15 U.S.C. 15 U.S.C. 1681c ( a ) ( 5 ) states that consumer reporting agencies are not allowed to include certain information in consumer reports, including : ( 5 ) Any other adverse item of information, other than records of convictions of crimes which antedates the report by more than seven years.

Central Portfolio Control is liable under the FDCPA 15 USC 1692e ( 10 ), 15 USC 1692d ( 1 ), and 15 USC 1692e ( 2 ). The reason I state this is because the opening date does not align with the date the reported the account on the payment history a violation of the FDCPA 1692e ( 2 ), they are attempting to collect even though I have not received any right to dispute the debt from them, enough information to verify the alleged debt, nor any notice that " it was an attempt to collect a debt '', a violation of the FDCPA 1692e ( 10 ). Lastly, this company is ruining my credit reputation by reporting materially misleading information to my consumer report and because they have not fulfilled proper procedures in accordance with the FDCPA regarding the communication aspect before furnishing their tradeline.

Product: Payday loan, title loan, personal loan, or advance loan
Consumer complaint narrative:
There are three recurring issues with Mariner Finance. One, you can not update your payment methods easily. If you delete a payment method and try to add it back, it says it is already in the system even though it is no longer listed as an option. Because of this the loan provider pulled money out of the wrong account and I almost missed a payment. Despite notifying them of this issue, no action has been taken to fix it. 

The second issue, I can not make additional payments on my loan. Every time I try to make an advance payment, the website says there is a restriction on my loan/payment method with Mariner Finances local branch. Even though I want to pay off my loan faster their system is forcing me to only make the minimum payments. Mariner Finance is prohibiting me from paying off my loan and to accrue interest and have to pay more in the long run. 

And the third issue, is that their login has been down consistently, so I can not even login to manage my loan. Despite contacting their customer service all they do is send me the link to login which doesnt work. This happened on XXXX XXXX XXXX, XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX 


Mariner Finance is a predatory lending company which has faults in their online platform and local branches that force people to pay more on their loans since they cant make additional payments other than the minimum monthly installments.

Consumer complaint narrative:
I hope this message finds you well. My name is XXXX XXXX, and I am reaching out to request your assistance in resolving a longstanding issue regarding a second mortgage on my property located at XXXX XXXX XXXX, XXXX, MA, which has caused me significant harm and is now severely limiting my ability to purchase my next home. 

In XXXX, I purchased my home with both a first and second mortgage. During the financial crisis, I successfully modified my first mortgage with Ocwen Financial Corporation, but I have not received any statements, invoices, or demands for payment on the second mortgage in over a decade. Despite multiple attempts to obtain information from Ocwen, I have been unable to determine the status of the second mortgage, and Ocwen has not acknowledged the debt in their system. 

This situation has placed me in a difficult position, as I am now in the process of selling my home and purchasing a new one. However, without resolution of this second mortgage, I am unable to move forward with my purchase. The uncertainty around this mortgage has not only delayed my plans but has caused significant emotional and financial stress. 

I have attached all the documents I have been able to obtain regarding this matter for your review. I would greatly appreciate any guidance or support your office can provide to help resolve this issue, as it is deeply impacting my ability to move forward with the sale of my current home and the purchase of my next home. 

Thank you for your attention to this matter, and I look forward to hearing from you soon.

Consumer complaint narrative: We began a loan application process with Wells Fargo several months ago beginning with a pre-approval for purchase of a new build home. Around early XXXX all parties were ready to close with loan approval in hand. XXXX delayed the closing process because there were a few minor punch list items for the builder to complete. This delay in closing happened at least XXXX more times throughout XXXX due to XXXX having issues with minor work that needed to be completed. Due to the WFs continuous inability to close on the approved loan, enough time had passed where XXXX apparently needed to repull credit. This final time, due to an erroneously reported past due cc payment, XXXX now says that we are not approved for financing when we were approved just the prior week. They backed out of approval at the last moment and have left my family with the prospect of being homeless. We were never given any indication that once we were approved that this approval could be pulled. This is unfair and unethical as we XXXX done everything the lender has asked during their significant delays.

Consumer complaint narrative: I opened an account with sofi bank. I wired my funds from XXXXXXXX XXXX  to sofi ( around {$2500.00} ). It was open about a month & I deposited a check it initially was cleared after a week. The check then came back, but I had the funds to cover the bad check. They then froze my account which was about 2 months ago saying I violated there policy. I asked them when they were going close my account and issue a check and mail me my remaining funds, they said they couldn't give me any information at this time. Everytime I call that's what they tell me. They still haven't closed my account & are now saying I will not receive my remaining funds when I am owed around {$900.00} & want give any more information. I have asked was there anything I can do to speed up process? One lady told me I could do a verify your id check. So I completed that & she said not to worry after that I would be receiving my funds. I have called twice since then speaking with someone in the fraud department everytime they are now saying this last time I will not be receiving any of my remaining funds. I asked why they couldn't give me a reason. But I don't owe any money to bank, I'm still owed around {$900.00} dollars & want my remaining funds.

Product: Credit reporting or other personal consumer reports
Money transfer, virtual currency, or money service
Consumer complaint narrative:
Summary : I have been unable to transfer my remaining funds ( approximately {$9000.00} ) from my Chase bank account to my personal account in XXXX, where I currently reside. Despite multiple attempts and interactions with Chase customer service, each wire transfer request has been cancelled, leaving me without access to my own money for living expenses. 


In XXXX, while pursuing a XXXX XXXX XXXX in the United States, I opened a Chase bank account. This account was used for tuition payments and daily expenses, including in-store grocery shopping and online purchases on Amazon. Upon graduating and leaving the U.S. in XXXX, the account balance was approximately {$9000.00}. 

Currently residing in XXXX and needing funds for living expenses, I attempted to transfer money from my Chase account to my personal bank account in XXXX. I initiated a wire transfer request through the Chase mobile app. The sequence of events is as follows : 1.First Attempt : 1.1Within 10 minutes, received an email canceling the transfer due to security review. 
1.2Immediately called Chase customer service .

1.3After identity verification, was advised to wait 30 minutes and resubmit the transfer.

2.Second Attempt : 2.1Resubmitted the transfer to my XXXX  account as instructed. 
2.2Received identical cancellation email within minutes.

2.3Called Chase again, receiving the same advice to resubmit after account notation.

3.Third Attempt : 3.1Submitted another request for transfer to my XXXX  account. 
3.2Received same cancellation email within 10 minutes.

3.3Account locked.

3.4Called Chase for the third time.

3.5After identity verification, account unlocked.

3.6Advised again to resubmit transfer request.

4.Fourth Attempt : 4.1App requested a phone call to Chase for a one-time verification code.

4.2Called Chase to obtain the code for the transfer to my XXXX account. 
4.3Unable to locate the transaction in the app during the call.

4.4Transferred to another representative.

4.5After identity verification, received the same response : account noted, await contact from the review team.

4.5Immediately after the call, received the same cancellation email.

Throughout this process, each customer service interaction resulted in identity verification, account notation, and instructions to resubmit the transfer request to my Irish account. Despite multiple assurances of resolution, the issue persists, preventing access to my personal funds and causing significant inconvenience. This ongoing situation has left me unable to transfer my own money from my Chase account to my personal account in XXXX for necessary living expenses.

Product: Money transfer, virtual currency, or money service
Consumer complaint narrative:
This is related to my Venmo account. Name on account is XXXX XXXX ( my married last name ). My Venmo Customer Support Ticket number is XXXX. 

For the past couple of months, I am unable to transfer money from my linked XXXX checking account into venmo. However, Venmo allows me to link my XXXX account and allows me to pay people as long as it's link. But won't allow me to transfer funds into Venmo- a feature I have successfully used before. I attempted to transfer money again and received a message that says I should contact customer service. 

On XX/XX/XXXX, around XXXX XXXX, I called Venmo. The agent could see I had multiple attempts to transfer fund that were declined. 

They said their XXXX referenced a risk rule and to wait XXXX hours for things to reset so I could make the transfer. 

HOWEVER, the agent noted that they could see I had many other attempts where days or weeks went by and nothing in 'their system reset '. 

I asked her to escalate this to their XXXX  or XXXX  team to look into it. She said they couldn't do that and there was no other option to address this. 

I notified her that I am making a formal complaint and wanted her to raise this. She said they didn't have a complaints resolution process. 

I asked to talk to a Supervisor. At first, she said I couldn't but upon pressuring for resolution, she transferred me to a supervisor named XXXX. XXXX basically told me the same thing and mentioned I could get a Venmo debit card as a way to solve for this. 

I found this SUPER problematic. I also notified them that I believe UDAAP has been breached for not having any way to address this. They wanted me to have a subpar product experience and use their product to solve the issue I'm having instead of finding a way to fix it so I could get equal access to all their services and features like all venmo customers. 

At the end of the call, XXXX said she would raise it but did not give any clarity and said she wanted to set my expectation that nothing can be done.

Product: Credit card
Sub-product: General-purpose credit card or charge card
Sub-issue: Credit card company won't increase or decrease your credit limit
Consumer complaint narrative:
I opened my current account in XXXX. Since at least XX/XX/XXXX, my credit limit has been {$10000.00}. ( See attachment 1 ) I believe my credit limit has been {$10000.00} since XXXX. 

I have always paid this account as agreed and on time. My most recent XXXX XXXX Credit Report dated XX/XX/XXXX has no adverse information. All accounts are current, paid as agreed and never late. ( See attachment 2 ) On XX/XX/XXXX, I received an email alert from Synchrony Bank that my XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX CARD account balance was within {$1000.00} of my credit limit. ( See attachment 3 ) I was concerned about this because I carefully manage my account and suspected an unauthorized charge of {$4000.00} or more. My credit limit was still {$10000.00} as of my last statement dated XX/XX/XXXX. ( See attachment 4 ) I logged into my account and discovered I was within {$140.00} of my NEW CURRENT credit limit of {$6000.00}. ( See attachment 5 ) My credit limit was reduced from {$10000.00} to XXXX WITHOUT NOTICE OR EXPLANATION. While online, I tried to request a credit limit increase back to {$10000.00}. The request was denied stating, Your credit limit can not be increased at this time. ( See attachment 6 ) I also received an email stating the same. Ironically, when I logged off my account, a message stated, Thank you for managing your Synchrony accounts. ( See attachment 7 ) I received an email stating the same. ( See Attachment 8 ) It appears that Synchrony Bank needs some training in customer relations. 

I responsibly manage all of my accounts because I use credit as a tool. Synchrony Banks reduction of my credit limit WITHOUT NOTICE is completely unjustified and has undermined my financial management plan and damaged my credit standing. 

I have been treated like a deadbeat that does not repay his debts. This is very insulting to me and reflects negatively on the Chevron brand. WHAT IF THIS WOULD HAVE OCCURRED WHILE TRAVELING ON VACATION? I may have discovered my new reduced credit limit had been reached while trying to pay for a hotel room or buy Chevron gas to return home. I could have been left stranded and my vacation ruined! Few people carry cash these days. 

On XX/XX/XXXX, I finally received a letter dated XX/XX/XXXX ( page XXXX ) stating, Based on a review of your account, Synchrony Bank has lowered your credit line to {$6000.00}. Our decision was based in part on a scoring system that was used to predict your creditworthiness. ( see attachment 9 ) I have held this account since XXXX and therefore there is no need to predict my creditworthiness. I have a proven track record at Synchrony Bank. I also have a credit history extending back into the late XXXX. 

One of the stated reasons was a lack of Real Estate Secured Loan information. I bought a home in XXXX and paid off the loan approximately in XXXX. I also paid off two car loans during that same time period. If I do not have any secured loans now, this should NOT be counted as a negative. 

Another reason listed for the decision is Too many bankcards with high balances compared to credit limit. This factor is instantly created when one or more banks, such as Synchrony Bank, lower their customers credit limit down to an existing balance. The only factor that should matter is whether or not the customer has paid consistently and on time. My most recent XXXX XXXX Credit Report dated XX/XX/XXXX has no adverse information. All accounts are current, paid as agreed and never late. ( See attachment 2 ) On XXXX XXXX, XXXX, my XXXX score was XXXX and my Payment History is listed as exceptional. ( See attachment XXXX ) On XX/XX/XXXX, I received a letter dated XX/XX/XXXX stating that the Synchrony Bank is unable to approve your credit limit increase request [ back to {$10.00}, XXXX ] at this time. The reasons for this decision are listed below : Insufficient experience at your current credit limit. [ now {$6000.00} ] ( See attachment 11 ) This reason is verifiably false and thus only serves as a pretext to deflect from an agenda of illegal discrimination in violation of the Equal Credit Opportunity Act. ( See Synchronys Environmental, Social, and Governance ( ESG ) statement < https : //investors.synchrony.com/esg > and Diversity, Equity, and Inclusion ( DEI ) statement < https : //www.synchrony.com/about-us/diversity > ) I have held this account since XXXX with a credit limit of {$10000.00} since at least XXXX ( I believe it has always been {$10000.00} since opened ). 

Lastly, on XX/XX/XXXX, I mailed a check for {$500.00} as a payment on my account because my remaining credit was close to my new credit limit. I use this card for gasoline, groceries, and online purchases. Inexplicably, my payment did not post to my account until 10 DAYS LATER on XX/XX/XXXX. This caused me great embarrassment at XXXX on XX/XX/XXXX when my card was declined for a {$74.00} purchase. ( See attachment XXXX ) This has NEVER happened to me in my life and should NOT be happening to me now considering my exceptional Credit History! ( See attachment XXXX )

Product: Money transfer, virtual currency, or money service
Consumer complaint narrative:
This is a continuation of my previous [ second ] complaint against Wells Fargo Bank [ case no. XXXX ] dated XX/XX/XXXX. Wells Fargo 's response dated XX/XX/XXXX said nothing at all, and therefore was totally unresponsive to the new issues raised in that complaint. Wells simply said that it had previously addressed my earlier [ first ] complaint dated XX/XX/XXXX, and that We did not find... any no new information that would change our ( previous ) response. However, Wells response is clearly incorrect for two reasons : 1. My second complaint discussed evidence showing that the Wells account received wired funds on XX/XX/XXXX in the amount of {$47000.00} from XXXX Bank [ Victim # 1 ], and immediately thereafter on XX/XX/XXXX and XX/XX/XXXX the fraudster made withdrawals totaling {$47000.00}. As a result that account had only a small remaining balance. 

On XX/XX/XXXX Wells very quickly returned {$47000.00} to XXXX Bank AFTER the fraudster had already removed nearly all of those wired funds. That action was clearly contrary to Wells own statement in its previous [ first ] response : After a fraudster has obtained the funds, the wire transfer can not be reversed. Wells did not in any way address this contradiction and did not explain or justify the basis for its return of {$47000.00} to XXXX. 

2. My second complaint discussed evidence showing that on XX/XX/XXXX the fraudsters Wells account received a second wire of {$47000.00} from XXXX XXXX [ same Victim # 1 ] and also my wire of {$24000.00} from XXXX XXXX. 

The evidence further shows that Wells received fraud recall requests from XXXX XXXX regarding Victim # 1 's wired funds, to which it assigned XXXX case numbers ending in XXXX and XXXX. Wells also received a fraud recall request from XXXX XXXX regarding my wired funds, to which it assigned a XXXX case number ending in XXXX. XXXX XXXX has advised that its fraud recall request was sent to Wells at XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX on Monday XX/XX/XXXX. This evidence strongly suggests that XXXX XXXX recall request was received EARLIER than either of the two recall requests from XXXX. 

Nevertheless, on XX/XX/XXXX Wells returned funds to XXXX in the amounts of {$47000.00} and {$23000.00}, which depleted all remaining funds in the fraudsters account ; and as a result nothing was returned to XXXX XXXX. This evidence strongly suggests that my {$24000.00} wired funds which were recalled earlier by XXXX XXXX were wrongfully included in the {$70000.00} that was returned to XXXX. Rather, {$24000.00} should have been returned to XXXX XXXX, and the remaining balance of only {$46000.00} should have been returned to XXXX. Wells did not in any way address or explain or justify its actions described above. 

As discussed above, Wells Fargo has completely failed to respond in a responsible manner to my second complaint, and it must be held accountable.
Company public response: Company has responded to the consumer and the CFPB and chooses not to provide a public response

Product: Checking or savings account
Consumer complaint narrative: XX/XX/scrub>XXXX XXXX XXXX  was one of the most stressful days of my life. You probably get a lot of complaints but i truly believe this one needs to seriously be looked into considering on how reputable credit karma is and how many of us Americans use it.On XXXX of this year, I had moved all of my money over to credit karma savings as they provided a high yield compared to others. I was in the process of getting a house and they were unable to provide proper documentation needed for the purchase of the home which almost cost me to lose this house. Luckily my lender was really nice and worked really hard to try to get the information needed through other venues being that credit karma was unhelpful, unprofessional and just plain did not have the tools that they're supposed to have to be able to show where funds are sourcing from. Fast forward to about two weeks later, someone had tried to hack into my credit karma account and changed its password, i was unable to see my credit karma activity at all, my email got subscription bombed which forced me to create a new email. Also had to freeze my accounts and lock my credit cards. All my money was in credit karma, i called them over 20 times over the course of 12 hours on that day and no one helped me up to this day. I got hung up on on 90 % of the calls, they werent even able to provide me with balance, transactions made ( considering that they were threatening me to close the account due to many transactions when i only made 4 and i have 6 transactions per month on that account without repercussions ), or even basic trouble shooting for the account. All they said was " you will receive a call within 5 business days with a solution '' when someone was trying to rob my account AT THAT MOMENT AND I NEEDED IMMMEADIATE ASSSISTANCE. They " froze '' the account, however i was able to withdraw all my funds from the account when thats wasnt supposed to happen. Up to this day, no one got back to me, luckily i was able to withdraw my money with my account being frozen but credit karma money needs to seriously be investigated. They are such a reputable company that literally provides ZERO assistance if your account gets hacked or even if your money is in risk of getting stolen. No money got stolen from me as luckily i got up extra early that day and was able to act quickly before this ended in tragedy. This could happen to anyone and end very bad.

Product: Credit reporting or other personal consumer reports
Consumer complaint narrative:
This letter serves as a formal demand to XXXX for the immediate removal of the inaccurate and fraudulent Kikoff Lending account, Account No : XXXX, from my XXXX credit report. The account is being reported inaccurately with late payments for XX/XX/year> and XX/XX/year>, which violates FCRA 15 U.S.C. 1681a ( 2 ) ( A ) ( i ). This section clearly states that a consumer report does not include any report containing information solely regarding payment history or utilization between the individual and the company making the report. Therefore, the reporting of these late payments is not only unlawful but constitutes a direct violation of federal law.

Additionally, under FCRA 605B ( 15 U.S.C. 1681c-2 ), I demand that XXXX block this fraudulent information within 4 business days as required by law. The reporting of this account and its associated derogatory remarks is both fraudulent and harmful to my credit.

Under FCRA 1681e ( b ), you are required to maintain reasonable procedures to ensure the maximum possible accuracy of consumer information. The information being reported by XXXX is inaccurate and unverifiable, violating FCRA 1681i ( a ) ( 1 ) ( A ), which mandates that inaccurate or unverifiable information must be corrected or deleted within 30 days. Given the seriousness of this issue, I demand the immediate removal of this account within 14 days of receiving this letter. 

Noncompliance with this request will be considered a willful violation of FCRA 1681n, entitling me to statutory and punitive damages. If this issue is not resolved promptly, I will escalate the matter by filing a formal complaint with the Consumer Financial Protection Bureau ( CFPB ) and pursuing legal action. 

Please provide written confirmation that this account and its associated derogatory remarks have been permanently removed from my XXXX credit report within 14 days of receipt of this letter. 

These letters are now clear about which bureau they are directed to ( XXXX or XXXX ) and are stronger in tone. When sent to the CFPB, they will clearly indicate which letter corresponds to which bureau. 

Please remove the inaccurate late payments for XXXX and XX/XX/year> for account XXXX from my credit report & stop reporting account XXXX to my XXXX credit report. Reporting this violates FCRA 1681a ( 2 ) ( A ) ( i ). I demand immediate correction.

Consumer complaint narrative:
Date : XX/XX/XXXX Dear Sir/Madam I am writing to formally request that a security freeze be placed on my credit file, effective immediately, pursuant to Section 605A of the Fair Credit Reporting Act ( FCRA ) ( 15 U.S.C. 1681c-1 ).

1. Restriction on Disclosure of Information ( Section 604 of the FCRA, 15 U.S.C. 1681b ) Pursuant to Section 604 of the FCRA, I demand that no disclosure of my personal information, including consumer reports, be made to any person, organization, or entity that is not legally authorized to receive such information or that does not have my explicit consent.

2. Right to Privacy ( Section 609 of the FCRA, 15 U.S.C. 1681g ) In accordance with Section 609 of the FCRA, I request written confirmation that my personal information, including any medical or insurance information, will not be disclosed to third parties without my prior consent, except as strictly required by law. This confirmation should detail the measures taken to protect my information in accordance with legal requirements. 



XXXX. Prohibition of Unauthorized Disclosure under Consumer Privacy Protection Laws Additionally, in line with federal and state privacy laws, I demand that no information contained in my file be disclosed to insurance companies or any other third parties without my explicit, written approval, unless required by law. Any unauthorized disclosure will be considered a violation of my privacy rights and will result in appropriate legal action. 



I attempted to make this request through your agency 's online portal, but unfortunately was unable to complete the process. For this reason, I am submitting this request in writing to ensure that the credit freeze is implemented in a timely manner. 

Below is the information necessary to process this request : XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX, CA XXXX. 

XX/XX/XXXX SS XXXX

Product: Debt collection
Issue: Took or threatened to take negative or legal action

Consumer complaint narrative:
To Whom It May Concern : I am writing to file a formal complaint against Planet Home Lending for placing inaccurate information on my consumer report and for violations of the Fair Credit Reporting Act ( FCRA ) and the Fair Debt Collection Practices Act ( FDCPA ). Additionally, Planet Home Lending appears to be operating without proper registration as a third-party debt collector with the Texas Secretary of State, which is required by Texas law to legally collect debts in the state.

Complaint Details : 1. Inaccurate Information on Credit Report : Planet Home Lending has placed erroneous information on my credit report, indicating an alleged debt.

2. Failure to Comply with FCRA and FDCPA : Planet Home Lending has failed to comply with the FCRA by not conducting a reasonable investigation and by not providing me with the required validation of debt. Additionally, the companys actions violate the FDCPA, as it has engaged in misleading and deceptive practices by reporting an alleged debt.

3. Non-Compliance with Texas State Requirements : Under Section 392.101 of the Texas Finance Code, a third-party debt collector must obtain a surety bond and file it with the Texas Secretary of State. Upon review, I found that Planet Home Lending is not listed in the Secretary of States database as a registered debt collector, suggesting that they are unlawfully operating in Texas without proper authorization. 


I have attached copies of all relevant documentation, including evidence of the companys non-registration and correspondence regarding the inaccurate information on my consumer reporting. 

Thank you for your attention to this matter. I look forward to your prompt response. 

Sincerely, XXXX XXXX XXXX All Rights Reserved.

Product: Credit reporting or other personal consumer reports
Sub-issue: Reporting company used your report improperly
Consumer complaint narrative:
Re : Dispute of Inaccurate Information LVNV Funding LLC Account Number : XXXX Original Creditor : XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX. 

Dear LVNV, I am writing to formally dispute the inaccurate information that has appeared on my credit report regarding a debt that was allegedly transferred to LVNV Funding LLC. The details of the account are as follows : Account Number : XXXX Original Creditor : XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX. 
Date Opened : XX/XX/year> Account Status : Collection account with {$650.00} past due as of XX/XX/year> Balance : {$650.00} Original Balance : {$650.00} Dispute Points : Unauthorized Transfer of Debt : I have never agreed to or signed any contract allowing the transfer of my debt from XXXX XXXXXXXX XXXX XXXX. to LVNV Funding LLC. Furthermore, I was not notified of this transfer, which is a violation of my consumer rights under the Fair Debt Collection Practices Act ( FDCPA ). 

Privacy Violations : This unauthorized transfer and reporting of my personal financial information to LVNV Funding LLC is a violation of the Gramm-Leach-Bliley Act ( GLBA ), which protects my financial privacy. The handling and sharing of my information without my consent is illegal. 

Fair Credit Reporting Violations : The reporting of this collection account by LVNV Funding LLC is inaccurate and unlawful. LVNV Funding LLC is acting as a debt buyer and is required by the Fair Credit Reporting Act ( FCRA ) to ensure that the information they report is accurate and verifiable. Since I have not received any verifiable proof of the debt transfer or the legality of their collection efforts, this account must be removed.

Action Requested : I demand the immediate removal of this collection account from my credit report. 
I request that you provide proof of the debts accuracy and documentation verifying that LVNV Funding LLC has the legal right to collect this debt. 
If this issue is not resolved, I will escalate the matter with the Federal Trade Commission ( FTC ), the Consumer Financial Protection Bureau ( CFPB ), and other appropriate government agencies for further legal action. 
Please complete this investigation promptly and notify me of the results in writing. 

Thank you for your immediate attention to this matter. 

Sincerely, XXXX XXXX

Product: Checking or savings account
Consumer complaint narrative:
Today ( XXXX  ), a total refund in the amount of {$2600.00} was deposited into my Capital One checking account by XXXX AS AGENT, bringing my total checking account balance to {$2700.00}. This is the refund amount that I requested be deposited into my checking account after the student loan that I borrowed from Department of Education paid for my graduate classes -- so that I could use these remaining funds to pay for the textbooks, etc. of the XXXX XXXX classes for which I registered this semester. 

When I went to a store ATM ( listed on Capital One 's app as an ATM approved by Capital One ) to withdraw some of these funds today ( XXXX ), the ATM stated that the transaction was declined by the financial institution ( Capital One ). I immediately went back to my car and called Capital One. 

Upon my call, XXXX, a Capital One employee from overseas, told me my account was restricted then sent an email, stating my account is restricted. Funny how this restriction came only after I tried withdrawing my funds. He also would NOT tell me why I could not withdraw my own money and why my account was restricted. I requested to speak to a US-based supervisor. XXXX kept me on the line for XXXX minutes, telling me repeatedly he was looking for a US-based supervisor that I eventually hung up without ever being connected to one. When I mentioned that I was going to report Capital One to CFPB and other relevant agencies, XXXX asked me to take a photo of my ID and text it to him, which I refused. I told him that if this had been a standard procedure, he would have asked me to do that in the beginning of the call, not after XXXX minutes into my being on hold. 

After hanging up on XXXX, I called again and got connected to another overseas Capital One employee named XXXX. XXXX eventually got me connected to someone named XXXX ( employee # XXXX ), who claimed to be a US-based supervisor. He, too, would NOT tell me why my account is restricted and why I could not withdraw my own money. When I told him that I need my money now for my classes, he claimed that I would instead be getting a check in the mail in the amount of {$2700.00} within the next XXXX business days. I want my money NOW.

Product: Credit card
Sub-product: General-purpose credit card or charge card
Sub-issue: Problem with rewards from credit card
Consumer complaint narrative: I tried to redeem my Discover credit card rewards points toward a gift card online. Each time when I tried to redeem the points, my account got locked. That issue occurred constently for many days ( over one week ). I have called Discover for more than 20 times for this issue, but the issue could not be resolved. I have talked with representatives from the front-line support team, the web support team, the tech support team, and the security department XXXX No one could solve the issue for me. To make things worse, different people told me very different things. One representative said that since the system did not allow me to redeem the rewards points, just did not redeem it. Another representative said that he had reported this issue to the central office of Discover and I needed to wait for 36 hours and then all things would be just fine. I have waited for over one week, and the issue is still there. Another representative said that this was not a technological issue but a security issue and that I needed to talk with the security department. I talked with the security department, and they said this is not a security issue and the only people who could deal with it is the tech support team. Another representative from the security department said that this was indeed a security issue but they could not resolve it. The last representative said that the only option for me is keeping redeeming the points until it finally work. Well, I have already tried that for more than 50 time, and my account got locked each time.
Company: CAPITAL ONE, NATIONAL ASSOCIATION - GREENWOOD DELAWARE BRANCH

Product: Mortgage
Sub-issue: Trying to communicate with the company to fix an issue while managing or servicing your loan
Consumer complaint narrative:
I am the owner of the loan with LoanCare. This loan was previously owned by XXXX, who have contributed to the issues with her loan. 

On XX/XX/XXXX, I closed on a loan with XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX to purchase XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX, XXXX XXXXXXXX, XXXX XXXX, Florida XXXX. This loan with XXXX included a 2-1 Buydown in which the seller provided a credit to be used for an interest point buy-down for the buyer. This was explained as a relatively easy concept in which the sellers paid money, and the first year, I would pay a monthly loan amount 2 % points lower on her loan, from 6.75 % to 4.75 % for the first year. The second year, the mortgage was to go to 5.75 % on XX/XX/XXXX. However, on closing day, I discovered that I could not find the buy down paperwork within the closing documents. This created confusion and chaos on closing day and questions as to the monthly mortgage amounts being higher than initially told. These comments were ignored and ultimately, I closed after being reassured that they buy down paperwork would be in the ink signed documents. As for the monthly amount, I was never given an explanation other than once the buy down was applied, it would be lower. I ultimately paid the amount toldwhich should not have included property taxes each month for the year of XXXX, as those were paid at closing. ( See XXXX XXXX ) Despite all this confusion, I paid my mortgage every month, in the erroneous amount, through the end of XXXX. XXXX provided an Escrow Analysis, which raised my mortgage even more, due to property taxes. ( See XXXX XXXX ). I am 100 % Totally and Permanently XXXX Vet, and as such, in the State of Florida, I am exempt from property taxes in my primary residence. This benefit was applied for and approved for the home I lived in prior to purchasing my new condo. I paid XXXX taxes on that home as it was my primary residence for most of XXXX. ( See XXXX  XXXX ). On XX/XX/XXXX, I both called and emailed XXXX regarding her XXXX status and emailed my paperwork showing I am exempt from property taxes. ( See XXXX  XXXX ). They refused to do a new escrow analysis to reflect the lack of taxes, so I reduced my payments, as she stated in my email, to eliminate property taxes and requested XXXX to comply with the law and remove them from my payments. XXXX refused and called to inquire as to when she would find out about the property taxes on her primary residence. I informed them that the State of Florida did not even require the applications to be due until XXXX and the XXXX XXXX XXXX told her to expect the information in XXXX. I did not hear back from XXXX after XXXX and I figured they were waiting for her property assessment, since taxes were not due until XXXX, it was impossible for her to be delinquent on that bill until then. 

Unknown to me, XXXX sold my loan to a new company, called LoanCare. On XX/XX/XXXX, LoanCare sent me a welcome email. After calling to confirm my loan had been sold, they informed me I was delinquent due to not paying her property taxes. I provided LoanCare the same information on XX/XX/XXXX, that was provided to XXXX on XX/XX/XXXX. On XX/XX/XXXX, LoanCare informed me that they were removing the property taxes from my account due to my status as a 100 % Totally and Permanently XXXX Service Vet and my exemption under Florida Law. They instructed me to pay a new amount, that was also in an amount larger than I expected, but I paid the amount on XX/XX/XXXX, until I could figure out why my loan was in such a confusing state. 

In the beginning of XX/XX/XXXX, I received a call from LoanCare in which they informed her me again that I was delinquent. Having made every payment on time for the existence of the loan, I believed this was again about the property taxes being removed. It was only after some back and forth with the LoanCare representative, was it discovered that LoanCare had no paperwork on my 2-1 Buy-down and believed they had purchased a loan at 6.75 %, and not the new 2nd year loan at the buy-down interest rate of 5.75 %. Immediately concerned due to the issues she had on closing day, I contacted her primary banker, XXXX XXXX XXXX, to see if he could find out what happened. ( See XXXX XXXX  ). I was sent, by the title company, the Buy-Down paperwork to sign on XX/XX/XXXX. This was the same paperwork she had requested on the day of her closing and was guaranteed to be in her closing documents on XX/XX/XXXX. It was not included in the closing documents and had to be re-accomplished 14 months later. 

At this point, since XXXX XXXX was no longer with XXXX, he contacted XXXX XXXX XXXX, who was the Director of Closing operations at XXXX. XXXX XXXX worked with LoanCare and on XX/XX/XXXX, it seemed that everything was worked out. XXXX XXXX reported from LoanCare : I spoke with the tax and escrow teams. The tax office confirmed the customer is 100 % Veteran exemption. However the customer has to pay a Valorem tax in the amount of {$49.00} per year. The escrow team will analyze the account today. Below is the payment effective XX/XX/XXXX and the customer also has {$1800.00} in suspense that can be used for her payment. There has been no negative reporting because of the transfer and there is a stop until XX/XX/XXXX. XXXX XXXXXXXX completed XXXX XX/XX/XXXX. XXXX XXXX is {$2700.00}. XXXX reduced {$110.00} per month. Overage is {$3300.00}, will be mailed out to customer. ( See XXXX XXXX ). 

I then received a new escrow analysis, which was completely different from the XXXX Escrow Analysis just 6 months earlier. It no longer had the property taxes in it, and it also no longer claimed that she owed extra money to get rid of an escrow deficit.instead, it admitted that she was owed almost {$3400.00} in overage and seemed to have her payments correct and they were lower than what she paid in for XX/XX/XXXX. ( See XXXX  XXXX ). 

After fighting with both companies for almost six months to correct my account, to remove the property taxes that, as a XXXX veteran, I was legally exempt from paying, I finally believed that my mortgage was correct. It wasnt until I called in XXXX to confirm they had copies of my insurance, did I find out that LoanCare, despite what XXXX XXXX told me, still claimed there was a missed payment. They first said it was XX/XX/XXXX where there was a missed payment. XXXX XXXX again stepped in, but LoanCare could not even provide answers another bank could understand, let alone a consumer. I provided proof of her XX/XX/XXXX payment and she was asked for proof of XX/XX/XXXX payment, which she also provided. I requested and then later begged for them to give me an answer to what month they claim I was delinquent on so I could clear this up. LoanCare then took one month to analyze her account. LoanCare claimed to not have enough information to tell me which month they were so confident I was delinquent in at that timedespite sending her threatening letters to report her to the credit bureau and take legal action against her. How they felt they had enough information to threaten legal action, but not be able to answer her simple questions on what payments she was behind on, is truly astonishing. In addition, in XXXX threatening letters, they claimed she was not responding to them. An obvious lie, based on all the attachments to this complaint. I was in contact with them non-stop to try to resolve this issue. ( See XXXX XXXX ). 

Finally, on XX/XX/XXXX, almost 5 months after the purchase of the loan from XXXX, XXXX XXXX XXXX from LoanCare provided a response. ( See XXXXXXXX  XXXX ) The response provided by LoanCare, after all this confusion, was nonsensical and full of bogus information. It did not explain why she should be back property taxes on the first 6 months of the year, it did not explain why they took back a credit or why. It did nothing to explain how, LoanCare, came to the realization that I owed exactly one month payment... when I never missed a full month 's payment. 

LoanCare did an escrow analysis, removed property taxes from the bill starting on XX/XX/XXXX, acknowledging my XXXX vet status, took out the taxes each month which amounted to {$370.00}. This amount was almost the exact same amount I reduced from my payments to XXXX, starting in XX/XX/XXXX, as I was exempt from paying the taxes, as I told XXXX. This is also the same amount that LoanCare claimed was still owed when LoanCare was transferred her loan. It was at this time, after additional investigating, that I found out XXXX reported me delinquent to credit agencies, for taxes I did not owe. XXXX has since removed the delinquent notice to the credit agencies. 
LoanCare acknowledged in their Escrow Analysis that I do not owe monthly property taxes in the amount of {$370.00}, but then claimed that the shortfall from XXXX of {$370.00} when it was transferred to them. I do not owe payment for property taxes for any part of the year, not just for the part of the year that LoanCare approved and seems to want her to believe. I didnt owe them for any part of the 2024 year, per Florida Law. ( See XXXX  XXXX ). I made every monthly payment required. ( See XXXX XXXXXXXX ). On XX/XX/XXXX, I disputed this accounting provided by XXXX XXXX XXXX and requested a full review of her account be provided. A new individual, XXXX XXXX XXXX eventually responded after XXXX XXXX asked again on XX/XX/XXXX, informing her they were looking into the matter. There has been no response since and my attorney has now sent a letter similar to this complaint. 

A simple review of all the emails and correspondence I had with both banks reveals deceptive practices by both XXXX and LoanCare. Both banks provided material interference with the ability of me, the consumer to understand the term or condition of a consumer financial product or service. In addition, the banks took unreasonable advantage of my reasonable reliance on the banks to act in the interests of the consumer. From the day of closing, I expressed confusion over amounts owed as well as adequate paperwork that explained it. This turned out to be good questions to ask, because less than a year later, it was discovered the paperwork was not handled correctly, despite her best due diligence and XXXX added in property taxes that she had already pre-paid for. In addition, XXXX  XXXX Escrow Analysis was another complete disaster, which failed to account for her escrow overage and instead, increased her amounts in XXXX to cover a shortfall. XXXX XXXX XXXX and XXXX XXXX tried their best to assist with damage control, but there was only so much they could do, as they did not work for the new company and XXXX XXXX did not even work for XXXX any longer. 

LoanCare has repeatedly been deceptive in their communications with me. LoanCare changed their theories on what the problem was. Ranging from interest rates being incorrect, to property taxes, to refunding me money and instructing her to use a credit to pay part of a month, to then take the credit back and use that bait and switch of money to claim she was delinquent for that month as well. LoanCare has put money in and taken money out of my mortgage account with no explanation. I have begged LoanCare for answers regarding her loan for months, yet they could not provide them. LoanCare clearly engaged in deceptive banking practices. They refuse to provide a full accounting on a loan that is not that old. Yet, they still felt emboldened enough to threaten me with legal action. 

After months of fighting and getting no resolution, I have had to hire an attorney to assist me.
Company public response: Company has responded to the consumer and the CFPB and chooses not to provide a public response

Product: Mortgage
Consumer complaint narrative: Our mortgage payment on XX/XX/year> went up from {$1400.00} to {$1900.00} per month without notice or any warning. Last year we received a kickback from our escrow account saying that we over paid for our taxes. I called and confirmed they stated we simply over paid, and added that extra to my principle. ( This was within the 1st year of owning our home, so knowing we may or may not have over estimated what our escrow should be. ) Our mortgage dropped from {$1600.00} a month to {$1400.00} a month. On XX/XX/XXXX with no notice my mortgage went up by {$600.00} per month! I called and originally the mortgage servicer said my taxes doubled... I called the tax assessor 's office and they said my taxes went down by {$100.00} since last year. I called the mortgage company back and they told me they made a mistake. They received the noticed from our city for due taxes late in XXXX, so they went ahead ASSUMED our taxes dropped by 50 % ( how would this ever be feasible??? ), and adjusted our mortgage, and kicked us an escrow check. We have been paying {$1400.00} since they told us we over paid ( about a year! ) Now we are footing the bill for the short escrow account and the taxes and home insurance they supposedly paid for us ( without notice our escrow was being over drawn ), which now we owe them back for. A whopping {$3800.00} if we can't do it in one lump sum, it equates to {$600.00} extra a month. I'm paying out the nose for their mistake. This is such an unprofessional practice and could easily force a family into forclosure for unprofessional practice. I work full time and am a student and either me or my wife ( who also works full time ) will now need to find a 2nd source of income.

Product: Mortgage
Sub-issue: Changes in loan terms during or after closing
Consumer complaint narrative:
I am a co-owner on my residence located at XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXXXXXX with my mother, XXXX XXXX, who is now deceased. At the time of the closing on XX/XX/year>, my father was also a record owner. He is also now deceased. I signed the mortgage documents as a co-borrower. 

The loan was underwritten through CrossCountry Mortgage, LLC located at XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXXXXXX. I will attach a copy of the Closing Disclosure form. 

The closing was conducted by XXXX XXXX XXXX, located at XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXXXXXX. 

The loan representative for CrossCountry Mortgage was XXXX XXXX. Another representative involved in the closing was XXXX XXXX. 

My parents were both born in XXXX and spoke XXXX as a second language. The reason for the refinance was to keep the monthly payments about the same while allowing some cash out in order to pay other bills. My father was XXXX  at the time of the closing and my mother was working XXXX XXXX XXXX years of age. 

The rate on the prior mortgage was 4.125 %. Again, the refinance was undertaken to realize some equity in the house to pay other bills, but keep the payments roughly the same. This meant extending the term for some years, which was fine At all times during this issue I resided with my parents in the home. It is my only residence. 

CrossCountry Mortgage stated that we could have a payment of {$1700.00} with a rate of 5.563 %. We were told that this payment included our property tax bills.

Later, we discovered that the real estate taxes were not included, which resulted in a new monthly payment of over {$2000.00}. Had we been quoted this figure prior to closing, my parents and I would have never gone through with the refinance closing.

My parents, being immigrants, as well as trusting individuals relied on the honesty and integrity of CrossCountry Mortgage. 

I realize now in scrutinizing the CD closely with the help of a real estate attorney that the taxes were not in escrow. This contradicts the express promises made to our family by the two representatives of CrossCountry.

One year later, CrossCountry contacted us to say that the taxes hadn't been paid and they were now forcing us into an escrow account and claimed that there was more than {$6000.00} owed retroactively. To say this was an unpleasant surprise to my mother is an understatement. 

We never would have taken this loan at a higher rate than our existing mortgage had we been told that the payments would exceed {$2300.00} a month. We accepted the higher rate with CrossCountry on their express promise that our payments ( with taxes included ) were going to be around XXXX XXXXXXXX. 

My mother has now passed and I live in the house alone. I can barely afford to make these monthly payments and of course regret relying on the verbal promises of unscrupulous brokers.

Consumer complaint narrative:
XX/XX/year>, I charged {$170.00} for my XXXX teaching platform. On XX/XX/year>, I paid {$200.00} to pay off that charge. After that I paid {$500.00} more toward the balance of the card. I was charged {$1.00} in interest for that month. Also, in total, I paid 29 TIMES THE minimum amount due for that month. 

In XXXX, XXXX, I paid timely {$330.00} toward the balance on the card. I paid XXXX XXXX times the minimum payment due for that month and was still charged {$1.00} in interest. I made no charges on the card during XXXX. 

The balance due since XXXX on this card ( and previously ) is a XXXX PERCENT INTEREST PROMOTIONAL BALANCE. I have paid ENORMOUS AMOUNTS on this card in the last months. 

I called customer service Friday to find out why I was charged interest on this card. They said according to their terms of my promotion, it is up to their discretion, as to whether or not they charge interest. 

Why am I still being charged interest, when I paid off the charge in XXXX? In my opinion, with me paying XXXX XXXX times what was requested in a minimum payment over XXXX and XXXX, it is certainly bad business to charge me interest, when there were no charges in XXXX. With all credit card companies that I've dealt with, after a charge is paid off, no interest continues to accrue. Why was I charged interest at all and in particular, why was I charged interest in XXXX? 

I am a valuable customer to PNC and this is insulting, bad business and it is horrible to treat a customer like this. If it is, in fact, up to their discretion, as to whether or not interest is going to be charged to me, they need to up their discretion and determine which customers they want to keep and which they do not.

Product: Debt collection
Issue: Attempts to collect debt not owed
Consumer complaint narrative:
XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXXXXXX in XXXX XXXX has violated Texas state law, and when I filed a complaint with the Attorney Generals office of Texas I was directed to file a complainant with yall. 

On XX/XX/XXXX I took my daughter XXXX XXXX to XXXXXXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXXXXXX for an exam. I was told she needed extensive work done on her XXXX. We scheduled an appointment for XX/XX/XXXX for the procedure and pre-paid {$350.00}. When we arrived I was told we needed to pay the bill in full before any work could be done. I was told we owed {$1000.00} so I paid the requested amount with a credit card. After that the proceeded was completed and we left. 

I never heard from XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXXXXXX again, no emails, phone calls, or letters in the mail. At the end of XX/XX/XXXXXXXX  I received a bill in the mail for {$350.00} from them. The bill was dated XX/XX/XXXX and had no explanation for what it was for. Just a demand to pay in 15 days or it would be sent to collections. 

According to Texas state law : " CIVIL PRACTICE AND REMEDIES CODE TITLE 6. MISCELLANEOUS PROVISIONS CHAPTER 146. CERTAIN CLAIMS BY HEALTH CARE SERVICE PROVIDERS BARRED Sec. 146.002. TIMELY BILLING REQUIRED. ( a ) Except as provided by Subsection ( b ) or ( c ), a health care service provider shall bill a patient or other responsible person for services provided to the patient not later than the XXXX  day of the XXXX month after the date the services are provided. : ''. This bill was sent 1 year and 7 months after the services provided and violates Texas state law. 

I called their billing department and explained this to them and the refused to accept that they violated state law, and demanded I pay. I asked to speak to their supervisor and was told he was busy, I then asked for their supervisor to call me back and I was told no that they would not call me back to discus this further, then they hung up on me. 

They have now sent this to a collection agency ( Tek Collect ) who is harassing me for this illegal bill. As stated I contacted the Attorney Generals office and also my state representatives and was told I should file my complaint with yall. Please find attached all documents I have regarding this. Thank you for your time looking into this matter.
Company public response: Company believes complaint caused principally by actions of third party outside the control or direction of the company

Product: Payday loan, title loan, personal loan, or advance loan
Issue: Charged fees or interest you didn't expect
Consumer complaint narrative:
I opened a line with Tally inc. several years ago. The premise of their product was that they would offer a lower interest rate than my credit card, and shift my debt onto their loan platform at the lower rate, and automatically pay off my credit cards in an optimal fashion to reduce interest costs. It worked like this for awhile. My line of credit on Tally was about {$8000.00} at an interest rate of around 11.9 %, which was far less than the cards I was paying off.

Around a year ago myself and most if not all members of the Tally community were sent an email saying that due to lack of investors, Tally would no longer be able to service our loans the same way. They said they would no longer be able to pay off and manage our card repayments with their service. Also, they let us know they were increased interest rates from the 11.9 % I had to 24.99 %. I requested information and refused payment, because this was illegal, and after excess of probably 40 emails I was only given generic copy and paste automated messages from Tally. I called and no one could tell me anything. They said they could change interest as they saw fit. 

So now, the product that they advertised as saving me money on interest, had higher interest than the original cards they came off of. It gets even worse. A few days ago I get an email that Tally is closing its door, dissolving. How nice. They sold my debt to a third party company, with no consent, with the below information. 

XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX ( XXXX ) Telephone number : XXXX Hours : Monday through Friday from XXXX XXXX and XXXX from XXXX XXXX Correspondence Address : XXXX  XXXX XXXX XXXX, XXXX XXXX, MO XXXX Payment XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX, IL XXXX This is a debt XXXX agency XXXX not a credit servicing company. Which means my dead that I had with Tally, will now be reported as collections. Even though it was only sent to collections because they dissolved their company after going insolvent. Tally has broken law after law after law, and now I will have an account with a non agreed upon interest rate with a collection agency and I did nothing wrong. This is absolute insanity, and I hope the government eats the executives from Tally alive, and I hope SRT is punished for purchasing manipulated debt.

Product: Credit reporting or other personal consumer reports
Issue: Unable to get your credit report or credit score
Sub-issue: Problem getting your free annual credit report
Consumer complaint narrative:
On XX/XX/2024, I attempted to obtain my credit report from Equifax through XXXX. However, I received no report. Instead, the screen displayed only a blank page under the Equifax logo where the credit report was supposed to appear. 

Despite multiple attempts to obtain the report, Equifax has informed me that the report has already been provided. As a result, I have not received the credit report to which I am legally entitled under the Fair Credit Reporting Act ( FCRA ). Additionally, this issue has resulted in one of my legally permissible requests being considered used, despite not having received the actual report. 

Furthermore, in correspondence with banks, I have been provided with specific credit score and credit report details, indicating that such information exists and is accessible to financial institutions. This discrepancy underscores that my credit report is available to banks, yet I am unable to access it. 

I am attaching screenshots of the blank screen and the agencys response asserting that the report was provided. I request that the CFPB investigate this matter to ensure compliance with the FCRA, facilitate the provision of my credit report, and address the issue of the unused request. 

Attachments : Screenshot of the blank screen received from Equifax. 
Correspondence from Equifax stating the report was provided.

Consumer complaint narrative:
In XXXX of XXXX, I received a non-itemized bill in the mail from XXXX XXXX XXXX for over {$2000.00}. I immediately wrote a letter directly to XXXX XXXX XXXX at their headquarters in Louisiana disputing the bill and asking for clarification on what service they supposedly provided. I never heard back from them. 

In XX/XX/XXXX, I received a collection letter from XXXX XXXX XXXX seeking payment of {$2000.00} on behalf of XXXX XXXX XXXX. Product: Credit reporting or other personal consumer reports
Issue: Problem with a company's investigation into an existing problem

Consumer complaint narrative:
I am submitting this complaint against TransUnion for permitting the re-addition of deleted accounts, improper re-aging of accounts, and the inclusion of discharged bankruptcy accounts without proper verification. These accounts were previously removed from my credit report after disputes but have been re-added without proper investigation or documentation. Additionally, there is evidence that certain accounts have been re-aged to make them appear more recent than they actually are.

The practice of re-aging and re-reporting discharged bankruptcy accounts contradicts both Fair Credit Reporting Act ( FCRA ) standards and bankruptcy protection laws, and it has caused continued harm to my credit report. 

Specific Issues : XXXX. Failure to Verify Accounts Properly : TransUnion allowed accounts to be re-added after being deleted, without requiring any further verification or investigation from the original creditors or debt buyers. There is no proof that these accounts have been properly validated in terms of transaction history to allow me to examine and verify, balances, dates, or my liability as I was on end of life care during the time period in question. 



XXXX. Re-Aging of Accounts : I have observed re-aging of multiple accounts, where the dates of last activity have been altered to reflect more recent dates, making these debts appear more current than they are. This tactic extends the reporting period for accounts that should no longer be listed or should be closer to expiring on my credit report under statute of limitations. 



XXXX. Reporting of Discharged Bankruptcy Accounts : TransUnion has allowed the re-reporting of accounts that were included and discharged in my bankruptcy case. These accounts were wiped out in bankruptcy and should no longer be reported. TransUnion has failed to verify that these accounts are no longer collectable and should not be appearing as adverse items. 



XXXX. Circumventing Legal Verification Requirements : The re-addition and re-aging of accounts appear to be a tactic used by debt collectors and creditors to bypass FCRA requirements, avoiding the proper steps of verification. TransUnion has failed to hold these furnishers accountable, thus violating my consumer rights.

5. Negative Impact on My Credit and Health : The continued re-reporting and re-aging of these accounts, along with the wrongful inclusion of discharged debts, has significantly harmed my credit score and increased stress, negatively impacting my health.

Debt collection
Issue: Attempts to collect debt not owed
Consumer complaint narrative:
XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX Consumer Financial Protection Bureau XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX Subject : Dispute of Collection Account under FCRA - Account No. XXXX Dear CFPB Representative, I am writing to formally dispute the inaccurate and misleading information that is being reported on my credit report by William Rush & Associates . The account in question has the following details : Creditor Name : William Rush & Associates Account Number : XXXX Amount Delinquent : {$2400.00} Address : XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX Payment Status : Collection/Chargeoff Dispute Reason : I believe this account is being reported inaccurately in violation of the Fair Credit Reporting Act ( FCRA ). According to the FCRA : No Contract with Collection Agency : I do not have any contractual relationship with William Rush & Associates, and I did not authorize any such entity to collect this debt on my behalf. As per 15 U.S. Code 1692e, debt collectors must report accurate information and must not use deceptive or misleading representations.

Incorrect Reporting of Debt : According to the IRS, an unpaid charge-off is considered income. The FCRA prohibits the reporting of income as a debt. This account was reported as a charge-off and therefore should not continue to be listed on my credit report.

Request for Validation : I have requested that the creditor provide a XXXX form to prove that this debt was canceled and should be considered income. However, no such form has been provided, and the account continues to be reported inaccurately. 

Action Requested : I request that the CFPB investigate this matter and direct William Rush & Associates to provide valid documentation supporting their claim or remove this account from my credit report immediately.

If William Rush & Associates is unable to verify the legitimacy of this debt, I demand that the account be removed from all credit reporting agenciesTransUnion, XXXX, and XXXX 30 days of this notice. 

Thank you for your attention to this matter. I look forward to your prompt response. 

Sincerely, XXXX XXXX XXXX Last XXXX Digits of XXXX : XXXX Be sure to include any relevant documents that support your claim when you send this letter.

Product: Mortgage
Consumer complaint narrative:
XX/XX/202XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX I contacted the mortgage division of Bank of America by phone, XXXX to determine the most efficient method of paying off an existing mortgage. 
I had already previously requested and received a mortgage pay-off letter from them. Bank of America Employee, XXXX in XXXX, Employee number XXXX told me that she could transfer the payoff from my savings to the mortgage loan account. 
I agreed and she submitted the payoff of USD XXXX and told me the transaction was complete. 
I requested either a confirmation number or a transaction number. She said she was unable to supply me with either, only her employee number, no last name, and that I would be mailed a letter of satisfaction of mortgage within 3 business days. I stated I was not comfortable with that, and would require verification by either a confirmation number or a transaction number. She referred me to her supervisor, XXXX in XXXX, who refused to give me her employee number, and also refused to provide any documentation of any kind for the transaction. XXXX actually stated that by requesting this type of documentation I was accusing her employees of stealing. I was shocked. 
All I wanted was a confirmation number or even just a transaction number for this HUGE transaction - something, anything that would verify the transaction. I requested to speak to her manager, who was named XXXX. XXXX from XXXX, Employee number XXXX came on the phone and said no, I would not be receiving a confirmation number for this USD XXXX transaction, nor would I receive a transaction number and that I would just have to wait until I received something in the mail. 
When I told her that my online savings account showed only the fact that the XXXX was REMOVED from my savings account as a Debit Hold with no further information about where the money went, she said there was nothing more she could do, but as a courtesy, she would call me the next business morning at XXXX to confirm that my mortgage payoff went through. 
I requested an email verifying the transaction, a screenshot showing the transaction was applied to the mortgage, basically, ANYTHING that would provide a documentation trail. I even mentioned the recent XXXX banking issues as further reason for my worries. She said she could not do anything else. 
I hung up the phone, literally terrified that I could have conceivably just lost over a quarter of a XXXX dollars. It was GONE from my bank account with nothing, no electronic or paper trail to document the mortgage loan payoff.

Terrified, I called my local branch and stayed on hold for over 1 hour but never got to speak with anyone. I hung up and got in my car and drove to my local branch and met with XXXX XXXX, Senior Banker and XXXX XXXX, Assistant Manager and explained the problem. Both agreed that my concern about not having ANY DOCUMENTATION of this transaction was very concerning. They got on the phone with Bank of America headquarters, and the same information was conveyed- there would be nothing given to me to document and verify this transaction ; I would just have to wait several days until I received something in the mail. 
The bank headquarters told them to convey to me that all their phone transactions are recorded and if the money did get lost, they would have a phone recording of the transaction. How that was supposed to help me was never explained. I went home, still in shock and fear that I could conceivably just lost all that money. I never did receive a phone call from XXXX in XXXX. The next morning, XX/XX/XXXX, there was a transaction number next to the USDXXXX withdrawal from my savings, but there was no information to show WHERE all of that money had gone. 
The mortgage loan I had satisfied was no longer showing up on my online account. On XX/XX/XXXX at XXXX I received an email stating Congratulations You've paid off your loan. There were no dollar amounts listed in the letter. There was no confirmation number or transaction number associated with the XXXX that was withdrawn from my savings account to satisfy the mortgage loan. Since there is no actual confirming information in the email, it does not make sense that this would be considered adequate documentation. If you would like a copy of that, I will send it. Please keep in mind, I received it 28 hours AFTER the transaction, yet it was still not adequate documentation of the transaction, since there were no amounts paid showing.

Consumer complaint narrative:
Around first week of XX/XX/XXXX, I applied for a loan at Golden One, but I was not approved. They sent a letter and called to notify me that I'm not approved for my loan application. So I didn't continue with the said loan. Then on XX/XX/XXXX, without my knowledge, Golden One had deposited a check of {$13000.00} on my checking account. One day, around XXXX, I checked my statements and realized that they gave me the loan amount of {$13000.00}. I went to the bank and told them that I do not have any knowledge about the loan amount that was deposited on my account, due the fact that they had already denied my loan application. The money is left untouched in my checking account and not been used for other purposes. Then the monthly payment started on XX/XX/XXXX, which caused the bank to deduct the payment amount. On XX/XX/XXXX, the amount was already low because of the automatic payments. I told them that I didn't make any payment but Golden One said I did. It was automatic and paid for monthly for 3 months. I did not setup any automatic payment because I was not supposed to be approved of the loan. All the automatic payment was setup by the bank. By this time, the remaining balance on the loan was already {$10000.00}. you could see the loan was left untouched and only the automatic payment caused the money to be reduced. I spoked to an investigator and they told me, based on their investigation, they used my voice and my automatic signature from an e-sign. I have attached proof that the money was left untouched until the automatic payment kicked in.
