Product: Checking or savings account
Consumer complaint narrative:
Approx XXXX, my XXXX fathers online access to his bank accts at Fifth Third, was locked. He called in-they asked his personal info to verify him. He was slow to respond and missed a # - was told he could not be verified and he had to visit a branch to resolve. He is on XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXXXXXX XXXX XXXX XXXXXXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXXXXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX. XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX His long-time partner with whom he lives, helps provide care. She assisted in calling back & had trouble hearing the rep. Again they would not unlock since they could not verify him. He was told the only way to unlock it was to come to branch. My father called a 5/3 banker XXXX XXXX in XXXX he knew for 40 yrs and she was not able to help. This is when I got involved. 
I am joint owner on all accts & his Attorney in Fact. I made a phone appt with a branch rep from the XXXX XXXX location in XXXX, NC. I was advised to come to a bank with my POA and to update some info & we would go from there. I made this appt for Sat XXXX. The banker for this appt, XXXX XXXX, called the day prior for more info. He advised that while he is a branch manager, its best to come in on a weekday in case we needed higher authority. 
XXXX, XXXX XXXX made copies of POA & asked me to update my fathers signature card ; I signed his name as Attorney in XXXX. While there, he called the dept ( XXXX ) needed to regain online access. XXXX XXXX told them he had POA in hand, but they stated it had to be uploaded for review. However, the phone rep said that even with the POA, my father still needed to call in to be verified. Phone rep refused to talk with me even though XXXX XXXX was verified as a branch mgr. XXXX XXXX restated my concern, if I have POA I should be able to do anything he would do at the bank. XXXX XXXX requested a manager. We stayed on hold for a long time and then we were told there was no supervisor available to help. XXXX XXXX requested that someone call him back to resolve. XXXX XXXX then told me that he would reach out to me when he had more info. 
After several days, XXXX XXXX told me ( XXXX ) he was unsuccessful, but all paperwork was uploaded & I could get access. Since I am a joint owner, I always had access. My original query and issue were getting my father back his online access. XXXX XXXX told me that my father needed to call that same number. I reiterated that he did this many times and my POA should allow me to act on his behalf. XXXX XXXX was told that was bank policy not to give password info etc. to anyone but the account holder. XXXX XXXX told me that they have noted he is in XXXX, and my father would not need to physically come in and he needed to call back. 
I told this to my father ; he sounded quite with it, so I suggested he call right then. The rep put him on hold and then the line went dead. He called back and tried again. The rep, XXXX was confused about what he needed, and his partner just said 1 word to my father- ONLINE, so that he would tell them it was for online access. The rep said that if he was on speaker phone, they would not help him. He took the phone off speaker as requested & he did perfect in relaying all his personal information to be verified. However, the rep said since someone was in the room with him and he was limited to what he could do on his phone, they would not unlock his online access even though they gave him the account balances with her in the room. My father is not always able to do this on his own. He sometimes needs assistance in dialing # s, etc.

We have gone through all the routes and done what was asked. My complaint is this : I have valid original legal Power of Attorney paperwork stating that I act as his Attorney in Fact for financial matters. They are not following this and not allowing me to act on his behalf. We understand and appreciate customer protection ; however, this is overkill. Thank you.

Product: Checking or savings account
Sub-issue: Funds not received from closed account
Consumer complaint narrative: My son passed away in XXXX and he had funds in Chime. Before XX/XX/XXXX, I contacted Chime 3 times and they told me each time they would send the information to the correct department and they would contact me. They never did. My husband contacted them on XX/XX/XXXX and they did send him an email requesting a picture of his ID and my sons death certificate. I sent that information as requested on XX/XX/XXXX. They sent an automatic email saying they would be in touch within 4 hours or longer if it was outside business hours. They never contacted us. He received emails saying that since he never responded to their requests, they were closing the request. We had not received anything else. Again I called and again had to go through everything with a customer service rep as though nothing was in the account records. Again they said someone would contact us. They told us that a different department handles this type of issue and they had no way to contact them other than email. We never heard from anyone again. On XX/XX/XXXX, I called again I explained I was trying to close my deceased sons account and nothing was being done. The man I spoke to said the account was indeed closed on XX/XX/XXXX and they had the necessary papers. He said he was not able to cut a check but filled out a form and would submit it to get this matter closed. He told me the total check would be for {$390.00}. I was to receive an email but I never did. I called again on XX/XX/XXXX. Again I had to start over snd explain everything. I was told that they would have to send an email to another department because they did not handle this matter. I got really frustrated and angry. The way they were treating me, you would have thought there were millions in this account. No one knows what is happening in that institution. You better hope you get everything handled the first time because it all becomes new information every time you call. I was finally able to get a supervisor who again was no help. Shell send an email to the correct department. I was amazed when I did get an email, however, it was asking me to upload the same documents that I have already send but I sent them again any way. I got my email back saying they would contact me within 4 hours unless it was after regular business which could take longer. That was on XX/XX/XXXX. It is XX/XX/XXXX and I have not heard a word. I replied to the email on XX/XX/XXXX and stated that no one contacted me but to no avail. No one will help with this account. I dont want to deal with my sons accounts at all but I have to. I just want it over.

Product: Credit card
Sub-product: General-purpose credit card or charge card
Consumer complaint narrative:
I requested credit limit after 180 days. I was given a credit limit increase prior to this request on XX/XX/2024. Credit Card company affiliated with XXXX denied my credit limit increase only because there were recent hard inquiries to my account. I disagree that hard inquiries is a bad thing because I was in the process of closing my older credit cards and trying out new promotional credit cards. I closed out previous VISA credit cards upon the promotional period ending and I started to open a new credit card with Master Card per Goldman Sachs Bank USA. Apple as part of Goldman Sachs Bank USA is now wrongfully declining a new credit limit increase only because they wrongfully assumed the hard inquiries were a bad thing but where there is no actual concern for these hard inquiries as if I have bad credit history. 

Any hard inquiries do not showcase as negative understandings as if I have poor credit history. I believe my credit history showcases good credit and that the denial of a credit increase by Goldman Sachs Bank USA should be corrected as to allow a better review of XXXX credit report or other credit agency as to reflect good credit history regardless of any inquiries on the account. Inquiries are likely due to closing promotional credit cards only with a XXXX bank but have nothing to do with the good credit history of the consumer. Goldman Sachs Bank USA would wrongfully decline a credit limit increase as part of a XXXX credit report where the recent inquiries only showcase a closure of old credit cards more so and VISA promotional credit cards could not be reopened as to have to wait XXXX to reopen a new promotional credit card with a XXXX bank. Thus, any hard inquiries were likely due to the closure of promotional credit cards and having to wait to reopen promotional credit cards with the same bank as if XXXX cards belonging to the same bank are synced as if the customer is only allowed XXXX promotional credit card every XXXX years ( which was not defined because XXXX bank assumes you are a new credit card holder upon application of a new credit card, but does not recognize the previous customer history of the older credit card as if to be allowed to switch credit card promotions and end old promotional cards such resulting in hard inquiries as if I am wrongfully assumed as a new credit card customer ). 

I am challenging the denial of the credit limit increase per my active Apple credit card where the hard inquiries are not always indicative of requesting new credit card application ( as if I were an older customer switching out credit cards promotions ) and was more so the closure of old promotional credit cards and not being allowed new promotional credit cards with the same XXXX Bank only due to the XXXX waiting limit on a new promotional credit card per VISA which can result in a hard inquiry as if I am a new customer rather than a previous customer. This does not reflect any negative understandings of credit to the consumer but should be recognized as a XXXX credit card application glitch ( error ) more so as if to say this is a loyalty credit card glitch producing a hard inquiry ( instead of soft inquiry ) as to wrongfully harm the consumer ( previous customer per promotional credit card ) upon switching to a new promotional credit card per application of a new promotion only : " Your XXXX credit report shows you've made multiple recent applications for credit, which have resulted in hard inquiries on your credit file ''

Product: Credit card
Sub-product: General-purpose credit card or charge card
Consumer complaint narrative:
On Saturday XX/XX/XXXX, I contacted Discover Financial Services regarding my outstanding credit card balance. During this conversation, I requested three things : 1. A copy of the cardmember agreement. 
2. A settlement offer for 25 % of the total outstanding balance.

3. Proof of debt beyond just statements, which would include a detailed breakdown of the debt and any related fees.

The supervisor I spoke to rejected my request for a settlement without providing any explanation, simply stating, No. They did, however, agree to send me the cardmember agreement.

When I requested proof of debt, the supervisor argued that the monthly statements constituted sufficient proof of debt and that my payments on the account implied my acceptance of the debt. I explained that I only continued making payments to protect my credit score, not as an acknowledgment of the debts accuracy.

Additionally, I was told that Discover would only consider a settlement if my account were to go 120+ days delinquent or if the account were to be sent to a law office. I find this approach unreasonable as it encourages customers to deliberately default on their debts, which would harm their credit.
Company: CAPITAL ONE, NATIONAL ASSOCIATION - GREENWOOD DELAWARE BRANCH

Product: Credit reporting or other personal consumer reports
Sub-issue: Reporting company used your report improperly
Consumer complaint narrative:
I am writing to formally dispute the reporting of an account on my consumer report. This account has been inaccurately and misleadingly reported by the original creditor despite the transfer to a subsequent purchaser of the debt, in clear violation of the Fair Credit Reporting Act ( FCRA ) and other applicable regulations. I am demanding the immediate deletion of this account from my credit report. 

The creditor has continued to report the account as " charged off '' every month, despite showing the balance as fully paid off and transferred to another lender. 
This is misleading and inaccurate. A charge-off is typically reported once, reflecting that the creditor has deemed the debt uncollectible and written it off. Continuous reporting of the charge-off each month, especially after the debt has been transferred or sold, is considered misleading and inaccurate under the FCRA. This is a clear violation of 15 U.S. Code 1681s-2 ( a ), which mandates that furnishers report only accurate and complete information. The ongoing monthly reporting of a charge-off is both false and deceptive when the account is no longer under the original creditor 's ownership.

The new lender has also been reporting the same debt as " charged off and in collections. '' This results in double reporting of the same debt, creating the false appearance that two separate charge-offs exist. This duplicative reporting is extremely damaging to my credit score and financial standing and violates the FCRAs requirement for accuracy under 15 U.S. Code 1681e ( b ). Both entities reporting the same debt as a charge-off is misleading and unfair, as it artificially inflates the severity of the accounts impact on my credit report. 

The inaccurate reporting of this account has had a profound and negative impact on my overall financial standing. Due to this duplicative and misleading reporting, I have been denied multiple credit opportunities, including credit cards, loans, and other financial products. These denials have harmed my ability to manage my financial affairs, contributing to unnecessary financial stress and losses. 

The creditors continuous inaccurate reporting is an intentional, negligent, defamatory, and unlawful FCRA violation. 
Therefore I demand that the following actions be taken immediately : 1. Complete and permanent deletion of the account from my consumer report 2. A written confirmation from your agency that this account has been fully deleted from my consumer report. 3. Compensation for damages due to the negative impact this reporting has had on my financial standing, including but not limited to a check payable to XXXX XXXX in the minimum amount of {$1000.00} for each violation, as authorized under 15 U.S.

Code 1692k for FDCPA violations and 15 U.S. Code 1681n for the following violations listed below including but not limited to : 15 U.S. Code 1681s-2 ( a ) Duty to Provide Accurate Information : The original creditor is in violation of this provision by reporting the account as " charged off '' after it was fully paid off and transferred. The debt has been discharged from their ownership, and they no longer have the legal right to report it as an active liability.

15 U.S. Code 1681e ( b ) Accuracy of Consumer Report Information : Credit reporting agencies have a legal duty to ensure maximum possible accuracy of the information reported. Allowing both the original creditor and the purchaser of the debt to report charge-offs for the same account leads to inaccurate and duplicative reporting. This has led to significant negative consequences for my creditworthiness, resulting in unfair denials of credit opportunities.

Unfair and Deceptive Practices : Reporting this debt in a manner that falsely suggests multiple charge-offs is both unfair and deceptive. This is a violation of consumer protection laws prohibiting unfair and deceptive acts and practices ( UDAP ). 

I demand swift resolution of this matter within 30 days from this report.

Consumer complaint narrative:
Complaint against TransUnion : I am experiencing ongoing issues with TransUnion 's website that prevent me from accessing my account and utilizing their free credit freeze services. Specifically : The website consistently fails to recognize my valid username and password. 
After resetting my password as prompted, the login page remains non-functional. 
The online chat service only provides automated responses and does not connect me to a human agent for assistance. 
I have had to fix my username and password multiple times in previous years, indicating a recurring issue. 
These technical problems are preventing me from thawing my credit for free, a service TransUnion is required to provide. 
I have followed all troubleshooting steps provided by TransUnion, but the issues persist. The difficulty in accessing the free credit freeze services, contrasted with the availability of paid services, appears to be an unethical practice. 

These ongoing website malfunctions are causing significant inconvenience and potentially harming my ability to manage my credit effectively. I believe this may violate consumer protection laws that require credit bureaus to provide free and accessible credit freeze services.
